 1.35.28. Ic wene, cwæð Orosius, þæt nan wis mon ne sie,
buton he genoh geare wite þætte God þone ærestan monn ryhtne &
godne gesceop, & eal monncynn mid him.
 1.35.30. Ond for þon þe he þæt god forlet þe him geseald
wæs, & wyrse geceas, hit God siþþan longsumlice wrecende wæs,
ærest on him selfum, & siþþan on his bearnum gind ealne þisne
middangeard mid monigfealdum brocum & gewinnum, ge eac þas eorþan, þe
ealle cwice wyhta bi libbað, ealle hiere wæstmbæro he gelytlade.
 1.36.5. Nu we witan þæt ure Dryhten us gesceop; we witon eac
þæt he ure reccend is, & us mid ryhtlicran lufan lufað þonne
ænig mon.
 1.36.7. Nu we witon þæt ealle onwealdas from him sindon; we
witon eac þæt ealle ricu sint from him, for þon ealle onwealdas of rice
sindon.
 1.36.9. Nu he þara læssena rica reccend is, hu micle swiþor
wene we þæt he ofer þa maran sie, þe on swa unmetlican onwealdum
ricsedon.
 1.36.12. An wæs Babylonicum, þær Ninus ricsade; þæt
oðer wæs Creca, þær Alexander ricsade; þridda wæs Affricanum,
þær/ Ptolome ricsedon; se feorða is Romane, þe giet ricsiende sindon.
 1.36.14. Þas feower heafodricu sindon on feower endum þyses
middangeardes, mid unasecgendlicre Godes tacnunge.
 1.36.16. Þæt Babylonicum wæs þæt forme, & on
easteweardum; þæt æfterre wæs þæt Crecisce, & on
norðeweardum; þæt þridde wæs þæt Affricanum, & on
suðweardum; þæt feorþe is Romane, & on westeweardum.
 1.36.19. Babylonisce þæt æreste & Romane þæt
siðmeste hie wæron swa fæder & sunu, þonne hie heora willan moton
wel wealdan.
 1.36.21. Þæt Crecisce & þæt Affricanisce wæron
swa swa hie him hiersumedon, & him underþieded wære.
 1.36.23. Þæt ic wille eac gescadwislecor gesecgean, þæt
hit mon geornor ongietan mæge.
 1.36.25. Se æresta cyning wæs Ninus haten, swa we ær
beforan sægden.
 1.36.26. Þa hiene mon ofslog, þa feng Sameramis his cwen to
þæm rice, & getimbrede þa burg Babylonie, to þon þæt heo
wære heafod ealra Asiria; & hit fela wintra siþþan on þæm stod,
oð ðæt Arbatus, Meþa ealdormon, Sardanopolum Babylonia cyning ofslog.
 1.36.29. Þa wearð Babylonia & Asiria anwald geendad, &
gehwearf on Meðas.
 1.36.31. On þæm ilcan geare þe þiss wæs, Procos,
Numetores fæder, ongon ricsian in Italia þæm londe, þær eft
Romeburg getimbred wearð.
 1.36.33. Se Procos wæs Numetores fæder & Mulieses, &
wæs Siluian eam.
 1.37.1. Seo Siluie wæs Remuses modor & Romules, þe
Romeburg getimbredon.
 1.37.2. Ðæt wille ic gecyþan, þæt þa ricu of nanes
monnes mihtum swa gecræftgade ne wurdon, ne for nanre wyrde buton from Godes
gestihtunge.
 1.37.5. Ealle stærwriteras secgað þæt Asiria rice æt
Ninuse begunne, & Romana rice æt Procose begunne.
 1.37.6. From ðæm ærestan geare Ninuses rices oðþæt
Babylonia burg getimbred wæs, wæron lxiiii wintra; eac of ðæm ilcan
geare þe Procos ricsade in Italia wæron eac swilce lxiiii wintra, ær
mon Romeburg getimbrede.
 1.37.9. Þy ilcan geare þe Romana rice weaxan ongann ond
miclian, on Procos dæge þæs cyninges, þy ilcan geare gefeoll
Babylonia & eall Asiria rice & hiora anwald, æfter þæm ðe mon
heora cyning ofslog Sardanopolum.
 1.37.13. Siþþan hæfdon Caldei þa lond gebun on freodome,
þe nihst þære byrig wæron, þeh þe Mæðe hæfden þone
anwald ofer hie, oðþæt Cirus, Persea cyning, ricsian ongann, & ealle
Babylonia aweste, & ealle Asirie & ealle Mæþe on Persa anwald
gedyde.
 1.37.16. Þæt þa swa gelomp, ðætte on þære ilcan
tide þe Babylonia ðiowdome onfeng from Ciruse ðæm cyninge, þætte
Roma aliesed wearð of þeowdome þara unryhtwisestana cyninga & þara
ofermodgestana, þe mon hæt Tarcuinie; & ða ðæt eastrice in
Asiria gefeoll, þa eac þæt westrice in Roma aras.
 1.37.22. Giet scæl ic, cwæð Orosius, monigfealdlecor
sprecan wiþ þa þe secgað þæt þa anwaldas sien of wyrda
mægenum gewordene, nales of Godes gestihtunge, hu emnlice hit gelomp ymb
ðas tu heofodricu, Asiria & Romana, swa swa we ær sægdon,
þætte Ninus ricsade on ðon eastrice lii wintra, & æfter him his
cwen Sameramis xlii wintra, & on middeweardum hire rice hio getimbrede
Babylonia þa burg.
 1.37.28. From þæm geare þe heo getimbred wearð, wæs
hire anwald m wintra & c & lx & folnæh feower, ær hio hiere
anwaldes benumen wurde & beswicen from Arbate hiere agnum ealdormenn &
Meþa cyninge; þeh þe siðþan ymbe þa burg lytle hwile freodom
wære buton onwalde, swa we ær sægdon, from Caldei þæm leodum.
 1.37.33. Swa eac swilce wearð Romeburg ymb m wintra & c &
lx & folneah feower, þætte Alrica hiere ealdormon & Gotona cyning
hiere onwaldes hie beniman woldon; & heo hwæðere onwealg on hiere
onwalde æfter þurhwunade.
 1.38.2. Þeh þe ægþer þissa burga þurh Godes
diegelnessa þus getacnod wurde: ærest Babylonia þurh hiere agenne
ealdormon, þa he hiere cyning beswac; swa eac Roma, þa hi hiere agen
ealdormonn & Gotona cyning hiere anwaldes beniman woldon, hit þeh God for
heora cristendome ne geþafode, naþer ne for heora caseras ne for heora
selfra, ac hie nugiet ricsiende sindon ægþer ge mid hiera cristendome ge
mid hiora anwalde ge mid hiera caserum.
 1.38.10. Þis ic sprece nu for ðæm þe ic wolde þæt
þa ongeaten, þe þa tida ures cristendomes leahtriað, hwelc mildsung
siþþan wæs, siþþan se cristendom wæs; & hu monigfeald
wolbærnes ðære worulde ær þæm wæs; & eac þæt hie
oncnewen hu gelimplice ure God on þæm ærran tidum þa anwaldas &
þa ricu sette, se ilca se þe giet settende is & wendende ælce
onwaldas & ælc rice to his willan.
 1.38.16. Hu gelice onginn þa twa byrg hæfdon, & hu gelice
heora dagas wæron, ægðer ge on ðæm gode ge on ðæm yfele.
 1.38.17. Ac hiora anwalda endas wæron swiþe ungelice; for
þon þe Babylonie mid monigfealdum unryhtum & firenlustum mid heora
cyninge buton ælcre hreowe libbende wæran, þæt hie hit na gebetan
noldan, ær þon hie God mid þæm mæstan bismere geeaðmedde, þa
he hie ægðres benam ge heora cyninges ge heora anwaldes; ac Romane mid
hiora cristnan cyninge Gode þeowiende wæron, þætte he him for
þæm ægþres geuþe, ge hiora cyninges ge heora anwaldes.
 1.38.25. For þæm magan hiora spræce gemetgian þa þe
þæs cristendomes wiþerflitan sint, gif hie gemunan willað hiora
ieldrena unclænessa, & heora wolgewinna, & hiora monigfealdan
unsibbe, & hiora unmiltsunge þe hie to gode hæfdon, ge eac him selfum
betweonum; ðæt hie nane mildheortnesse þurhteon ne mehtan, ær
þæm him seo bot of ðæm cristendome com, þe hie nu swiþost
tælað.
 2.38.31. Ymb feower hunde wintra & ymb feowertig þæs þe
Troia Creca burg awested wæs, wearð Romeburg getimbred from twam
gebroðrum, Remuse & Romuluse.
 2.39.2. & raðe æfter Romulus hiora anginn geunclænsade
mid his broðor slege, & eac siþþan mid his hiwunge & his
geferena: hwelce bisena he ðær stellende wæs, mid þæm þe hie
bædon Sabini þa burgware þætte hi him geuðen hiora dohtra him to
wifum to habbanne, & hie him þara bena forwierndon.
 2.39.6. Hi swaþeah heora unðances mid swicdome hie begeaton,
mid þæm þe hie bædon þæt hie him fylstan mosten ðæt hie
hiera godum þe ieð blotan mehten: þa hie him þæs getygðedon, þa
hæfdon hi him to wifum, & heora fæderum eft agiefan noldon.
 2.39.10. Ymb þæt wearð þæt mæste gewinn monig gear,
oð hie fornæh mid ealle forslægene & forwordene wæron on
ægþere healfe, þæt hie mid nanum þinge ne mehton gesemede
weroþan, ær þara Romana wif mid heora cildum iernende wæron gemong
ðæm gefeohtum, & heora fæderum wæron to fotum feallende, &
biddende þæt hie for þara cilda lufan þæs gewinnes sumne ende
gedyden.
 2.39.16. Swa weorðlice & swa mildelice wæs Romeburg on
fruman gehalgod, mid broðor blode, & mid sweora, & mid Romuluses
eames/ Numetores, þone he eac ofslog, ða he cyning wæs, & him self
siþþan to ðæm rice feng.
 2.39.19. Þuss gebletsade Romulus Romana rice on fruman: mid his
broðor blode þone weall, & mid þara sweora blode þa ciricean, &
mid his eames blode þæt rice.
 2.39.22. Ond siþþan his agenne sweor to deaðe beswac, þa he
hiene to him aspon, & him gehet ðæt he his rice wið hiene dælan
wolde, & hiene under ðæm ofslog.
 2.39.25. He þa Romulus æfter þiosan underfeng Cirinen gewinn
þara burgwarana, for þon þe he þagiet lytel landrice hæfde buton
þære byrig anre, for þon þe Romulus & ealle Romware oþerum
folcum unweorðe wæran, for þon ðe hie on cnihthade wæron oþerra
manna niedlingas.
 2.39.29. Þa hie ða hæfdon Cirinensa þa burg ymbseten,
& ðær micelne hungor þoliende wæron, þa gecwædan hie
þæt him leofre wære þæt hie on ðæm iermþum heora lif
geendodon þonne hie ðæt gewinn forleten, oððe frið genamen.
 2.39.32. Hie ðær þa winnende wæron oð hie þa burg
abræcon, & æfter þæm wið þa londleode on ælce healfe
unablinnendlice winnende wæron, oð hie ðærymbutan hæfdon monega
byrig begietena.
 2.40.1. Ac þa cyningas þe æfter Romuluse ricsedon wæron
forcuðran & eargran þonne he wære, & þæm folcum laðran
& ungetæsran, oð þætte Tarcuinius, ðe we ær ymbe sædon,
þe hira eallra fracoþast wæs, ægþer ge eargast, ge wrænast, ge
ofermodgast, ealra þara Romana wif ða þe he mehte he to geligre
geniedde, & his suna geþafode þæt he læg mid Latinus wife,
Lucrettie hatte, Brutuses sweostor, þa heo on firde wæron, ðeh þe
hie Romana bremuste wæron to ðæm cyninge.
 2.40.8. Heo ða Lucretie hi selfe for þæm acwealde.
 2.40.9. Ða þæt Latinus hiere wer geascade, & Brutus
hiere broðor, þa forleton hie ða firde þe hie bewitan sceoldan, &
þa hie ham comon, þa adræfdon hie ægðer ge þone cyning, ge his
sunu, ge ealle þa þe þær cynecynnes wæron of þy rice mid ealle.
 2.40.12. Him ða Romane æfter þæm ladteowas gesetton, þe
hie consulas heton, þæt heora rice heolde an gear an monn.
 3.40.15. Æfter þæm þe Romeburg getimbred wæs ii hunde
wintrum & iiii, þætte Brutus wæs se forma consul.
 3.40.16. Romulus heora forma cyning & Brutus heora forma consul
wordon emnreðe.
 3.40.17. Romulus slog his broðor, & his eam, & his
sweor.
 3.40.18. Brutus slog his ii suna & his wifes twegen broðor,
for þon þe hie spræcon ðæt hit betere wære þætte Romane eft
heora cynecynne onfengen, swa hie ær hæfdon; for þæm he hie het
gebindan, & beforan eallum þæm folce mid besman swingan, &
siþþan mid æxsum heora heafda of aceorfan.
 3.40.23. Tarcuinius þa, ðe ær Romana cyning wæs, aspon
Tuscea cyning him on fultum, Porsenna wæs haten, þæt he ðe ieð
mehte winnan wið Brutuse & wið eallum Romanum.
 3.40.25. He ða Brutus gecwæð anwig wið þone cyning ymb
heora feondscipe; ac him Tarcuinius oðerne ðegn ongean sende, Arrunses sunu
ðæs ofermodgan, & heora þær ægðer oðerne ofslog.
 3.40.29. Æfter þæm Porsenna & Tarcuinius þa cyningas
ymbsæton Romeburg, & hie eac begeaton, þær Mutius nære, an monn
of ðære byrig: he hi mid his wordum geegsade.
 3.41.2. Ða hie hiene gefengon, ða pinedon hie hiene mid
þæm þæt hie his hand forbærndon, anne finger & anne, &
hiene secgan heton, hu fela þæra manna wære þe wið þæm cyninge
Tarcuinie swiðost wiðsacen hæfde.
 3.41.5. Þa he ðæt secgean nolde, þa acsedon hie hine hu
fela þær swelcerra manna wære swelce he wæs.
 3.41.7. Þa sægde he him ðæt ðær fela þara monna
wære/, & eac gesworen hæfdon ðæt hie oþer forleosan woldon,
oþþe hira agen lif, oþþe Porsennes þæs cyninges.
 3.41.9. Þa þæt þa Porsenna gehierde, he ðæt setl
& þæt gewin mid ealle forlet, þe he ær þreo winter dreogende
wæs.
 4.41.12. Æfter þæm wæs þæt Sabinisce gewinn, &
him Romane þæt swiðe ondrædende wæron, & him gesetton hiran
ladteow þonne hiera consul wære, þone ðe hie tictatores heton, &
hie mid þæm tictatore micelne sige hæfdon.
 4.41.15. Æfter þæm Romane betux him selfum, þa rican menn
& þa earmran, micel gewinn upahofon, & him ðæt to longsumere
wrace come, þær hie ðe raðor gesemed ne wurden.
 4.41.18. On þæm dagum wæron þa mæstan ungetina on
Romanum, ægðer ge on hungre ge on moncwealme, under þæm twæm
consulum, Tita & Publia hatton.
 4.41.20. & hie heora gefeohta þa hwile hie gerestan, þeh
hie þæs hungres & þæs moncwealmes ne mehte, ac þa monigfealdan
iermþo þa werigan burg swiþe brociende wæran.
 4.41.23. Ær ðæm þe seo wol geendod wære, Ueigentes
& Etrusci þa leode wið Romanum gewinn upahofon, & wið þæm
twæm consulum, Marcuse & Grease.
 4.41.25. & þa Romane him ongean foran, & him betweonum
aþas gesworan þæt hiera nan nolde eft eard gesecan buton hie sige
hæfden.
 4.41.27. Þær wæron Romane swa swiþe forslægene, þeh
hie sige hæfden, þæt heora an consul þe him to lafe wearð forsoc
þone triumphan, þe him mon ongean brohte þa he hamweard wæs, &
sæde þæt hie hæfden bet gewyrht þæt him mon mid heafe ongean
come þonne mid triumphan.
 4.42.1. Þæt hie triumphan heton, þæt wæs þonne hie
hwelc folc mid gefeohte ofercumen hæfdon, þonne wæs heora þeaw
þæt sceoldon ealle hiera senatus cuman ongean heora consulas æfter
þæm gefeohte, siex mila from ðære byrig, mid crætwæne, mid
golde & mid gimstanum gefrætwedum, & hie sceoldon bringan
feowerfetes twa hwit.
 4.42.6. Þonne hie hamweard foran, þonne sceoldon hiera senatus
ridan on crætwænum wiðæftan þæm consulum, & þa menn
beforan him drifan gebundene þe þær gefongene wæron, ðæt heora
mærþa sceoldon þy þrymlicran beon.
 4.42.9. Ac þonne hie hwelc folc buton gefeohte on heora geweald
genieddon, þonne hie hamweard wæron, þonne sceolde him man bringan
ongean of þære byrig crætwæn, se wæs mid siolfre gegiered, &
ælces cynnes feowerfetes feos an, hiora consulum to mærþe.
 4.42.13. Þæt wæs þonne triumpheum.
 4.42.14. Romulus gesette ærest monna senatum: ðæt wæs,
an hund monna, þeh heora æfter fyrste wære þreo hund.
 4.42.15. Þa wæron simbel binnan Romebyrg wuniende, to þon
þæt hie heora rædþeahteras wæron & consulas setton, &
þæt ealle Romane him hirsumeden, & þæt hie bewisten eal þæt
licgende feoh under anum hrofe þæt hie begeaton oþþe on gafole
oþþe on hergiunga, þæt hie hit siþþan mehten him eallum
gemænelice to nytte gedon, þæm þe þær buton þeowdome
wæron.
 4.42.22. Þa consulas þe on ðæm dagum þæt Sabinisce
gewinn underfengon, þe mon het eall hiera cynn Fabiane, for þon hit ealra
Romana ænlicost wæs & cræftegast.
 4.42.24. Nu giet todæge hit is on leoðum sungen hwelcne demm
hie Romanum gefeollan.
 4.42.25. Eac þæm monega ea sindon be noman nemnede for
þæm gefeohte, & eac þa geata þe hie ut of Romebyrig to þæm
gefeohte ferdon him mon ascop þa noman þe hie giet habbað.
 4.42.28. Æfter þæm Romane curon iii hund cempena &
siex, þæt sceolde to anwige gangan wið swa fela Sabina, & getruwedon
þæt hie mid hiera cræftum sceolden sige gefeohtan.
 4.42.30. Ac Sabini mid heora searwum hie ealle þær ofslogon
buton anum, se þæt laðspel æt ham gebodade.
 4.42.32. Næs na on Romanum anum, ac swa hit an scopleoðum
sungen is þæt gind ealne middangeard wære caru & gewin & ege.
 4.43.1. Cirus, Persa cyning, þe we ær beforan sægdon, þa
hwile ðe Sabini & Romane wunnon on þæm westdæle, þa hwile wonn
he ægþer ge on Sciþþie ge on Indie, oþ he hæfde mæst ealne
þone eastdæl awest; & æfter ðæm fird gelædde to Babylonia,
þe þa welegre wæs þonne ænigu oþeru burg.
 4.43.5. Ac hiene Gandes seo ea þæs oferfæreldes longe
gelette, for þæm þe þær scipa næron: þæt is ealra ferscra
wætera mæst buton Eufrate.
 4.43.7. Þa gebeotode an his ðegna þæt he mid sunde þa ea
oferfaran wolde, mid twam tyncenum; ac hiene se stream fordraf.
 4.43.9. Ða gebeotode Cirus ðæt he his ðegn on hire swa
gewrecan wolde, þa he swa grom wearð on his mode & wiþ þa ea
gebolgen, þæt hie mehte wifmon be hiere cneowe oferwadan, þær heo
ær wæs nigon mila brad þonne heo fledu wæs.
 4.43.13. He þæt mid dædum gelæste, & hie upp forlet
an feower hund ea & on lx, & siþþan mid his firde þær
oferfor.
 4.43.14. & æfter þæm Eufrate þa ea, seo is mæst
eallra ferscra wætera, & is irnende þurh middewearde Babylonia burg,
he hie eac mid gedelfe on monige ea upp forlet, & siþþan mid eallum his
folce on ðære ea gong on þa burg færende wæs, & hie gerahte.
 4.43.19. Swa ungeliefedlic is ænigum menn þæt to
gesecgenne, hu ænig mon mehte swelce burg gewyrcan swelce sio wæs,
oðþe eft abrecan.
 4.43.21. Membrað se ent angan ærest timbran Babylonia, &
Ninus se cyning æfter him; & Sameramis his cwen hie geendade æfter
him on middeweardum hiere rice.
 4.43.23. Seo burg wæs getimbred an fildum lande & on swiþe
emnum, & heo wæs swiþe fæger an to locianne; & heo is swiþe
ryhte feowerscyte; & þæs wealles micelness & fæstness is
ungeliefedlic to secgenne: þæt is, þæt he is l elna brad, & ii
hund elna heah, & his ymbgong is hundseofontig mila & seofeða dæl
anre mile, & he is geworht of tigelan & of eorðtyrewan, & ymbutan
þone weall is se mæsta dic, on þæm is iernende se ungefoglecesta
stream; & wiðutan þæm dice is geworht twegea elna heah weall, &
bufan ðæm maran wealle ofer ealne þone ymbgong he is mid stænenum
wighusum beworht.
 4.43.33. Seo ilce burg Babylonia, seo ðe mæst wæs &
ærest ealra burga, seo is nu læst & westast.
 4.43.34. Nu seo burg swelc is, þe ær wæs ealra weorca
fæstast & wunderlecast & mærast, gelice & heo wære to
bisene asteald eallum middangearde, & eac swelce heo self sprecende sie to
eallum moncynne, & cweþe: Nu ic þuss gehroren eam & aweg gewiten,
hwæt, ge magan on me ongietan & oncnawan þæt ge nanuht mid eow
nabbað fæstes ne stronges þætte þurhwunigean mæge.
 4.44.7. On ðæm dagum þe Cirus Persa cyning Babylonia
abræc, ða wæs Croesus se liþa cyning mid firde gefaren Babylonium to
fultume; ac þa he wiste þæt hie him on nanum fultome beon ne mæhte,
& þæt seo burg abrocen wæs, he him hamweard ferde to his agnum
rice.
 4.44.11. & him Cirus wæs æfterfylgende, oþ he hiene
gefeng, & ofslog.
 4.44.12. Ond nu ure Cristne Roma bespricð þæt hiere wealles
for ealdunge brosnien, nales na for þæm þe hio mid forheriunge swa
gebismrad wære swa Babylonia wæs; ac heo for hiere cristendome nugiet is
gescild, ðæt ægþer ge hio self ge hiere anweald is ma hreosende for
ealddome þonne of æniges cyninges niede.
 4.44.17. Æfter þæm Cirus gelædde fird on Sciþþie,
& him ðær an giong cyning mid firde ongean for, & his modor mid
him Damaris.
 4.44.18. Þa Cirus for ofer þæt londgemære, ofer þa ea
þe hatte Araxis, him þær se gionga cyning þæs oferfæreldes
forwiernan mehte; ac he for þæm nolde þy he mid his folce getruwade
ðæt he hiene beswican mehte, siþþan he binnan ðæm gemære
wære, & wicstowa name.
 4.44.23. Ac þa Cirus geahsade þæt hiene se gionga cyning
þær secean wolde, & eac þæt þæm folce seldsiene &
uncuðe wæron wines dryncas, he for þæm of ðære wicstowe afor on
ane digle stowe, & þær beæftan forlet eall þæt þær
liðes wæs & swetes; þæt þa se gionga cyning swiðor micle
wenende wæs þæt hie þonon fleonde wæren þonne hie ænigne
swicdom cyþan dorsten.
 4.44.28. Þa hie hit þær swa æmenne metton, hie ðær
þa mid micelre bliðnesse buton gemetgunge þæt win drincende wæron,
oð hi heora selfra lytel geweald hæfdon.
 4.44.31. He þa Cirus hie þær besyrede & mid ealle
ofslog; & siþþan wæs farende þær ðæs cyninges modor mid
þæm twæm dælum þæs folces wuniende wæs, þa he þone
ðriddan dæl mid ðæm cyninge beswicen hæfde.
 4.44.34. Hio þa seo cwen Dameris mid micelre gnornunge ymb
þæs cyninges slege hiere suna þencende wæs, hu heo hit gewrecan
mehte; & þæt eac mid dædum gelæste, & hiere folc on tu
todælde, ægþer ge wifmen ge wæpnedmen, for þon þe þær
wifmenn feohtað swa same swa wæpnedmen.
 4.45.2. Hio mid þæm healfan dæle beforan þæm cyninge
farende wæs, swelce heo fleonde wære, oð hio hiene gelædde on an
micel slæd, & se healfa dæl wæs Ciruse æfterfylgende.
 4.45.5. Þær wearþ Cirus ofslægen, & twa þusend
monna mid him.
 4.45.6. Seo cwen het þa ðæm cyninge þæt heafod of
aceorfan, & beweorpan on anne cylle, se wæs afylled monnes blodes, &
þus cwæð: þu þe þyrstende wære monnes blodes xxx wintra, drync
nu þine fylle.
 5.45.10. Æfter þæm þe Romeburg getimbred wæs twa hunde
wintra & iiiix, þætte Cambisis feng to Persa rice, Ciruses sunu, se,
mid þon þe he Egypte oferwon, gedyde þæt nan hæþen cyning ær
gedon ne dorste, þæt wæs þæt he heora godgieldum eallum wiðsoc,
& hie æfter þæm mid ealle towearp.
 5.45.15. Æfter him ricsade Darius, se awende ealle Asiriæ
& Caldei eft to Perseum, þe ær from him gebogene wæron.
 5.45.16. Æfter þæm he wonn on Sciþþie, ægþer ge
for Ciruses slege þæs cyninges, his mæges, ge eac for þæm þe him
mon/ ðær wifes forwiernde.
 5.45.18. His heres wæs seofon hund þusenda, þa he on
Sciðþie for.
 5.45.19. Hwæþere ða Sciþþie noldon hiene gesecan to
folcgefeohte, ac þonne hie gind þæt lond tofarene wæron, hie þonne
hie floccmælum slogan.
 5.45.21. Þa wæron ða Perse mid þæm swiþe geegsade,
& eac ondredon þæt mon þa brycge forwyrcan wolde þe æt þæm
gemære wæs, þæt hie siþþan nysten hu hie þonan comen.
 5.45.24. He þa se cyning, æfter ðæm þe his folc swiþe
forslægen wæs, þær forlet hundeahtatig þusenda beæftan him,
þæt hie ðær þagiet leng winnan sceoldon, & he self þonan
gewat on þa læssan Asiam, & hie forhergeade; & siþþan on
Mæcedoniam, & on Ionas Creca leode, & þa hie butu oferhergeade;
& for siððan firr an Crecas, & gewin upp ahof wið Athenienses,
for þæm hie mæcedoniam on fultume wæron.
 5.45.30. Sona swa Atheniense wiston þæt Darius hie mid
gefeohte secan wolde, hie acuron endlefan þusend monna, & him ongean
foran, & þone cyning æt ðære dune metton þe mon hætt
Morotthome.
 5.45.33. Heora ladteow wæs haten Htesseus; se wæs mid his
dædum snelra þonne he mægenes hæfde; se geworhte micelne dom on
ðæm gefeohte.
 5.46.3. Þa wearð tu hund þusenda Persea ofslægen, &
þa oþre gefliemed.
 5.46.4. Þa he eft hæfde fird gegaderod on Perseum, &
þæt wrecan þohte, þa gefor he.
 5.46.6. Æfter him feng his sunu to Persea rice Xersis.
 5.46.6. Þæt gewinn þæt his fæder astealde he
diegellice for þæm v gear scipa worhte, ond fultum gegaderode.
 5.46.8. Þa wæs mid him an wræccea of Læcedamania, Creca
byrg, se wæs haten Damerað, se þæt facn to his cyþþe gebodade,
& hit on anum brede awrat, & siþþan mid weaxe beworhte.
 5.46.11. Xersis, þa he an Crecas for, hæfde his agenes folces
viii c þusenda, & he hæfde of oþerum þeodum abeden iiii c m; &
he hæfde scipa, þara miclena dulmuna, an m & ii hund, & þara
scipa wæron iii m þe hiora mete bæran; & ealles his heres wæs
swelc ungemet þæt mon eaðe cweþan mehte ðæt hit wundor wære,
hwær hie landes hæfden þæt hie mehten an gewician, oþþe
wæteres þæt hie mehten him þurst of adrincan.
 5.46.17. Swa þeah seo ungemetlice mengeo þæs folces wæs
þa ieðre to oferwinnanne þonne heo us sie nu to gerimanne oþþe to
geliefanne.
 5.46.20. Leoniða, Læcedemonia cyning, Creca byrg, hæfde
iiii þusend monna, þa he angean Xersis for on anum nearwan londfæstenne,
& him þær mid gefeohte wiðstod.
 5.46.22. Xersis þæt oþer folc swa swiðe forseah, þæt
he ascade, hwæt sceolde æt swa lytlum weorode mara fultum, buton þa ane
þe him þær ær abolgen wæs on ðæm ærran gefeohte,
þætte wæs on Merothonia þære dune.
 5.46.25. Ac gesette þa men on ænne truman þe mon hiora
mægas ær on ðæm londe slog, & wiste þæt hie woldon
geornfulran beon þære wrace þonne oþere men, & hie swa wæron
oð hie þær mæst ealle ofslægene wurdon.
 5.46.29. Xersis, swiþe him þa ofþyncendum þæt his folc
swa forslagen wæs, he self þa þærto for mid eallum þæm mægene
þe he ðærto gelædan mehte, & þær feohtende wæron iii
dagas, oþ þara Persea wæs ungemetlic wæl geslægen.
 5.46.32. He het þa þæt fæste lond utan ymbfaran, þæt
him mon sceolde an ma healfa on feohtan þonne on ane.
 5.46.34. Leoniþa þæt þa geascade þæt hiene mon swa
beþridian wolde.
 5.46.35. He þonan afor, & his fierd gelædde on an oþer
fæstre land, & þær gewunedon oþ niht.
 5.47.1. & him from afaran het ealla þa burgware þe he of
oðerum londe him to fultome abeden hæfde, þæt hie him gesunde burgen,
for þæm he ne uþe þæt ænig ma folca for his þingum forwurde
þonne he self mid his agenre þeode.
 5.47.4. Ac he þus wæs sprecende & geomriende: Nu we
untweogendlice witan þæt we ure agen lif forlætan sceolan for þæm
ungemetlican feondscipe þe ure ehtende on sindon; uton þehhwæþere
acræftan hu we heora an þisse niht mægen mæst beswican, & us
selfum betst word & longsumast æt urum ende gewyrcan.
 5.47.9. Hu micel þæt is to secganne þætte Leoniða mid
vi c monna vi c m swa gebismrade, sume ofslog, sume gefliemde.
 5.47.12. Xersis wæs þa æt twam cirrum on ðæm londe swa
gescend mid his ormætan menige.
 5.47.13. He þagiet þriddan siþe wæs wilniende mid
scipfierde þæt he þæs gewinnes mehte mare gefremman, & him Ionas,
Creca leode, on fultum gespon; þeh hie ær ofer hiera willan him to
gecierdon, & hie him geheton þæt hie ðæt gefeoht ærest mid him
selfum þurhteon wolden, þeh hie him eft facen gelæsten, þa hie on
ðæm sæ feohtende wæron.
 5.47.18. Themestocles hatte Atheniensa ladteow.
 5.47.19. Hie wæron cumen Leoniðan to fultume, þeh hie æt
þæm ærran gefeohte him ne mehten to cuman.
 5.47.20. Se Themestocles gemyndgade Ionas þære ealdan
fæhþe þe Xersis him to geworht hæfde, hu he hie mid forhergiunge
& mid heora mæga slihtum on his geweald geniedde.
 5.47.23. He bæd hie eac þæt hie gemunden þara ealdena
treowa & þæs unarimedlican freondscipes þe hie ægþer hæfdon
ge to Atheniensum ge to Læcedemoniam ær on ealddagum, & hie biddende
wæs þæt hie mid sume searawrence from Xerse þæm cyninge sume hwile
awende, þæt hie & Læcedemonie mosten wið Persum þæs gewinnes
sumne ende gewyrcan; & hi him þære bene getygþedon.
 5.47.29. Þa þa Perse þæt gesawon þæt him þa from
bugan þe hie betst getriewdon þæt him sceolde sige gefeohtan, hie selfe
eac fleonde wæron, & hiora þær wearð fela ofslægen &
adruncen & gefangen.
 5.47.33. Xersis þegn wæs haten Marðonius.
 5.47.33. Se hiene wæs georne lærende þæt he ma hamweard
fore þonne he þær leng bide, þylæs ænegu ungeþwærnes on his
agnum rice ahafen wurde; & cwæþ þæt hit gerisenlicre wære
þæt he þæt gewinn him betæhte mid þæm fultume þe þær
to lafe þagiet wæs leng to winnanne, & sæde þæt hit þæm
cyninge læsse edwit wære gif þæm folce buton him þagiet misspeowe,
swa him ær dyde.
 5.48.4. Se cyning þa Xersis swiþe geliefedlice his þegne
gehierde, & mid sumum dæle his fultume þonan afor.
 5.48.6. Þa he þa hamweard to þære ie com, þe he ær
westweard het þa ofermætan brycge mid stane ofer gewyrcan, his sige to
tacne þe he on þæm siþe þurhteon þohte, þa wæs seo ea to
þon flede þæt he ne mehte to þære brycge cuman.
 5.48.9. Þa wæs ðæm cyninge swiþe ange on his mode
þæt naþær ne he mid his fultume næs, ne ðæt he ofer þa ea
cuman ne mehte.
 5.48.11. Toeacan ðæm he him wæs swiþe ondrædende
þæt him his fiend wæren æfterfylgende.
 5.48.13. Him þa to com an fiscere, & uneaþe hiene ænne
ofer brohte.
 5.48.13. Hu God þa mæstan ofermetto & þæt mæste
angin on swa heanlice ofermetto geniðerade, þæt se, se þe him ær
geþuhte þæt him nan sæ wiþhabban ne mehte þæt he hiene mid
scipun & mid his fultume afyllan ne mehte, þæt he eft wæs biddende
anes lytles troges æt anum earman men, þæt he mehte his feorh
generian.
 5.48.19. Morþonius, Xersis þegn, forlet þa scipa þe hie on
farende wæron, & for to anre byrig on Boetium, Creca londe, & hie
abræc.
 5.48.20. Him mon þæt æfter ðæm hrædlice forgeald,
þa hie mon gefliemde, & swiþe forslog; þeh þe Atheniensum se sige
& seo reafung þæs Persiscan feos to maran sconde wurde, for þon,
siþþan hie welegran wæron, hie eac bleaðran gewurdon.
 5.48.24. Æfter þæm Xersis wearþ his agenre þeode
swiþe unweorþ, & hiene his agen ealdormon Artabatus besirede &
ofslog.
 5.48.26. Eala, cwæð Orosius, hu lustbærlice tida on
ðæm dagum wæron, swa swa þa secgað, þe þæs cristendomes
wiðerflitan sint, þæt us nu æfter swelcum longian mæge swelce þa
wæron, þa swa micel folc on swa lytlan firste æt þrim folcgefeohtum
forwurdon, þæt wæs nigon x hund þusenda of Persa anra anwealde buton
hiera wiþerwinnum, ægþer ge of Sciþþium ge of Crecum.
 5.48.32. Þæt tacnade Leoniða on his þæm nihstan
gefeohte & Persa, hwelc moncwealm on Creca londe wæs mid monigfealdum
deaðum, mid þæm þe he sprecende wæs to his geferum æt his
underngereorde, ær he to ðæm gefeohte fore: Uton nu brucan þisses
undernmetes swa þa sculon þe hiora æfengifl on helle gefeccean sculon.
 5.48.36. Þeh he swa þa cwæde, he cwæð eft oþer word:
þeh ic ær sæde þæt we to helle sceolden, þeh ne geortriewe ic na
Gode þæt he us ne mæge gescildan to beteran tidun þonne we nu on
sint.
 5.49.3. Leoniþa sæde þæt þa tida þa yfele wæron,
& wilnade þæt him toweard beteran wæron; & nu sume men secgað
þæt þa beteran wæren þonne nu sien.
 5.49.6. Nu hie swa twywyrdige sindon, þonne wæron ægþer
gode, ge þa ærran, swa sume men nu secgað, ge eac þas æfterran,
swa hie ær sædon, & næron naðere an þance; gif hie þonne
soð ne sædon, þonne næron naþer gode ne þa, ne nu.
 5.49.10. Nu we sculon eft, cwæð Orosius, hwierfan near Roma,
þær we hit ær forleton; for þon ic ne mæg eal þa monigfealdan
yfel emdenes areccean, swa ic eac ealles þises middangeardes na maran
dæles ne angite buton ðætte on twam onwealdum gewearð, on þæm
ærestan & on ðæm siþemestan: þæt sint Asirie & Romane.
 6.49.15. Æfter þæm þe Romeburg getimbred wæs ii hunde
wintra & hundeahtatigum, þy ilcan geare þe Sabini Romane swa beswicon,
þa hiora iii hund & siex men of ægðerre healfe to anwigge eodon,
wearð micel wundor on heofonum gesewen, swelce eal se hefon birnende
wære.
 6.49.19. Þæt tacen wearð on Romanum swiþe gesweotolad mid
þæm miclan wolbryne monncwealmes, þe him raðe ðæs æfter com,
swa ðæt hie healfe belifene wurdon, & heora twegen consulas ðe hie
ða hæfdon, ge þa æt nihstan ða þe þær to lafe beon moston
wæron to ðæm meðie þæt hie ne mehton þa gefarenan to eorþan
bringan.
 6.49.25. Sona æfter þæm ealle heora þeowas wið þa
hlafordas winnende wæron, & hie benoman heora heafodstedes þæt hie
Capitoliam heton.
 6.49.27. & hie micla gefeoht ymb þæt hæfdon, oþ hie
ofslogan þone ænne consul þe hie þa niwan geset hæfdon, þeh þa
hlafordas on þæm ende hæfden heanlicne sige.
 6.49.29. & sona þæs, þy æfterran geare, Romane wunnan
wið Fulcisci þæt folc, & þær wurdon swiþe forslægene,
& se dæl se þær to lafe wæs, wearð on an fæsten bedrifen,
& þær wurdon mid hungre acwealde, þær heora þa ne gehulpe þa
þær æt ham wæron, mid ðæm þe hie gegaderedon eal moncynnes
þæt þær læfed wæs, & genamon anne earmne mon him to
consule, þær he on his æcere eode, & his sulh on handa hæfde,
& siþþan to Fulcisci þæm londe ferdon, & hie ut forleton.
 6.50.6. Æfter þæm wæs an ger full þæt ofer eall
Romana rice seo eorþe wæs cwaciende & berstende.
 6.50.7. & ælce dæg mon com unarimedlice oft to senatum,
& him sædon from burgum & from tunum on eorþan besuncenum, &
hie selfe wæron ælce dæg on þære ondrædinge hwonne hie on þa
eorþan besuncene wurden.
 6.50.10. Æfter ðæm com swa micel hæte giend Romane
þæt ealle heora eorðwæstmas ge eac hie selfe neah forwurdon.
 6.50.12. Æfter þæm þær wearð se mæsta hunger.
 6.50.14. Æfter þæm Romane gesettan him X consulas, þær
hie ær twegen hæfdon, to þon þæt hie hiera æ bewisten.
 6.50.15. Hiera an wæs Claudius haten, se him wæs on teonde
ealdordom ofer þa oþere, þeh hie him þæs geþafiende næren, ac
wið hiene winnende wæron, oþ þone first þe hie sume to him gecirdon,
sume noldan.
 6.50.18. Ac swa on twa todælde him betweonum wunnan þæt hie
forgeatan þara utera gefeohta þe him anhende wæron, oþ ealle þa
consulas togædere gecirdon, & Claudium þone ænne mid saglum
ofbeotan; & siþþan heora agen lond wegende wæron.
 6.50.23. Ieþelice, cwæð Orosius, & scortlice ic hæbbe
nu gesæd hiora ingewinn, þeh hi him wæron forneah þa mæstan &
þa pleolecestan.
 6.50.25. Þæt eac Eðna þæt sweflene fyr tacnade, þa
hit up of helle geate asprong on Sicilia þæm londe, hwelc gewinn þa
wæron be ðæm þe nu sindon, & Sicilia fela ofslog mid bryne &
mid stænce.
 6.50.27. Ac siþþan hit cristen wearð, þæt helle fyr
wæs siþþan geswiðrad, swa ealle ungetina wæron, þæt hit nu is
buton swelce tacnung þæs yfeles þe hit ær dyde, þeh hit ælce
geare sie bradre & bradre.
 7.50.31. Æfter þæm þe Romeburg getimbred wæs III hunde
wintra & an, þætte Sicilie ungerade wæron him betweonum, & hie
healfe asponan Læcedemonie him on fultum, & healfe Athenienses, Creca
þeoda, þe ær ætgædere wið Perse winnende wæron.
 7.51.2. Ac siþþan hie on Sicilium wunnon, hie eac siþþan
betweonum him selfum winnende wæron, oþ þæt Darius, Persa cyning,
Læcedemonium on fultume wearð wið þæm Athenienses, for þæm
gewinnum his ieldrena.
 7.51.6. Wæs ðæt micel wunder þæt eall Persa anweald
& Læcedemonia þæt hie ieð mehton Ahtene þa burg awestan þonne
hie ðæt folc mehten to heora willum geniedan.
 7.51.9. & sona æfter þæm, þy ilcan geare, Darius
gefor Persa cyning.
 7.51.9. & his II suna ymb þæt rice wunnon, Artecserses
& Cirus, oþ hiora ægþer þæt mæste folc ongean oþerne
geteah, & þa unsibbe mid gefeohtum dreogende wæron oþ Cirus ofslagen
wearð, se þær gingra wæs.
 7.51.13. On þæm dagum wæs an burg in Affrica sio wæs neh
þæm sæ, oð an sæflod com, & hie aweste & þa men
adrencte.
 8.51.15. Æfter þæm þe Romeburg getimbred wæs III hunde
wintra & LV, þætte Romane besæton Ueiorum þa burg X winter.
 8.51.16. & him þæt setl swiþor derede þonne þam þe
þærinne wæron, ægþer ge an ciele ge an hungre; buton ðæm þe
mon oft hergeade ægðer ge on his selfe ge on heora land æt ham.
 8.51.19. & hie þa hrædlice beforan heora feondum
forweorþan sceoldon, þær hie ða burg ne abræcen mid þæm
cræfte þe þa scondlicost wæs, þeh he him eft se weorðesta wurde,
þæt wæs þæt hie from heora wicstowum under þære eorþan
dulfon, oþ hie binnan þære byrig up eodon, & hie nihtes on
frumslæpe on bestælan, & þa burg mid ealle awestan.
 8.51.24. Þysne nyttan cræft, þeh he arlic nære, funde
heora tictator, Camillis hatte.
 8.51.26. Sona æfter þæm wearð Romana gewinn & þara
Gallia, þe wæron of Senno þære byrig.
 8.51.27. Þæt wæs ærest for þæm þa Gallia
hæfdon beseten Tusci þa burg.
 8.51.28. Þa sendon Romane ærendracan to Gallium, & hie
bædon þæt hie frið wið hie hæfden.
 8.51.29. Þa on ðæm ilcan dæge æfter þæm þe hie
þiss gesprecen hæfdon, fuhton Gallie on þa burg; þa gesawan hie Romana
ærendracan on hie feohtende mid þæm burgwarum.
 8.51.32. Hie for þæm hie gebulgon, & þa burg forleton,
& mid eallum heora fultume Romane sohton.
 8.51.33. & him Uauius se consul mid gefeohte ongean com, &
eac raðe gefliemed wearð eft into Romebyrig, & him Gallie wæron
æfterfylgende oþ hie ealle þærbinnan wæron.
 8.52.3. Gelice & mon mæd mawe, hie wæron þa burg
hergende & sleande buton ælcre ware.
 8.52.4. Þæt tacen nugiet cuþ is on þære ea noman
þæs consules sleges Fauiuses.
 8.52.6. Ne wene ic, cwæð Orosius, þæt ænig mon atellan
mæge ealne þone demm þe Romanum æt þæm cirre gedon wearð,
þeh hie þa burg ne forbærnden swa hie þa gedydon.
 8.52.8. & þa feawan þe þær to lafe wurdon gesealdon M
punda goldes wið heora feore; & hie þæt dydon for þæm swiþost
þe hie þohtan þæt hie siþþan hiora underþeowas wæren.
 8.52.11. & sume binnan þæt fæsten oðflugon, þæt
hie Capitoliam heton.
 8.52.12. Hie þa eac besæton, oð hie sume hungre acwælan,
sume on hand eodan, & hie siþþan oþrum folcum him wið feo
gesealdon.
 8.52.15. Hu þyncð eow nu, cwæð Orosius, þe þæs
cristendomes tida leahtriað, siþþan Gallia ut of þære byrig aforan,
hu bliðe tida Romane æfter ðæm hæfdon.
 8.52.17. Þa þa iermingas þe þær to lafe wurdon ut of
þæm holan crupon þe heo on lutedan, swa bewopene swelce hie of oþerre
worolde come, þonne hie besawon on þa besengdan burg & on þa westan,
þæt him þa wæs syndrig ege þær him ær wæs seo mæsta
wyn.
 8.52.21. Eac buton þæm yfele nahton hie naþer ne
þærinne mete ne þærute freond.
 8.52.23. Þæt wæron þa tida þe Romane nu æfter
sicað, & cweþað þæt him Gotan wyrsan tida gedon hæbben
þonne hie ær hæfdon, & næron on hie hergende buton þrie dagas;
& Gallie wæron ær siex monað binnan þære byrig hergende, &
þa burg bærnende; & him þæt þagiet to lytel yfel þuhte buton
hie eac hie þæs naman bename þæt hie nan folc næren.
 8.52.28. Eft þa Gotan þær læssan hwile hergedan þæt
hie for þæs cristendomes are & þurh Godes ege þæt hie naþer
ne þa burg ne bærndon ne þæs þone willan næfdon þæt hie
heora noman hie benamon.
 8.52.31. Ne þara nanne yflian noldan þe to ðæm Godes huse
oðflugon, þeh hie hæþene wære; ac swiþor micle wæron wilniende
þæt hie gemong him mid sibbe sittan mosten.
 8.52.34. & uneaðe mehte ær ænig þæm Gallium
oðfleon/ oþþe oðhydan.
 8.52.34. & þa þa Gotan þær lytle hwile hergedan, ne
mehte mon buton feawa ofslagenra geahsian.
 8.52.36. Ðær wæs gesiene Godes irre, þa hiora ærenan
beamas/ & hiora anlicnessa, þa hie ne mehton from Galliscum fyre
forbærnede weorþan; ac hi hefenisc fyr æt ðæm ilcan cyrre
forbærnde.
 8.53.4. Ne wene ic, cwæð Orosius, nu ic longe spell hæbbe
to secgenne, þæt ic hie on þisse bec geendian mæge; ac ic oþere
anginnan sceal.
