Bede 1
B9.6.3.
Bede, History of the English Church and Nation, Book 1: Miller 1890-98, 24-92.



 0.24.29. <foreign>LIBER PRIMUS</foreign> Breoton ist garsecges ealond, ðæt
wæs iu geara Albion haten: is geseted betwyh norðdæle and westdæle,
Germanie & Gallie & Hispanie þam mæstum dælum Europe myccle
fæce ongegen.
 0.24.31. Þæt is norð ehta hund mila lang, & tu hund mila
brad.
 0.26.1. Hit hafað fram suðdæle þa mægþe ongean, þe
mon hateþ Gallia Bellica.
 0.26.2. Hit is welig þis ealond on wæstmum & on treowum
misenlicra cynna; & hit is gescræpe on læswe sceapa & neata;
& on sumum stowum wingeardas growaþ.
 0.26.5. Swylce eac þeos eorþe is berende missenlicra fugela
& sæwihta, & fiscumwyllum wæterum & wyllgespryngum.
 0.26.7. & her beoþ oft fangene seolas & hronas and
mereswyn; & her beoþ oft numene missenlicra cynna weolcscylle &
muscule, & on þam beoð oft gemette þa betstan meregrotan ælces
hiwes.
 0.26.9. & her beoð swyþe genihtsume weolocas, of þam
bið geweorht se weolocreada tælgh, þone ne mæg sunne blæcan ne ne
regn wyrdan; ac swa he biþ yldra, swa he fægerra biþ.
 0.26.12. Hit hafað eac þis land sealtseaþas; & hit
hafaþ hat wæter, & hat baðo ælcere yldo & hade ðurh
todælede stowe gescræpe.
 0.26.14. Swylce hit is eac berende on wecga orum ares &
isernes, leades & seolfres.
 0.26.15. Her biþ eac gemeted gagates: se stan bið blæc gym;
gif mon hine on fyr deþ, þonne fleoþ þær neddran onweg.
 0.26.17. Wæs þis ealond eac geo gewurðad mid þam
æðelestum ceastrum, anes wana þrittigum, ða þe wæron mid weallum
& torrum & geatum & þam trumestum locum getimbrade, butan oðrum
læssan unrim ceastra.
 0.26.20. & forðan ðe ðis ealond under þam sylfum
norðdæle middangeardes nyhst ligeþ, & leohte nihte on sumera
hafað, swa þæt oft on middre nihte geflit cymeð þam behealdendum,
hwæðer hit si þe æfenglommung ðe on morgen deagung is on ðon
sweotol, ðæt þis ealond hafað mycele lengran dagas on sumera, &
swa eac nihta on wintra, þonne ða suðdælas middangeardes.
 1.26.27. Ðis ealond nu on andweardnysse æfter rime fif Moyses
boca, ðam seo godcunde æ awriten is, fif ðeoda gereordum ænne wisdom
þære hean soþfæstnysse & þære soðan heanesse smeað &
andetteaþ; þæt is on Angolcynnes gereorde & Brytta & Scotta
& Peohta & Ledenwara: þæt an is, þæt Leden, on smeaunge
gewrita eallum þam oðrum gemæne.
 1.28.3. On fruman ærest wæron þysses ealondes bigengan
Bryttas ane, fram þam hit naman onfeng.
 1.28.4. Is þæt sæd, ðæt hi comon fram Armoricano
þære mægeþe on Breotone, & þa suðdælas þyses ealondes
him gesæton & geahnodon.
 1.28.7. Þa gelamp æfter þon þætte Peahte ðeod com of
Scyððia lande on scipum & þa ymbærndon eall Breotone gemæro,
þæt hi comon on Scotland upp, & þær gemetton Sceotta þeode,
& him bædon setles & eardungstowe on heora lande betwyh him.
 1.28.10. Andswearedon Scottas, þæt heora land ne wære to
þæs mycel, þæt hi mihton twa þeode gehabban.
 1.28.12. Ac cwædon: We magon eow sellan halwende geþeahte,
hwæt ge don magon.
 1.28.13. We witan heonan noht feor oðer ealond eastrihte,
þæt we magon oft leohtum dagum geseon.
 1.28.14. Gif ge þæt secan wyllaþ, þonne magon ge þær
eardungstowe habban: oððe gif hwylc eow wiðstondeð, þonne
gefultumiað we eow.
 1.28.17. Ða ferdon Peohtas in Breotone, & ongunnon eardigan
þa norðdælas þyses ealondes; & Bryttas, swa we ær cwædon,
ða suðdælas.
 1.28.18. Mid þy Peohtas wif næfdon, bædon him fram
Scottum.
 1.28.19. Ða geþafedon hi ðære arednesse, & him wif
sealdon, þæt ðær seo wise on tweon cyme, þæt hi ðonne ma of
þam wifcynne him cyning curan þonne of þam wæpnedcynne: þæt get
to dæg is mid Peohtum healden.
 1.28.24. Ða, forþgongenre tide, æfter Bryttum & Peohtum,
þridde cynn Scotta Breotone onfeng on Pehta dæle, ða wæron cumene of
Hibernia Scotta ealonde mid heora heretogan, Reada hatte: oðþa mid
freondscipe oðþa mid gefeohte him sylfum betwih hi seðel &
eardungstowe geahnodon, þa hi nu get habbað.
 1.28.28. Þæt cynn nu geond to dæg Dalreadingas wæron
hatene.
 1.28.30. Hibernia Scotta ealond ge on brædo his stealles ge on
halwendnesse ge on smyltnysse lyfta is betere mycle þonne Breotone land, swa
þæt ðær seldon snau leng ligeð þonne ðry dagas.
 1.28.32. & þær nænig mann for wintres cyle on sumera
heg ne maweþ, ne scypene his neatum ne timbreþ.
 1.28.34. Ne þær monn ænigne snicendne wyrm ne ætterne
gesihþ; ne þær ænig nædre lifian ne mæg.
 1.30.1. Forþon of Breotone nædran on scipum lædde wæron:
sona swa hi ðæs landes lyft gestuncan, swa swulton hi.
 1.30.3. Eac neah þan ealle þa ðing, þe ðanon cumað,
wið ælcum attre magon.
 1.30.4. Þæt to tacne is, þæt sume menn gesawon, ða þe
wæron fram nædran geslegene, þæt man scof þara boca leaf, þe of
Hibernia coman, & þa sceafþan dyde on wæter, & sealde drincan
þam mannum; & sona wæs þæt atter ofernumen, & hi wæron
gehælde.
 1.30.8. Is þæt ealond welig on meolcum & on hunige; &
wingeardas weaxaþ on sumum stowum.
 1.30.9. & hit is fiscwylle & fugolwylle, & mære on
huntunge heorta & rana.
 1.30.10. Þis is agendlice Scotta eðel; heonon coman seo
ðridde ðeod Scotta, swa we ær cwædon, eac be Bryttum & Peohtum on
Breotone.
 2.30.13. Wæs Breotene ealond Romanum uncuð, oððæt Gaius
se casere, oðre naman Iulius, hit mid ferde gesohte & geeode syxtygum
wintra ær Cristes cyme.
 3.30.16. Ða æfter þon Claudius se casere, se wæs feorþa
fram Agusto eft fyrde gelædde on Breotone, & þær butan hefegum
gefeohte & blodgyte mycelne dæl þæs landes on anweald onfeng.
 3.30.18. Swylce he eac Orcadas þa ealond, þa wæron ut on
garsecge butan Brotone, to Romwara rice geþeodde.
 3.30.20. & þy syxtan monðe, þe he hider com, he eft to
Rome hwearf.
 3.30.21. Ðeos fyrd wæs getogen ðy feorðan geare his rices,
þæt ger wæs fram Cristes hidercyme þæt sixte eac feowertigum.
 3.30.24. Fram þam ylcan casere Claudie wæs sended Uespassianus
on Breotone, se æfter Nerone ricsode.
 3.30.25. Se geeode þæt ealond on Wiht & Romana onwealde
underþeodde.
 3.30.26. Þæt is þrittiges mila lang east & west, &
twelf mila brad suð & norð.
 3.30.27. Ða feng Neron to rice æfter Claudie þam casere.
 3.30.28. Se naht freomlices ongan on þære cynewisan, ac betwuh
oðera unrim æwyrdleana Romwara rices, þæt he Breotone rice forlet.
 4.32.1. Ða wæs fram Cristes hidercyme hundteontig & fiftig
& six gear, þæt Marcus, oþre naman Antonius, se wæs feowerteoþa
fram Agusto þam casere, se onfeng Romwara rice mid Aurelia his breðer.
 4.32.4. Ðara cyninga tidum wæs se halga wer Eleuther biscop
& papa þare Romaniscan cyrican.
 4.32.5. Sende to him Lucius Breotone cyning ærendgewrit; bæd
hine & halsade, þæt he þurh his bebod cristene gefremed wære.
 4.32.7. & hraðe þa gefremednesse ðære arfæstan bene
wæs fylgende.
 4.32.8. & ða onfengan Bryttas fulluhte & Cristes
geleafan, & ðone onwealhne & unwemmedne on smyltre sibbe heoldan oþ
Deoclitianes tide þæs yfelan caseres.
 5.32.11. Ða wæs ymb hundteontig wintra & nigan &
hundeahtatig wintra fram Drihtnes menniscnysse, þæt Seuerus casere, se
wæs æffrica cynnes, of þære byrig ðe Lepti hatte, se wæs
seofonteogeða fram Agusto, þæt he rice onfeng, & þæt hæfde
seofontyne gear.
 5.32.14. Þes casere framlice rehte ða cynewisan, ac
hwæðere mid gewinne.
 5.32.16. He com on Breotone mid fyrde, & þær mid myclum
& hefegum gefeohtum mycelne dæl þæs ealondes on anweald onfeng;
& hit begyrde & gefæstnade mid dice & mid eorðwealle from
sæ to sæ fram oðrum elreordum þeodum.
 5.32.19. & he ðær on Eoforwicceastre adle forðferde;
& Basianus his sunu feng to Breotenrice.
 6.32.21. Ða wæs ymb tu hund wintra & syx &
hundeahtatig æfter þære Drihtenlican mennyscnysse, þæt
Dioclitianus casere, se wæs fram Agusto ðridde eac ðrittigum, se
hæfde twentig wintra rice.
 6.32.23. Se geceas Maximianum him to fultume his rices ge sealde
him westdæl middaneardes.
 6.32.25. & he onfeng cynegewædum & com on Breotone.
 6.32.26. Þa betwyh ða monigan yfel þe hi dydon, Dioclitianus
in estdæle middangeardes & Maximianus on westdæle, hi hendon &
hergedon Godes cyrican & yfeledon, & slogan cristene men.
 6.34.1. Onfengon hi ða teoþan stowe on ehtnysse Godes cyrcena
æfter Nerone casere.
 6.34.3. Wæs seo ehtnysse þyssa arleasra cyninga unmetra &
singalre eallum þam ærgedonum on middanearde, forðon ðurh tyn winter
full Godes cyricena hynnysse & unsceaððiendra fordemednesse & slege
haligra martyra unblinnendlice don wæs.
 6.34.6. Wæs eac Bryten þa swyðe gehyned on myclum wundre
Godes geleafan & ondetnysse.
 7.34.8. Swylce eac on þa tid on Breotone wæs ðrowiende
Sanctus Albanus; be þam Fortunatus presbyter on fæmnena lofe, ða he
gemynegode þara eadigra martyra, ða þe of eallum middangearde to Drihtne
coman, cwæð he: þone æðelan Albanum seo wæstmberende Bryton
forðbereð.
 7.34.12. Wæs he Albanus hæðen ða gyt, þa ðara
treowleasra cyninga beboda wið cristenum monnum grimsedon.
 7.34.14. Ða gelamp þæt he sumne Godes mann preosthades, se
wæs ða reþan ehteras fleonde, on gestliðnysse onfeng.
 7.34.15. And mid þy ðe he hine þa geseah on singalum gebedum
& wæccum dæges & nihtes beon abysgadne, þa wæs he semninga
mid þam godcundan gyfe gesawen & gemildsad.
 7.34.18. & he sona bysene his geleafan & arfæstnesse
onhyrigean ongan; & swylce eac sticcemælum his þam halwendan
trymnyssum wæs gelæred, þæt he forlet þa ðystro deofulgylda
& of inneweardre heortan cristen wæs geworden.
 7.34.22. Mid þy ða se foresprecena Godes man fela daga mid him
wæs on gestliðnesse, þa becom þæt to earan þæs manfullan
ealdormannes, þæt Albanus hæfde ðone Cristes andettere digollice mid
him.
 7.34.25. Ða het he hraðe his þegnas hine secan & acsian.
 7.34.25. Ða sona þæs þe hi coman to þæs martyres
huse, þa Sanctus Albanus for ðam cuman, þe he gefeormade, gegyrede hine
ða his munucgegyrelan; & eode him on hond.
 7.34.28. & hi hine gebundenne to him læddon.
 7.34.29. Ða gelamp hit on þa ylcan tid, þe Albanus to him
gelæded wæs, þæt he se dema stod æt his godgyldum & deoflum
onsægdnesse bær.
 7.34.31. Mid þy ðe he geseah Sanctum Albanum, þa wæs he
sona yrre geworden, forþam he mid his sylfes willum geþristade, þæt he
hine sylfne on geweald sealde swylcere frecednysse for þam cuman, þe he on
gestliðnysse gefeormode.
 7.36.3. Het hine ða teon & lædan to ðam deofolgyldum,
ðe he æt stod; cwæð him þus to: Forðon ðe ðu þone mangengan
& þone wiþfeohtend & þone forhycgend ura goda ðu me helan
woldest, swyðor þonne minum ðegnum secgean, þonne wite ðu þæt
þu scealt ðam ylcan wite onfon, ðe he geearnode, gif ðu gewitan
ðencest fram þam bigange ure æfestnysse.
 7.36.8. And Sanctus Albanus ða mid his sylfes willan cyðde
& openade þam ehterum Godes geleafan, þæt he cristen wære.
 7.36.10. & he ne wæs ondredende ða beotunge þæs
ealdormannes, ac he begyrded wæs mid wæpnum þæs gastlican
camphades.
 7.36.12. & he openlice sæde þæt he his bebodum
hyrsumian ne wolde.
 7.36.13. Ða cwæð he se ealdorman & se dema him to: Saga
me hwylces hiredes & hwylces cynnes þu si.
 7.36.14. And þa andswarede him Sanctus Albanus: Hwæt limpeþ
þæs to ðe of hwylcum wyrtruman ic acenned si?
 7.36.16. Ac gif ðu wylle gehyran þæt soþ minre
æfestnysse, þonne wite þu me cristene beon: & ic cristenum
þenungum ðeowian wylle.
 7.36.18. Þa cwæð he se dema: Gesaga me þinne naman,
hwæt ðu haten sie.
 7.36.19. Þa cwæð he: Albanus ic eom geciged fram minum
yldrum; & þone soðan God & þone lifigendan, se gescop heofon
& eorðan & ealle gesceafta, ic symble bigange,& me to him
gebidde.
 7.36.22. Þa wæs he se dema yrre geworden; cwæð him to:
Gif ðu wille þysses lifes gesælignysse mid us brucan, ne yld þu
þæt þu þam myclan godum mid us onsecge.
 7.36.24. Ða andswarede Sanctus Albanus: ða onsægdnysse, þa
ðe fram eow deoflum wæron agoldene, ne magon hi ðam underðeoddum
gefulltumian, ne heora lustas ne heora willan gefyllan.
 7.36.27. Ac gyt soþre is, swa hwylc man swa þissum onlicnyssum
& deofolgyldum ansægdnysse bereð, se forðam mede onfehð, þæt
is ecum tintregum helle wites.
 7.36.29. Ða se dema þas word gehyrde, ða wæs he mid miclum
wylme & yrre onstyred; het ða & bebead hraðe swingan &
tintregian ðone Godes andettere.
 7.36.32. Tealde & wende þæt he mid swinglan sceolde þa
beldu & þa anrednesse his heortan anescian, ða he mid wordum ne mihte.
 7.36.33. Ða he ða mid grimmum swinglum & tintregum wæced
wæs, & he ealle þa witu, ðe him man dyde, geþyldelice &
gefeonde for Drihtne abær & aræfnde.
 7.38.2. Þa se dema þæt ða oncneow & þa ongæt,
þæt he hine mid tintregum & mid swinglan oferswiðan ne mihte, ne
from þam bigonge ðære cristenan æfestnysse acyrran, þa het he hine
heafde beceorfan.
 7.38.6. Mid ðy he þa to deaðe gelæded wæs, þa com he
to swiðstremre ea, seo floweþ neah ðære ceastre wealle.
 7.38.7. & he geseah ðær micle menigo monna
æghwæðeres hades; & wæron missenlicræ yldo & getincge
men.
 7.38.9. Seo menigo monna butan tweon mid godcundre onbryrdnysse
wæs geciged to þenunge ðæs eadigan martyres.
 7.38.10. & hi swa ðæs streames brycge abysgade wæron
þæt hi hwene ær æfenne oferfaran ne mihten; &, neah ðon eallum
utagangendum, þæt se dema butan ðenunge abad on þære ceastre.
 7.38.13. And ða Sanctus Albanus, on ðam wæs byrnende
wilsumnes modes, þæt he recenust to þrowunge become, eode ða to
þære burnan þe ic ær sæde, & his eagan ahof upp to heofonum,
þa sona adrugode se stream & beah for his fotum, swa þæt he mihte
dryge ofergangan.
 7.38.18. Þa ðis wundor ða geseah betwuh oðre se sylfa
cwellere ðe hine slean sceolde, þa wæs he sona mid godcundre
onbryrdnysse innan monad, þæt he wearp þæt sweord onweg þæt he
on handa hæfde, & him to fotum feoll.
 7.38.21. & he geornlice bæd & wilnade, þæt he mid
ðone martyr oððe for hine þrowian moste, ðe he ær slean sceolde.
 7.38.23. Ða wæs þes man ðurh Godes gyfe of ehtere geworden
soðfæstnesse freond ond Cristes geleafan.
 7.38.24. And þa astah se arwurðesta Godes andettere mid þa
menigeo on þa dune upp, seo wæs ða tidlice grene & fæger &
mid misenlicum blostmum wyrta afed & gegyred æghwyder ymbutan.
 7.38.27. Wæs þæt þæs wyrðe, þæt seo stow swa
wlitig & swa fæger wære, þe eft sceolde mid þy blode ðæs
eadigan martyres gewurðad & gehalgod weorþan.
 7.38.30. On þysse dune ufanweardre bæd Sanctus Albanus fram
Gode him wæter seald beon to sumre his þenunge.
 7.38.31. & þa sona hraðe beforan his fotum wæs wyl upp
yrnende, þæt ealle menn ongytan mihtan, þæt ðæt wæter to his
þenunge sended wæs, þe he ær to Gode wilnade.
 7.38.34. & nu seo wylle & þæt wæter, gefylledre
wilsumnesse & ðære ðenunge þæs eadigan martyres wæs
forlætende ða cyþnysse þære ðenunge, & hwearf eft to
gecynde.
 7.40.2. Wæs seo stow hwæthwugu on healfre mile fram þære
ceastre wealle, & fram þære burnan þe he ær drigum fotum
ofereode.
 7.40.4. Ðær wæs þa heafde beslagen se strengesta martyr
Sanctus Albanus, & þær he onfeng beah & sige eces lifes, þone
ylcan sige God behet eallum þam ðe hine lufian wyllað.
 7.40.7. Ac se cwellere, se ðe his arlease handa aðenede ofer
þone arfæstan sweoran ðæs martyres & his heafod of asloh, ne
wæs he forlæten þæt he ofer him deadum gefege: ac him ða eagan of
his heafde ascuton & ætgædere mid þæs martyres heafde on
eorðan feollan.
 7.40.11. Ða wæs eac swylce heafde beslegen & gemartyrad se
mon, se ðe wæs ær ðon mid þam uplican mihte geðread, þæt he
wiðsoc þæt he ðone Godes andettere sloge.
 7.40.13. Be þam ðonne cuð is, þeah ðe he mid wætere
fulluhtes bæþes aþwegen ne wære, þæt he wæs hwæðere mid
þy bæðe his blodes geclænsad & ðæs heofonlican rices wyrðe
geworden.
 7.40.16. Ða wæs se dema æfter ðyssum mid þa neownysse
swa monigra heofonlicra wundra swyþe gedrefed & gefyrhted, het þa sona
blinnan fram ehtnysse cristenra manna, & ongan arweorþian ða þrowunge
þara haligra martyra, þurh ða he ær wende þæt he hi acyrran
meahte fram æfestnysse þæs cristenan geleafan.
 7.40.21. Wæs he þrowigende se eadiga Albanus ðy teoðan
dæge Kalendarum Iuliarum neah ðære ceastre, ðe Romane heton
Uerolamium, seo nu fram Angelðeode Werlameceaster oþþe Wæclingaceaster
is nemned.
 7.40.24. Ða wæs sona æfter þon þæt smyltnes com
cristenra tida, þæt ðær wæs cyrice geworht & getimbrad
wundorlices geweorces & his þrowunge & martyrdome wyrþe.
 7.40.27. On ðære stowe nu soðlice oð ðysne andwardan
dæg untrumra manna hælo & wyrcnes heofonlicra mægena gelomlice
beoð mærsade, & monigfealde wundra gelimpað.
 7.40.30. Wæron eac swylce þrowiende on ða tid Aaron &
Iulilius, þa wæron burhwarumen on Ligeceastre, & eac oðre monige
æghwæðeres hades on missenlicum stowum, ða wæron missenlicum
cwealmnyssum ðreste & ungeheredre leoma toslitnysse wundade.
 7.42.1. Fulfremede compe heora sawle to gefean sendon þære
upplican ceastre heofona rices wuldres.
 8.42.3. And þæs ðe þa seo costnung ðære ehtnesse
gestilled wæs, þa wæron forðgongende þa cristenan men & ða
geleafsuman, þa þe hi ær on ða frecnan tid þære ehtnysse on wudum
& on westenum & scræfum hi hyddon & digledon.
 8.42.6. & hi ða edniwedon Godes cyricean þa ðe ær
toworpene wæron, & eac cyricean timbredon & halgodon þam halgum
martyrum, & heora stowe bræddon & weorðodon, swa swa sigefæst
tacon, & symbeldagas mærsedan; & þa godcundan geryno clænan
muðe & clænre heortan halgedon & fremedon.
 8.42.11. Þeos sibb awunade on Cristes cyrican, ða þe on
Brytene wæron, oð ða tide þe se Arrianisca gedweolda aras.
 8.42.13. Ðyssum tidum Constantinus, se be Diocletiane lyfgendum
Gallia rice & Ispania heold & rehte, wæs se mon monðwære &
for weorulde god ferde he forð on Breotone.
 8.42.15. & Constantinus his sunu þam godan casere, se wæs
of Elena þam wife acenned, his rice forlet.
 8.42.17. Writeð Eutropius þæt Constantinus se casere wære
on Breotone acenned, & æfter his fæder to rice feng.
 8.42.18. Þæs cyninges tidum se Arrianisca gedwola wæs
upcumen; & þæt deadbærende attor his getreowleasnysse, nalæs
þæt on eallum middangeardes cyricum þæt he stregde, ac hit eac swylce
on þis ealond becom.
 8.42.22. Se gedweola wæs on þam Nyceaniscan sinoþe
geniðerad & afylled on Constantinus dagum.
 9.42.24. Ða wæs ymb feower hund wintra & seofone æfter
Drihtnes menniscnysse; feng to rice Honorius casere, se wæs feorða eac
feowertigum fram Agusto þam casere twam gearum ær Romaburh abrocen &
forhergad wære.
 9.42.27. Seo hergung wæs þurh Alaricum Gotena cyning
geworden.
 9.42.28. Wæs Romaburh abrocen fram Gotum ymb þusend wintra
& hundteontig & feower & syxtig ðæs þe heo geworht wæs.
 9.44.2. Of þære tide Romane blunnun ricsian on Breotene.
 9.44.3. Hæfdon hi Breotona rice feower hund wintra &
þæs fiftan hundseofontig, ðæs ðe Gaius, oðre naman Iulius, se
casere þæt ylce ealond gesohte.
 9.44.5. & ceastre & torras & stræta & brycge on
heora rice geworhte wæron, þa we to dæg sceawian magon.
 9.44.6. Eardædon Bryttas binnan þam dice to suðdæle, þe
we gemynegodon þæt Seuerus se casere het þwyrs ofer þæt ealond
gedician.
 9.44.9. Þa ongunnan twa ðeoda Pyhtas norðan & Scottas
westan hi onwinnan & heora æhta niman & hergian; & hi fela geara
yrmdon & hyndon.
 9.44.11. Ða on ðære unstilnysse onsendon hi ærendwrecan
to Rome mid gewritum & wependre bene: him fultumes bædon, & him
gehetan eaðmode hyrnysse & singale underþeodnysse, gif hi him
gefultumadon þæt hi mihton heora fynd oferwinnan.
 9.44.14. Ða onsendan hi him mycelne here to fultume.
 9.44.15. & sona þæs ðe hi on þis ealond comon, þa
compedon hi wið heora feondum, & him mycel wæl ongeslogan, & of
heora gemærum adrifon & aflymdon.
 9.44.18. & Lærdon þæt hi fæsten worhtan him to
gebeorge wið heora feondum: & swa mid mycele sige ham foran.
 9.44.20. Ða þæt ða ongeaton ða ærran gewinnan
þæt se Romanisca here wæs onweg gewiten, ða coman hi sona mid
sciphere on heora landgemæro, & slogan eall & cwealdon þæt hi
gemetton; & swa swa ripe yrð fortreddon & fornamon, & hi mid
ealle foryrmdon.
 9.44.23. And hi ða eft sendon ærendracan to Rome &
wæpendre stefne him fultumes bædon, þæt þæt earme eðel mid
ealle ne fordiligad ne wære, ne se nama ðære Romaniscan þeode, se
ðe mid him swa lange scean & bryhte, fram fremdra ðeoda
ungeþwærnesse fornumen & fordilgad beon sceolde.
 9.44.28. Þa wæs eft here hider sended, se wæs cumende on
ungewenedre tide on herfeste: & hi sona wið heora feondum gefuhtan, &
sige hæfdan, & ealle ða ðe þone deað beswician myhtan ofer
ðone sæ norð aflymde, þa ðe ær ælce geare ofer ðone sæ
hloðedon & hergedon.
 9.44.32. Ða gesægdon Romane on an Bryttum þæt hi no ma ne
mihton for heora gescyldnysse swa gewinnfullicum fyrdum swencte beon.
 9.44.34. Ac hi manedon & lærdon þæt hi him wæpno
worhton & modes strengðo naman þæt hi compedon & wiðstodan
heora feondum.
 9.46.2. & hi him ða eac to ræde & to frofre fundon,
þæt hi gemænelice fæsten geworhten him to gescyldnesse, stænene
weal rihtre stige fram eastsæ oð westsæ, þær Seuerus se casere iu
het dician & eorðwall gewyrcan: ðone man nu to dæg sceawian mæg
eahta fota bradne & twelf fota heanne.
 9.46.6. Swylce eac on þæs sæs waroþe to suðdæle,
þanon ðe hi sciphere on becom, torras timbredon to gebeorghe ðæs
sæs.
 9.46.8. Ða sona þæs ðe þis fæsten geworht wæs,
ða sealdon hi him bysne monige, hu hi him wæpen wyrcean sceoldan, &
heora feondum wiðstondan.
 9.46.10. & hi ða grettan & him cyðdan þæt hi
næfre ma hi secan woldan; & hi sigefæste ofer sæ ferdon.
 9.46.12. Ða þæt þa Pehtas & Scottas geacsedon,
þæt hi ham gewitene wæron, & eac þæt hi hider no eft ma hi
secan ne woldan, þa wæron hi ðe baldran gewordene, & sona ealne
norðdæl ðysses ealondes oð ðone weall genoman & gesetton.
 9.46.15. Wið þyssum stod on þam fæstene ufanweardum se
earga feða Brytta & þær forhtigendre heortan wunode dæges &
nihtes.
 9.46.17. Þa sohtan heora gewinnan him sarwe & worhton him
hocas, & mid þam tugan hi earmlice adun of þam wealle.
 9.46.19. & hi wæron sona deade, swa hi eorðan gesohtan.
 9.46.20. Hig þa forlættan þone wall & heora burh, &
flugan onwæg: & heora gewinnan hi ehtan & slogan, & on wæll
fyldon.
 9.46.21. Wæs þis gefeoht wælgrimre & strengre eallum
þam ærgedonum.
 9.46.22. Forðon swa swa sceap from wulfum & wildeorum beoð
fornumene, swa þa earman ceasterwaran toslitene & fornumene wæron fram
heora feondum, & heora æhtum benemde & to hungre gesette.
 10.46.26. Ða wæs ymb feower hund wintra & þreo &
twentig þære Drihtenlican menniscnysse; Theodosius casere æfter Honorie
rice onfeng, & þæt hæfde syx & twentig wintra.
 10.46.28. Se wæs fifta eac feowertigum fram Agusto þam
casere.
 10.46.29. Þæs caseres rices ðy eahteþan geare Palladius
biscop wæs ærest sended to Scottum, þa ðe on Crist gelyfdon, fram
þam biscope þære Romaniscan cyricean, Celestinus wæs haten.
 10.48.1. Swylce eac his rices þy ðriddan geare eac twentigum
Aetius wæs haten mære man; se wæs iu ær heah ealdorman, & þa
wæs þriddan siðe consul & cyning on Rome.
 10.48.3. To þysum ða þearfendan lafe Brytta sendon
ærendgewrit; wæs se fruma þus awriten: Ettio ðriga cyninge: Her is
Brytta geong & geomerung.
 10.48.5. & on forðgeonge þæs ærendgewrites þus hi
heora yrmðo arehton: Us drifað þa ellreordan to sæ; wiðscufeð us
seo sæ to þam ællreordum: betwih him twam we þus tweofealdne deað
þrowiað, oððe sticode beoð oððe on sæ adruncene.
 10.48.9. Ðeah ðe hi þas ðing sædon, ne mihton hi
nænigne fultum æt him begitan, forþon on ða ylcan tid he wæs
abysgad mid hefigum gefeohtum wið Blædlan & Atillan Huna cyningum.
 11.48.13. Swylce eac þissum tidum com mycel hungor on
Constantinopolim Creca ealdorburh: & sona wol wæs æfterfyligende.
 11.48.14. Ge eac monige weallas mid seofon & fiftegum torran
gehruron & gefeollan: & swylce eac monige oðre ceastre tohrorene
wæron.
 11.48.16. & se hunger & se wolberenda stenc þære lyfte
monige þusendo monna & neata fordilgade & fornam.
 11.48.19. Com se foresprecena hungur eac swylce hider on Bryttas
& hi to ðon swyþe wæhcte, þæt heora monige heora feondum on
hand eodan; & gyt ma wæs þe þæt don ne wolde: ac, þa him ælc
mennisc fultum blonn, þæt hi ma on godcundne fultum getreowodan.
 11.48.22. & þa ongunnan ærest wið heora fynd feohtan,
þa þe monige gear ær hi onhergedon & hleoðedon.
 11.48.24. & hi him ða micel wæl ongeslogan, & hi ham
bedrifan, & sige ahton.
 11.48.25. Æfter þyssum com god gear, & swa eac micel
genihtsumnys wæstma on Breotone lond, swa nænig æfteryldo syððan
gemunan mæg.
 11.48.27. Mid þy ða ongon firenlust weaxan; & sona wol
ealra monna somod gehradode, þæt wæs wællhreownysse &
soðfæstnysse feoung, & seo lufu liges & leasunge.
 11.48.29. & nalæs þæt an þæt ðas ðing dyden
weoruldmen, ac eac swylce þæt Drihtnes eowde, & his hyrdas.
 11.48.31. & hi druncennesse & oferhydo & geciide ond
geflite & æfeste & oðrum mannum þysses gemetes wæron heora
swiran underþeoddende, onweg aworpenum Cristes geoce þam leohtan &
þam swetan.
 11.50.2. Betwih ðas þing þa com semninga mycel wol & grim
ofer ða gehwyrfdon modes menn.
 11.50.3. & se on hrærdnesse swa mycele menigo heora fornom
& gefylde, þætte ða cwican no genihtsumedon þæt hi ða deadan
bebyrigdan.
 11.50.5. Ac hwæðere þa ðe lifigende wæron for ðam ege
þæs deaðes noht þon sel woldan, ne fram heora sawle deaðe acigde
beon ne mihton.
 11.50.7. Forðon nalæs æfter myclum fæce grimmre wræc
þa þære fyrenfullan þeode þæs grimman mannes wæs
æfterfyligende.
 11.50.9. Þa gesomnedon hi gemot & þeahtedon &
ræddon, hwæt him to donne wære, hwær him wære fultum to secanne
to gewearnienne & to wiðscufanne swa reðre hergunge & swa
gelomlicre þara norðþeoda.
 11.50.12. & þa gelicode him eallum mid heora cyninge,
Wyrtgeorn wæs haten, þæt hi Seaxna þeode ofer þam sælicum
dælum him on fultum gecygdon & gelaðedon.
 11.50.14. Þæt cuð is þæt þæt mid Drihtnes mihte
gestihtad wæs, þæt yfell wræc come ofer ða wiþcorenan, swa on
þam ende þara wisena sweotolice ætywed is.
 12.50.17. Ða wæs ymb feower hund wintra & nigon &
feowertig fram ures Drihtnes menniscnysse, þæt Martianus casere rice
onfeng & VII gear hæfde.
 12.50.19. Se wæs syxta eac feowertigum fram Agusto þam
casere.
 12.50.20. Ða Angel þeod & Seaxna wæs gelaðod fram
þam foresprecenan cyninge, & on Breotone com on þrim myclum scypum;
& on eastdæle þyses ealondes eardungstowe onfeng þurh ðæs ylcan
cyninges bebod, þe hi hider gelaðode, þæt hi sceoldan for heora eðle
compian & feohtan.
 12.50.24. & hi sona compedon wið heora gewinnan, þe hi oft
ær norðan onhergedon; & Seaxan þa sige geslogan.
 12.50.26. Þa sendan hi ham ærenddracan & heton secgan
þysses landes wæstmbærnysse, & Brytta yrgþo.
 12.50.27. & hi þa sona hider sendon maran sciphere strengran
wighena; & wæs unoferswiðendlic weorud, þa hi togædere geþeodde
wæron.
 12.50.29. & him Bryttas sealdan & geafan eardungstowe
betwih him þæt hi for sibbe & hælo heora eðles campodon &
wunnon wið heora feondum, & hi him andlyfne & are forgeafen for heora
gewinne.
 12.52.2. Comon hi of þrim folcum ðam strangestan Germanie,
þæt of Seaxum & of Angle & of Geatum.
 12.52.4. Of Geata fruman syndon Cantware, & Wihtsætan;
þæt is seo ðeod þe Wiht þæt ealond oneardað.
 12.52.5. Of Seaxum, þæt is of ðam lande þe mon hateð
Ealdseaxan, coman Eastseaxan & Suðseaxan & Westseaxan.
 12.52.7. And of Engle coman Eastengle & Middelengle & Myrce
& eall Norðhembra cynn; is þæt land ðe Angulus is nemned, betwyh
Geatum & Seaxum; is sæd of þære tide þe hi ðanon gewiton oð
to dæge, þæt hit weste wunige.
 12.52.10. Wæron ða ærest heora latteowas & heretogan
twegen gebroðra Hengest & Horsa.
 12.52.11. Hi wæron Wihtgylses suna, þæs fæder wæs
Witta haten, þæs fæder wæs Wihta haten & þæs Wihta fæder
wæs Woden nemned, of ðæs strynde monigra mægða cyningcynn fruman
lædde.
 12.52.14. Ne wæs ða ylding to þon þæt hi heapmælum
coman maran weorod of þam ðeodum, þe we ær gemynegodon.
 12.52.16. & þæt folc, ðe hider com, ongan weaxan &
myclian to þan swiðe, þæt hi wæron on myclum ege þam sylfan
landbigengan ðe hi ær hider laðedon & cygdon.
 12.52.19. Æfter þissum hi þa geweredon to sumre tide wið
Pehtum, þa hi ær þurh gefeoht feor adrifan.
 12.52.20. & þa wæron Seaxan secende intingan & towyrde
heora gedales wið Bryttas.
 12.52.21. Cyðdon him openlice & sædon, butan hi him maran
andlyfne sealdon, þæt hi woldan him sylfe niman & hergian, þær hi
hit findan mihton.
 12.52.23. & sona ða beotunge dædum gefyldon: bærndon
& hergedon & slogan fram eastsæ oð westsæ; & him nænig
wiðstod.
 12.52.25. Ne wæs ungelic wræcc þam ðe iu Chaldeas
bærndon Hierusaleme weallas & ða cynelican getimbro mid fyre fornaman
for ðæs Godes folces synnum.
 12.52.27. Swa þonne her fram þære arleasan ðeode,
hwæðere rihte Godes dome, neh ceastra gehwylce & land forheregeode
wæron.
 12.52.29. Hruran, & feollan cynelico getimbro & anlipie:
& gehwær sacerdas & mæssepreostas betwih wibedum wæron
slægene & cwylmde: biscopas mid folcum buton ænigre are sceawunge
ætgædere mid iserne & lige fornumene wæron.
 12.52.33. & ne wæs ænig se ðe bebyrignysse sealde þam
ðe swa hreowlice acwealde wæron.
 12.54.1. & monige ðære earman lafe on westenum fanggene
wæron & heapmælum sticode.
 12.54.2. Sume for hungre heora feondum on hand eodon & ecne
þeowdom geheton, wiðþon þe him mon andlifne forgefe: sume ofer sæ
sarigende gewiton: sume forhtiende in eðle gebidon, & þearfende lif in
wuda & in westenum & in hean cleofum sorgiende mode symle dydon.
 12.54.7. Ond þa æfter þon þe se here wæs ham hweorfende
& heo hæfdon utamærede þa bigengan þisses ealondes, ða ongunnon
heo sticcemælum mod & mægen monian; & forðeodon of þæm
deaglum stowum, þe heo ær in behydde wæron, & ealra anmodre
geþafunge heofonrices fultomes him wæron biddende, þæt heo oð
forwyrd æghwær fordilgode ne wæron.
 12.54.12. Wæs in ða tid heora heretoga & latteow
Ambrosius, haten oðre noman Aurelianus.
 12.54.13. Wæs god mon & gemetfæst, Romanisces cynnes
mon.
 12.54.14. In þisses monnes tid mod & mægen Brettas
onfengon: & he heo to gefeohte forðgecegde & him sige geheht: &
heo eac on þam gefeohte þurh Godes fultom sige onfengon.
 12.54.17. & þa of þære tide hwilum Brettas, hwilum eft
Seaxan sige geslogon oð þæt ger ymbsetes þære Beadonescan dune,
þa heo micel wæl on Ongolcynne geslogon, ymb feower & feowertig wintra
Ongolcynnes cymes in Breotone.
 13.54.21. Ða wæs æfter forðyrnendre tide ymb fif hund
wintra & tu & hundnigontig wintra from Cristes hidercyme; Mauricius
casere feng to rice & þæt hæfde an & twentig wintra.
 13.54.23. Se wæs feorða eac fiftegum from Augusto.
 13.54.24. Ðæs caseres rices ðy teoðan geare Gregorius se
halga wer, se wæs on lare & on dæde se hehsta, feng to biscophade
þære Romaniscan cyrican & þæs apostolican seðles: &
þæt heold & reahte þreotteno ger & syx monað & tyn dagas.
 13.54.27. Se wæs mid godcundre inbryrdnesse monad þy
feowertegeðan geare þæs ylcan caseres, ymb fiftig wintra &
hundteontig Ongolcynnes hidercymes in Breotone, ðæt he sende Agustinum
& oðre monige munecas mid hine Drihten ondredende bodian Godes word
Ongolþeode.
 13.54.32. Þa hyrsumodon heo þæs biscopes bebodum to þæm
gemyngedan weorce, ond feran ongunnon & sumne dæl þæs weges gefaren
hæfdon, ða ongunnon heo forhtigan & ondredan him þone siðfæt,
& þohton þæt him wislicra & gehæledra wære, þæt heo
ma ham cerdon, þonne heo þa elreordan þeode & þa reðan & þa
ungeleafsuman, þara þe heo furðum gereorde ne cuþon, gesecan scolde.
 13.56.5. & þis gemænelice him to ræde gecuron.
 13.56.6. Ond þa sona sendon Agustinum to þæm papan, þone
þe him to biscope gecoren hæfde, gif heora lar onfongen wære, þæt
he scolde eaðmodlice for heo þingian, þæt heo ne þorfte in swa
frecne siðfæt & in swa gewinfulne & in swa uncuðe
elþeodignesse faran.
 13.56.10. Þa sende Sanctus Gregorius ærendgewrit him to, &
heo trymede & lærde in þam gewrite þæt heo eaðmodlice ferde in
þæt weorc þæs Godes wordes & getreowde in Godes fultum; &
þæt heo ne fyrhte þæt gewiin þæs siðfætes ne wyrgcweodulra
monna tungan ne bregde: ac þæt hi mid ealre geornfulnysse & mid Godes
lufan ða god gefremede þe hi þurh Godes fultum doon ongunnon: &
þæt hi wiston þæt ðæt micle gewin mare wuldor eces edleanes
æfterfyligde: & he ælmihtigne God bæd þæt he hi mid his gife
gescylde: & þæt he him seolfum forgeafe þæt he moste ðone
wæstm heora gewinnes in heofona rices wuldre geseon, forðon he gearo
wære in þam ylcan gewinne mid him beon, gif him lefnys seald wære.
 13.56.22. Ða wæs gestrangod Agustinus mid trymnysse þæs
eadigan fæder Gregorius mid ðam Cristes þeowum, ða þe mid him
wæron; & hwearf eft on þæt weorc Godes word to læranne & com
on Breotone.
 14.56.25. Ða wæs on þa tid Æðelbyrht cyning haten on
Centrice, & mihtig: he hæfde rice oð gemæro Humbre streames, se
tosceadeð suðfolc Angelþeode & norðfolc.
 14.56.27. Þonne is on eastewardre Cent mycel ealand Tenet,
þæt is syx hund hida micel æfter Angelcynnes æhte.
 14.56.29. Þæt ealond tosceadeð Wantsumo stream fram þam
togeþeoddan lande.
 14.56.30. Se is þreora furlunga brad: & on twam stowum is
oferfernes, & æghwæþer ende lið on sæ.
 14.58.1. On þyssum ealande com upp se Godes þeow Agustinus
& his geferan; wæs he feowertiga sum.
 14.58.3. Noman hi eac swylce him wealhstodas of Franclande mid, swa
him Sanctus Gregorius bebead.
 14.58.4. & þa sende to Æþelbyrhte ærenddracan &
onbead, þæt he of Rome come & þæt betste ærende lædde;
& se þe him hyrsum beon wolde, buton tweon he gehet ecne gefean on
heofonum & toweard rice butan ende mid þone soþan Gode & þone
lifigendan.
 14.58.8. Ða he þa se cyning þas word gehyrde, þa het he hi
bidan on þæm ealonde, þe hi upp comon: & him þider hiora þearfe
forgeafon, oð þæt he gesawe hwæt he him don wolde.
 14.58.11. Swylce eac ær þam becwom hlisa to him þære
cristenan æfestnesse, forþon he Cristen wif hæfde, him gegyfen of
Francena cyningcynne, Byrhte wæs haten.
 14.58.13. Þæt wif he onfeng fram hyre yldrum þære
arednesse, þæt hio his leafnesse hæfde þæt heo þone þeaw
þæs Cristenan geleafan & hyre æfestnesse ungewemmedne healdan moste
mid þy biscope, þone þe hi hyre to fultome þæs geleafan sealdon,
þæs nama wæs Leodheard.
 14.58.18. Ða wæs æfter monegum dagum, þæt se cyning
com to þam ealonde, & het him ute setl gewyrcean; & het Agustinum mid
his geferum þider to his spræce cuman.
 14.58.21. Warnode he him þy læs hie on hwylc hus to him
ineodan; breac ealdre healsunge, gif hie hwylcne drycræft hæfdon þæt
hi hine oferswiðan & beswican sceolden.
 14.58.23. Ac hi nalæs mid deofulcræfte ac mid godcunde
mægene gewelgade coman: bæron Cristes rode tacen, sylfrene Cristes mæl
mid him & anlicnesse Drihtnes Hælendes on brede afægde &
awritene, & wæron haligra naman rimende, & gebedo singende; somod
for hiora sylfra ecre hælo & þara þe hi to comon to Drihtne
þingodon.
 14.58.27. Þa het se cyning hie sittan, & hie swa dydon; &
hi sona him lifes word ætgædere mid eallum his geferum, þe þær
ætwæron, bodedon & lærdon.
 14.60.1. Þa ondswarede se cyning & þus cwæð: Fæger
word þis syndon & gehat þe ge brohtan & us secgað.
 14.60.2. Ac forðon heo neowe syndon & uncuðe, ne magon we
nu gen þæt þafian, þæt we forlæten þa wisan, þe we longre
tide mid ealle Ongolþeode heoldon.
 14.60.4. Ac forðon þe ge hider feorran elþeodige cwomon ond,
þæs þe me geþuht is & gesewen, þa þing, ða ðe soð &
betst gelefdon, þæt eac swilce willadon us þa gemænsuman, nellað we
forðon eow hefige beon.
 14.60.8. Ac we willað eow eac fremsumlice in gestliðnesse
onfon, & eow ondlifen sellan & eowre þearfe forgifan.
 14.60.9. Ne we eow beweriað þæt ge ealle, ða þe ge
mægen, þurh eowre lare to eowres geleafan æfæstnisse geðeode &
gecyrre.
 14.60.11. Þa sealde se cyning him wunenesse & stowe in
Cantwara byrig, seo wæs ealles his rices ealdorburg, ond swa swa he geheht,
him ondlifen forgeaf & weoruldþearfe; ond eac swylce leafnesse sealde,
þæt heo mosten Cristes geleafan bodian & læran.
 14.60.15. Is þæt sægd, þa heo ferdon & nealehton to
ðære ceastre, swa swa heora þeaw wæs, mid þy halgan Cristes mæle
& mid onlicnesse þæs miclan cyninges usses Drihtnes Hælendes
Cristes, þæt þeosne letaniam & ontemn gehleoðre stefne sungon:
<foreign>Deprecamur te, Domine, in omni misericordia tua ut auferatur furor tuus, et
ira tua a ciuitate ista et de domo sancta tua quoniam peccauimus.</foreign>
 15.60.22. Ða wæs sona ðæs þe heo inneodon in þa
eardungstowe þe him alyfed wæs in þære cynelecan byrig, ða gunnon
heo þæt apostolice lif þære frymðelecan cyrcan onhyrgan, þæt
is, in singalum gebedum & in wæccum & in fæstenum Drihtne
þeodon; & lifes word, þæm heo meahton, bodedon & lærdon, ond
eall þing þisses middangeardes swa fremde forhogodon: ða þing aan, ða
ðe hire ondleofne nedþearfleco gesewen wæron, heo onfengon from þæm
þe heo lærdon.
 15.60.28. Æfter þon þe heo lærdon, heo sylfe þurh all
lifdon, ond heo hæfdon geara mod þa wiðerweardan ge eac swylce deað
sylfne to þrowianne for ðære soðfæstnesse, þe hy bodedon &
lærdon.
 15.60.30. Ne wæs þa elding þætte monige gelefdon &
gefulwade wæron; wæron wundriende þa bilwitnesse þæs
unsceðþendan lifes & swetnesse heora, þære heofonlican lare.
 15.62.2. Wæs bi eastan þære ceastre welneah sumo cirice in
are Sancti Martini geo geara geworht, mid þy Romani þa gyt Breotone
beeodon; in þære cirican seo cwen gewunade hire gebiddan, þe we ær
cwædon þæt heo Cristen wære.
 15.62.5. In þisse cyrican ærest þa halgan lareowas ongunnon
heo somnian & singan & gebiddan & mæssesong don & men
læran & fulwian, oð þæt se cyning to geleafan gecyrred wæs,
& maran leafnisse onfengon ofer eal to læranne & circan to
timbriganne & to betanne.
 15.62.10. Þa gelamp þurh Godes gife, þæt se cyning eac
swylce betuh oþre ongon lustfullian þæt clænoste lif haligra mid
heora þam swetestan gehatum.
 15.62.12. Ond heo eac getrymedon, þæt þa soð wæron, mid
monigra heofonlicra wundra æteownesse; & he þa gefeonde wæs
gefulwad.
 15.62.14. Þa ongunnon monige dæghwamlice efstan & scyndan
to gehyranne Godes word; & hæðenesse þeaw forleton & to
ðære annesse hy geþeoddan þurh geleafan þære halgan Cristes
cirican.
 15.62.16. Þara geleafan & gehwyrfednesse is sægd þæt
se cyning swa wære efnblissende, þæt he nænne hwæðre nydde to
Cristes geleafan, ac ða ðe to geleafan & to fulwihte cerdon, þæt
he þa inwordlicor lufode, swa swa hy wæron him efnceasterwaran þæs
heofonlican rices.
 15.62.21. Forðon he geleornode from his lareowum & fram þam
ordfruman his hælo, þætte Cristes þeowdom sceolde beon wilsumlic,
nales geneðedlic.
 15.62.23. Ond he þa se cyning geaf & sealde his lareowum
gerisne stowe & setl heora hade in his aldorbyrig, & þær to sealde
heora nydðearfe in missenlicum æhtum.
 16.62.26. Betweoh ðas ðing þa se halga wer Agustinus ferde
ofer sæ, & com to Arela þære ceastre; & from Otherio þam
ærcebiscope þære ilcan ceastre æfter hæse & bebode þæs
eadigan fæder Sancte Gregorii wæs gehalgod ercebiscop Ongolþeode.
 16.62.29. & eft hwearf & ferde to Breotone; & sona
sende ærendwrecan to Rome, þæt wæs Laurentius mæssepreost &
Petrus munuc, þæt heo scoldan secgan & cyþan þam eadigan biscope
Sancte Gregorii, þætte Ongelþeod hæfde onfongen Cristes geleafan
& þætte he to biscope gehalgad wære: swylce eac be monegum socnum
& frigenessum, þa ðe him nedþearflice gesegen wæron, his
geþeahte wæs biddende.
 16.64.4. Ond he sona þara gerisne andsware onsende.
 16.64.6. <foreign>INTERROGATIONES SANCTE AGUSTINI ARCHIEPISCOPI ET
RESPONSIONES SANCTI GREGORII PAPAE URBIS ROMANORUM</foreign>.
 16.64.6. <foreign>Interrogatio I.</foreign>
 16.64.6. Ærest bi biscopum, hu hy mid heora geferum drohtian
& lifgan sculon?
 16.64.7. Oðþo in þam lacum geleafsumra, þe heo to wigbedum
& to Godes cirican bringað, hu monige dælas þara beon scyle?
 16.64.8. Ond hu biscop in cirican don scyle?
 16.64.10. <foreign>Responsio.</foreign>
 16.64.10. Cwæð he: þæt halige gewrit þæt cyðeð,
þæt me nis tweo þæt þu gearwe const, ond synderlice þæs eadgan
Paules epistola þone he wrat to Timotheo, in þam he hine geornlice tydde
& lærde, hu he in Godes huse drohtian & don scolde.
 16.64.13. Þonne is þeaw þæs apostolican seðles, þonne
heo biscopas halgiað, þæt him bebodu sellað, ond þætte ealles
þæs ondlifenes, þe him gegonge, feower dælas beon scyle, an ærest
biscope & his heorode for feorme & onfongnesse gæsta & cumena,
oðer dæl Godes þeowum, þridda þearfum, se feorða to edneowunge
& to bote Godes ciricum.
 16.64.18. Ac forðon þin broðorlicnes is in mynstres regolum
getyd & gelæred, ne scealt þu hwæþre sundor beon from þinum
geferum in Ongolcircan , seo nu gen neowan is becumen & gelæded to Godes
geleafan.
 16.64.21. Þas drohtunge & þis liif þu scealt gesettan,
þætte in fruman þære acennendan cirican wæs ussum fædrum, in
þæm nænig heora, of þam þe heo ahton, owiht his beon onsundrad
cwæð/, ac him eallum wæron eall gemæno.
 16.64.25. Gif þonne hwylce preostas & Godes þeowas synd
butan halgum hadum gesette, þa ðe heo from wiifum ahabban ne mæge, nimen
heom wiif & heora ondleofone utan onfongen.
 16.66.1. Forðon bi ðæm ilcum fædrum, bi ðæm we
foresprecende wæron, awriten is, þæt heo wæren todælende heora
weoruldgood syndrigum monnum, swa æghwylcum þearf wæs.
 16.66.3. Swylce eac be heora ondlifne is to þencenne & to
foreseonne, þæt heo godum þeawum lifgen under ciriclecum regole &
sealmas to singenne & wæccan to bigongenne, & from eallum
unalyfednessum heora heortan & tungan & lichoman Gode ælmihtegum
clæne healden.
 16.66.7. Þæm lifiendum þonne in gemænum life hwæt is
us to sprecenne, hu heo heora ælmessedæle oðþe gestliðnesse bigonge
& mildheortnesse fyllen?
 16.66.9. Mid þy eall, þætte ofer bið to lafe on heora
weoruldspedum, arfæstum & godum is to reccenne & to sellenne, swa
swa ealra magister Drihten Crist lærde & cwæð: <foreign>Quod superest, date
elemosynam et ecce omnia munda sunt vobis:</foreign> ðætte ofer seo & to lafe,
sellað ælmesse, & eow beoð eal clæno.
 16.66.15. <foreign>INTERROGATIO II.</foreign>
 16.66.15. Mid þy an geleafa is & seondon missenlice gewunan
ciricena, oðer gewuna is mæssesonga in þære halgan Romaniscan cirican
& oðer is hæfd in Gallia rice.
 16.66.18. <foreign>RESPONSIO.</foreign>
 16.66.18. Ðu seolfa const þeaw & gewunan þære
Romaniscan cirican in þære þu afeded wære.
 16.66.19. Ac me nu þynceð & bet licað, þætte swa
hwæt swa þu oðþo in Romana cirican oðþo in Gallia oðþo in
hwylcre oðerre hwæt þæs gemætte, þætte ælmeahtegum Gode ma
licie, þæt þu bihygdelice þæt geceose ond in Ongolðeode cirican
fæstlice to healdenne gesette, seo nu gena is neowu in geleafan.
 16.66.24. Forðon ne seondon to lufienne þa wiisan fore stowum,
ac fore godum wisum stowe seondon to lufienne.
 16.66.25. Forþon of syndrigum ciricum gehwylcum þa ðu
æfest & good & riht geceose, þa ðu togædre gesomna, & on
Ongolþeode mod in gewunan asete.
 16.66.28. <foreign>INTERROGATIO III.</foreign>
 16.66.28. Ic þec halsio, hwylc wiite sceal þrowian, swa hwylc
swa hwæthugu of cirican þurh stale ut abrygdeð?
 16.68.1. <foreign>RESPONSIO.</foreign>
 16.68.1. Ðis mæg geþencan þin broðorlicnes of þæs
þeofes hade, hu he geriht beon mægge.
 16.68.2. Forðon sume syndon þa ðe habbað woruldspede &
hwæðre stale fremmað, sume seondon þa þe in þisse wiisan þurh
wæðelnesse agyltað.
 16.68.4. Forðon is ned þætte sume mid woningum sume
þearlicor, sume liðelecor, synd gerehte.
 16.68.5. Ond þeah ðe þæt wiite hwene heardor &
strongor don sy, þonne is hit of lufan to donne, nales of welme ne of
hatheortnesse.
 16.68.7. Forðon þæm menn þurh þa þrea þis bið
gegearwod, þæt he ne sy seald þæm ecan fyrum helle tintreges.
 16.68.9. Forþon þys gemete we sculon men þreagean, swa swa
ða goodan fædras gewuniað heora flæslecu bearn, þa heo for heora
synnum þreageaþ & swingað; ond hwæðre þa seolfan, þe heo mid
þam wiitum þreagað & swencað, lufiað eac & wilniað him to
ærfeweardum to habbenne; & heora weoruldgod, þa heo agan, him
healdað þa ðe heo geare gesegene beoð eahtan & witnian.
 16.68.15. Forðon seo lufu is a in þæm moode to haldanne,
& hit þæt gemet þara þrea dihtað & findeð, swa ðætte
þæt mod buton rihtum regole allinga nowiht deð.
 16.68.17. Eac swylce þu toætectest in þinre frignesse, hu
ða þing mon geldan sceolde, þa ðe mid stale of cirican afyrred
wære.
 16.68.19. Ac feor þæt la sy, þætte Godes cirice mid
æteacnesse onfo, þæt heo gesegen bið of eorðlicum þingum
anforlæten, & heo bi idlum þingum weoruldgestreon sece.
 16.68.22. <foreign>INTERROGATIO IIII.</foreign>
 16.68.22. Hwæðer moton twegen æwe gebroðor twa geswustor
in gesinscipe onfon, þa ðe beoð feorr heora cneorisse from him acende?
 16.68.24. <foreign>RESPONSIO.</foreign>
 16.68.24. Ðis mot beon swa; & eallum gemetum þæt is
alyfed.
 16.68.24. Forðon nis ower gemeted in halgum bocum, þætte
þisse frignesse wærword sy gesegen.
 16.68.27. <foreign>INTERROGATIO V.</foreign>
 16.68.27. Oð hwelce cneorisse sculon cristne men mid heora
mægum him betweohn in gesinscipe geþeodde beon?
 16.68.28. & steopmodrum & broðorwiifum ac þæt alyfed
is, þæt heo moten in gesinscipe gegadrode beon?
 16.70.3. <foreign>RESPONSIO.</foreign>
 16.70.3. Cwæð he: sum eorðlic æ in þære Romaniscan
cynnewisan forlæteð, þætte oððe broðor oðþe sweostor
oððe twegra gebroðra bearn oððe twegea gesweostra sunu & dohtor
gemengde wæren in gesinscipe.
 16.70.6. Ac we þæt cuðlice oncneowon & ongeton,
þætte þæt tuddur growan ne weaxan meahte of swylcum gesinscipe; ond
seo halige æ bewereð & forbeodeð þa scondlicnesse onwreon
mægsibba.
 16.70.9. Forðon is ned, þætte cristene men in þære
þriddan cneorisse oððe in þære feorðan him betweohn wifian scyle,
forþon seo æftere cneoris, þe we forecwædon, alle gemete is to
forbeorenne & to forlætenne.
 16.70.12. Hefig maan is & godfrecnis þæt mon hine menge
mid his steopmeder, forðon in Godes æ is awriten: <foreign>Turpitudinem patris tui
non reuelabis:</foreign> Ne onwreoh þu scondlicnesse þines fæder.
 16.70.15. Ac forðon þe awriten is: <foreign>Erunt duo in carne una:</foreign>
wer & wiif, heo tu beoð in anum lichoman, ono se ðe geðyrstigað
onwreon þa sceondlicnesse his steopmeder, seo an lichoma mid his fæder
wæs, hwæt se soðlice onwriið his fæder scondlicnesse.
 16.70.18. Swelce is eac bewered þæt mon hine menge wið his
broðorwiife, forðon þurh þa ærran geþeodnesse heo wæs geworden
his broðor lichoma.
 16.70.21. For þære wiisan eac swilce Iohannes se Baptista
wæs heafde becorfen & halige martirdome his liif geendade, þa he þam
cyninge sægde, þæt him alyfed nære þæt he his broðor wiif
brohte & hæfde.
 16.70.24. Ac forðon monige seondon on Ongolðeode, þa þe mid
þy heo þa gena in ungeleafsumnesse wæron, þissum maanfullum
gesinscipum wæron gemengde sægde ac heo seondon to monienne, nu heo to
geleafan cwomon, þæt heo ahebban heo from swylcum unrihtum, & ongyten
þætte þæt is hefig synn, ond him ondræden þone forhtiendan Godes
dom, þy læs heo for flæsclicre lufan tintrego ecre cwealmnisse onfoon.
 16.70.30. Ne seondon heo hwæðre for þisse wiisan to
biscergenne gemænsumnisse Cristes lichoman & blodes, þy læs on him
gesegen sy þa ðing onwrecen beon, in þæm heo þurh unwisnesse
gesyngodon ær fulwihtes bæðe.
 16.70.33. Forðon in þas tid seo halige cirice sumu þing
þurh welm receð, sumu þurh monþwærnesse aræfneð, sumu þurh
sceawunge ældeð, & swa abireð & ældeð, þætte oft
þæt wiðerworde yfel abeorende & ældend bewereð.
 16.72.4. Ealle, þa þe to Cristes geleafan becumað, seondon to
monienne, þæt heo nowiht swelces ne durron gefremman.
 16.72.5. Gif hwylc þonne ofer þæt gefremmen, þonne seondon
heo to bescyrienne Cristes lichoman & blodes.
 16.72.7. Forðon, swa swa bi þam monnum is hwæthwugu to
aræfnenne, þa ðurh unwisnesse synne fremmað, swa þonne is stronglice
to ehtenne, þa ðe him ne ondrædað weotonde syngian.
 16.72.10. <foreign>INTERROGATIO VI.</foreign>
 16.72.10. Gif micel feornis siiðfætes betweohn ligeð,
þætte bisceopas æþelice cuman ne magon, hwæðer mot biscop halgad
beon buton oðera biscopa ondweardnesse?
 16.72.13. <foreign>RESPONSIO.</foreign>
 16.72.13. Soðlice in Ongolcirican, in þære þu ana nu gena
eart biscop gemeted, ne meaht þu on oðre wisan biscop halgian buton oðrum
biscopum.
 16.72.15. Ac þe sculon of Gallia rice biscopas cuman, þa þe
æt biscopes halgunge in witscipe stonde.
 16.72.16. Forþon ne sceal biscopa halgung on oðre wisan weosan,
nemne in gesomnung & in gewitscipe þreora oðþe feower biscopa,
þæt heo fore his gehælde þæm ælmihtigan Gode ætgædre
heora bene & gebedo senden & geoten.
 16.72.20. <foreign>INTERROGATIO VII.</foreign>
 16.72.20. Hu sculon we don mid Gallia & Bretta biscopum?
 16.72.21. <foreign>RESPONSIO.</foreign>
 16.72.21. In Gallia biscopum ne sellað we þe ænge
aldorlicnesse, forþon þe fram þam ærran tidum minra foregengena
pallium onfeng se biscop in Areela þære byrig, þone we ne sculon
bescerian ne beneoman þære onfongnan aldorlicnesse.
 16.72.24. Ac gif þe foor gelimpe in Gallia mægðe, hafa ðu
mid þone ilcan biscop sprece & geþeahte hwæt to donne sy, oðþo
gif hwelc uncyste in biscopum gemette syn, hu þa gerehte & gebette beon
scylen.
 16.74.1. Ond gif wen sy, þæt he in strengo þeodscipes &
þrea to wlæc sy, þonne is he to onbærnenne & to gebetenne mid
þinre broðorlicnesse lufan, ond þætte he, þa ðe wiðerworde
seondon þære hæse & bebodum usses sceppendes, from biscopa þeawum
bewerge.
 16.74.5. Ne meaht þu deman Gallia biscopas buton heora agenre
aldorlicnesse, ac þu hy a scealt liðelice monigan & him æteawan
þinra godra weorca onhyrenesse.
 16.74.7. Alle Bretta biscopas we bebeodað þinre
broðorlicnesse, to ðon þætte unlærde seon gelærede, &
untrume mid þinre trymenisse syn gestrongade, & unrehte mid þinre
aldorlicnesse seon gerehte.
 16.74.11. <foreign>INTERROGATIO VIII.</foreign>
 16.74.11. Hwæðer sceal geeacnad wiif fulwad beon oðþe
æfter þon þe heo bearn cenneð?
 16.74.12. Oðþe æfter hu micelre tide mot heo in circan
gongan?
 16.74.13. Oðþo eac swylce þætte bearn þæt heo cende,
þy læs hit seo mid deaðe fornumen, æfter hu feola daga alefað him
þæm geryne onfoon fulwihtes bæðes?
 16.74.15. Oðþe æfter hu micelre tiide mot þæm wiife
hire wer in lichoman gegadrunge geþeoded beon?
 16.74.16. Oðþe gif wiif numen sy in monaðaðle gewunan,
hwæðer alefað hire in circan gongan oðþe þæm geryne onfoon
þære halgan gemænsumnesse?
 16.74.19. Oðþe se wer, se ðe his wiife gemenged bið,
ærþon he bibaðod sy, mot he in circan gongan oððe to ðæm geryne
þære halgan gemænsumnesse?
 16.74.21. All þas þing þære neowan ðeode Ongolcynnes in
Godes geleafan gedafenað cuð habban.
 16.74.23. <foreign>RESPONSIO.</foreign>
 16.74.23. Forhwon ne sceal þæt geeacnade wiif fulwad beon, mid
þy nis beforan Godes ælmihtiges eagum ænig synn wæstmbeorendes
lichoman?
 16.74.25. Forþon mid þy usse ealdras, þa ærestan men, in
neorxna wonge agylton, þa forluran hy rehte Godes dome þa undeaðlicnesse
, þe heo onfengon & in gescepene wæron.
 16.74.27. Ono hwæt þa se ilca ælmihtega God monna cyn
allinga adwæscan ne wolde for heora synne, he ða þæm menn
undeaðlicnesse onweg ahof ofer his synne, & hwæðre for fremsumnesse
his arfæstnesse him geheold wæstmbeorennisse tudres.
 16.76.1. Ono þætte þære menniscan gecynde of
ælmehteges Godes gefe gehealden wæs, hwelce rehte mæg þonne bewered
beon from gife þæs halgan fulwihtes?
 16.76.3. In þæm geryne, þe bið æghwylc synn grundinga
adwæsced, swiðe dyslic is þætte scyle þære godcundan gife
wiðcweden beon.
 16.76.5. Ðu frugne eac swylce, þonne wiif cennende wære,
æfter hu feola daga heo moste in circan gongan.
 16.76.6. Hwæt þu þæt seolfa leornadest in bebode
þære aldan cyðnesse, þætte fore wæpnedbearne heo sceolde heo
ahabban from Godes huses ingonge þreo & þritig daga, fore wiifcilde syx
& syxtig daga.
 16.76.9. Þæt is hwæðre to weotanne, þætte þæt
is on gastlicum geryne ongyten.
 16.76.10. Forþon þeah þe heo in þa ilcan tiid, þe heo
acenned hæbbe, Gode þoncunge to donne in circan gonge, ne bið heo mid
nænige synne byrðenne ahefigad.
 16.76.13. Forþon se willa þæs lichoman bið in synne, nales
þæt saar þære cennisse: in þæs lichoman gemengednesse bið
willa , þonne in þæs tudres forðlædnisse bið gooung & sar.
 16.76.15. Bi ðon þære ærestan meder ealles moncynnes
wæs cweden: <foreign>In dolore paries:</foreign> in saare þu cennest bearn.
 16.76.17. Ono gif we beweriað þæt acennende wiif, þæt
heo ne mot in circan gongan, hwæt we þonne þæt seolfe sar & wiite
hire in synne tellað.
 16.76.19. Fulwian þonne þæt cennende wiif oðþe þæt
bearn þæt þær acenned bið, gif heo syn þreade mid frecernisse
deaðes, ge heo in þa seolfan tiid þe heo cenneð ge þæt þær
acenned bið, nænige gemete is bewered.
 16.76.22. Forþon seo geofu þæs halgan gerynes, swa swa
lifgendum & þæm ongeotendum mid micle gesceade is to forseonne, swa
þonne, þæm þe se deað tobeotað, buton ænigre ældenne is to
gebeorenne & to gefremmenne, þy læs gif hwylc lytel ælding sy,
þætte ne mægge gemeted beon se ðe alesed si.
 16.76.27. To hire gerestscipe þonne hire wer ne sceal gongan,
ær þon þæt acennde bearn from meolcum awened sy.
 16.76.28. Ac unriht gewuna wel hwær is arisen betweoh
gesinhiwum, þætte wiif forhycgað heora bearn fedan, þa ðe heo
cennað, & heo oðrum wiifum to fedenne sellað.
 16.76.31. Þæt is þonne gesegen gemeted fore intingan
unforhæfdnisse anre, forþon, þonne heo ne willað ahabban from heora
werum, þætte heo forhycgað fedan þa ðe heo cennað.
 16.76.33. Ono þas wiif, þa ðe heora bearn of unrihtum gewunum
oðrum to fedenne sellað, nemne seo clæsnunge tiid forðgeleore, ne
sceolon heo heora werum gemengde beon.
 16.78.2. Þa þe þonne in gewunan monaðaðle numene beoð,
butan beorðres intingan, heo wæron bewered heora weorum gemengde beon, swa
ðætte seo halige æ mid deaðe slæhð, gif hwylc wæpnedmon
gongeð to monaðaðlium wiife.
 16.78.5. Hwæðre þæt wiif, mid þy heo þone gewunan
þrowað monaðaðle, ne sceal heo bewered beon þæt heo mote in circan
gongan; forðon seo oferflownis þæs gecyndes hire ne mæg in synne
geteled beon, & þurh þæt þe heo þurh nead þrowað, nis
þæt reht þæt heo sy bescyred from Godes circan ingonge.
 16.78.10. Hwæt we weotan & leorniað in Cristes bocum,
þætte þæt wiif, þe wæs þrowiende blodes flownisse, heo
eaðmodlice wæs cumende æfter Drihtnes bæce & gehran þæt
fæs his hrægles, & sona instæpe hire untrymnes onweg gewat &
heo wæs hal geworden.
 16.78.14. Ono nu þæt wiif in blodes flownesse geseted
hergendlice meahte Drihtnes hrægle gehrinan, forhwon þonne, se þe
blodryne þrowað monaðaðle, ne alefað hire in Drihtnes cirican
gongan?
 16.78.17. Ac þu cwist nu: Heo nedde hire untrymnesse þæt heo
Cristes hrægle gehrine; þas wiif, bi þæm we sprecað, gelomlic
gewuna getiið.
 16.78.19. Ono geþenc, broþor þu leofesta, þætte eal,
þe we þrowiað in þissum deaðlican lichoman, is of untrymnesse
þæs gecyndes rehte Godes dome geendebyrdad.
 16.78.21. Wæs æfter synne þæs ærestan monnes,
forðon hyngran, þyrstan, hatian, calan, wærigian, al þæt is of
untrymnesse þæs gecyndes.
 16.78.23. Ond hwæt elles is to secenne wið þæm hungre
nemne ondlifen, wið þurst drync, wið hæto celnis, wið cyle hrægl,
wið werignesse reste, wið untrymnesse lacedom secan.
 16.78.26. Hwæt wiifum heora monaðaðle blodes flownes bið
untrymnis.
 16.78.27. Ono nu þæt wiif wel geþyrstgade, þætte
Drihtnes hrægle in aðle geseted gehran, þætte anum untrumum hade
wæs forgifen, forhwon ne sceal þæt eallum wiifum beon forgyfen, þa
ðe mid uncyste heora gecyndes beoð geuntrumade.
 16.78.30. Swelce eac in þæm ilcum dagum ne sceal him bewered
beon þæm geryne onfon þære halgan gemænsumnesse.
 16.78.32. Gif þonne for micelre arwyrðnesse hwylc mon ne
geþyrstgað onfon, se is to herienne; ac gif he onfehð, nis he to
demenne.
 16.78.34. Forðon þara godra mooda & monna þeaw bið,
þæt heo þær hwilum synne ongeotað, þær þe syn ne bið,
& oft buton synne bið doen, þætte of synne cymeð: swa swa þæt
is, þonne us eac hyngreð, þæt we etað buton synne, & us þæt
wæs geworden of synne þæs ærestan monnes, þæt us eac hyngran
meahte.
 16.80.3. Forþon swa swa bi þæm aldan þeodscipe þa
utteran weorc wæron bihealden, swa in þæm neowan þeodscipe, nales swa
swiðe þætte utan doen bið, swa þætte innan þoht bið,
bihygdelice is behealden.
 16.80.7. Forþon, mid þy seo æ monig þing bewereð to
etanne, swa swa unclæne, hwæðre in godspelle Drihten cwæð: Nales
þætte ingongeð in muð monnan besmiteð, ac þa ðe utgongað of
muðe, þa seondan þe þone monnan besmiteð.
 16.80.10. & wene æfter þon wæs þæt areccende &
cwæð: Of heortan utgongað yfele geþohtas.
 16.80.11. Þær genihtsumlice is gesægd, þætte þæt
from þæm ælmihtegum Gode unclæne & besmiten æteawed bið in
weorce beon, þætte of wyrtruman besmitenes geþohtes & unclænes
acenned bið.
 16.80.14. Bi þon swelce Paulus se apostol cwæð: Eall bið
clæne clænum: þæm besmitenum & ungeleafsumum noht bið
clæne.
 16.80.16. & he sona se apostol þone intingan þære ilcan
besmitenesse wæs gesecgende, & æftercwæð: Forðon bismiten
syndon ge heora mod ge ingewitnis.
 16.80.19. Ono nu nu þæm mete ne bið clæne, þam þet
mod ne bið clæne, forhwon þonne þæt wiif þæt heo clæne mode
of gecynde þrowað, sceal hire in unclænnesse geteled beon?
 16.80.22. Se wer, se þe mid his agene wiife bið slæpende,
nemne he mid wætre aþwegen & bibaðod sy, ne sceal he in circan
gongan, ne, þeah þe he bibaðod si, sona mot ingongan.
 16.80.24. Forþon seo æ bibead þæm aldan Godes folce,
þætte se wer, se ðe wære his wiife gemenged, þæt he sceolde
wætre aðwegen & bebaðad beon, & ær sunnan setlgonge ne moste
in heora gesomnunge ingongan.
 16.80.27. Þæt hwæðre mæg gastlice ongyten beon;
forþon wer bið wiife gemenged, þonne unalyfedre willunge monnes mood in
geþohte þurh lustfulnesse bið geþeoded.
 16.80.30. Forþon, nemne ær þæt fyr þære unrehtan
willunge from þam mode acolie, ne sceal he hine wyrðne telgan broðra
& Godes þeowa gesomnunge, seðe hine gesiið hefigadne beon þurh
yfelnesse unrehtes willan.
 16.80.33. Þeah þe bi þisse wisan missenleco cynn monna
missenlice ongete & halde, hwæðre symble wæs Romana gewuna from
heora yldrum æfter gemængnisse agenes wiifes , þæt heo clæsnunge
bæðes & þweales sohton, & from cirican ingonge hwylchwugu fæc
arwyrðlice ahabban.
 16.82.3. Þeah þe we þas þing cweðe, ne tellað we synne
weosan gesinscipe; ac forðon seo alefde gemængnis wiifes buton willan
þæs lichoman ne mæg beon, from ingonge þære halgan stowe is to
ahaabbenne; forðon se seolfa willa nænge þinga buton synne beon mæg.
 16.82.7. Ne wæs acenned of unrehthæmde ne þurh dyrne
forlegenesse, ac acenned wæs of ælicum gesinscipe, se ðe cwæð:
<foreign>Ecce enim in iniquitatibus conceptus sum et in delictis peperit me mater mea:</foreign>
ic wat þæt ic wæs in wænessum geeacnod & in scyldum mec cende
min modor.
 16.82.11. Ono he wiste hine in wenessum geeacnade, he þa geomrade
hine from scylde acennedne.
 16.82.13. Forðon he bær þa wætan þære uncyste in
þæm telgan, þone he geteah ær of þam wyrtruman.
 16.82.14. Hwæðre in þam wordum is sweotol, þæt he
wenesse nemde, nales þa gemengnisse þæs gesinscipes, ac þone seolfan
willan þære gemengnisse.
 16.82.17. Forðon gedafenað, þætte seo ælice gegadrung
lichoman seo for intingan tudres, nales þæs willan, & seo gemengnes
þæs flæsces seo for intingan bearna to cennenne, nales cwemnis
uncysta.
 16.82.19. Swa hwelc mon swa his wiif, nales for unrehtæs willan
willunge, ac for intingan anum bruceð to streonne, þes mon is his seolfes
dome to forlætenne, oððe be cirican ingonge, oðþe to onfonne
þæm geryne Cristes lichoman & his blode; forþon we him ne sculon
biwerigan þam halgan geryne onfon, se ðe in fyre geseted bið &
beornan ne conn.
 16.82.25. Mid þy þonne seo lufu ne bið tudres to tilienne, ac
se willa ma wealdeð in þæm weorce þære gemengnisse, þonne
habbað þa gesinhiwan ðearfe be heora gemengdnesse, þæt hi wepen
& hreowe don.
 16.82.28. Forðon seo halige laar him þis forgifeð, &
hwæðre be þære seolfan forgifenesse mid ege þæt mood
instyreð.
 16.82.30. Forðon se apostol Sanctus Paulus mid ðy cwæð,
<foreign>Qui se continere non potest, habeat uxorem suam,</foreign> se ðe hine ahabban ne
mæg, hæbbe his wiif, he ða sona se apostol underðeodde &
æftercwæð: <foreign>Hoc autem dico secundum indulgentiam, non secundum
imperium:</foreign> ðis ic cweðo æfter forgifnesse, nales æfter bebodo.
 16.82.34. Forþon ne bið þæt forgifen, þætte alefed
bið, ac þæt bið riht.
 16.84.1. Ðætte he cwæð bi þære forgifnesse, þa
æteawde he ðær synne weosan.
 16.84.2. Mid wæccre moode is to smeageanne & to
geþencenne, þæt, þa he Drihten wolde his folc gesprecende beon in
Sinai dune, he þa ærest bebead, þæt heo heora hrægl woosce &
clænsode & heo from wiifum ahæfde.
 16.84.6. Ono nu in þære stowe, þær þe Drihten wæs
þurh þa underðeoddan gesceafte to monnum spreocende, mid swa micle
forseonesse wæs þæ lichoman clænnisse asoht, þæt, þa ðe
Godes worde onfengon, ne sceoldon wiifum gemengde beon, micle ma þonne þa
wiif, ða ðe ælmehteges Drihtnes lichoman onfooð, in him seolfum sculon
lichoman clænnisse healdan, þy læs heo mid þa seolfan micelnisse
þæs ungeæhtendlican gerynes hefigade syn.
 16.84.12. Swelce eac bi þisse wisan to Dauide þurh þone
sacerd wæs cweden be his geferum, þætte, gif heo fram wifum clæne
wæren, þæt heo moston onfoon & þicgan þa foresetenesse hlafes,
þa ðe mid him halige wæron, þa heo eallinga onfoon ne þycgan moston,
ær þon Dauit ondete heo fram wiifum clæne beon.
 16.84.17. Þonne se wer, se ðe æfter his wiifes gemengnisse
wætre aþwegen & bibaðod bið, he mot þam geryne onfon þære
halgan gemænsumnesse, mid þy him eac alyfed bið, swa we ær cwædon,
in cirican gongan.
 16.84.21. <foreign>INTERROGATIO VIIII.</foreign>
 16.84.21. Hwæðer æfter bysmrunge, seo þurh slæp
wæpnedmonnum gelimpeð, oððo Drihtnes lichoman ænig onfoon mot,
oðþo, gif hit sacerd bið, mot he þa halgan geryno mærsian
mæssesonga?
 16.84.24. <foreign>RESPONSIO.</foreign>
 16.84.24. Ðeosne mon eac swylce seo cyðnis þære ealdan
æ bismiten cwið, swa we ær in þæm uferan kapitule cwædon, &
him ne forgifeð þætte he mote in Godes hus gongan, nemne he sy wætre
aðwegen, ne þonne gena ær æfenne.
 16.84.27. Þæt hwæðre on oðre wisan þæt gastlice
folc is ongeotonde under þam ilcan ondgete, þe we foresprecende wæron.
 16.84.29. Forðon se mon bið bismrad swa swa þurh swefn, se
ðe costad bið mid unclænnesse, ond þonne mid soðum onlicnessum in
geþohte bið bismiten.
 16.84.31. Ac he is mid wætre to aþweanne, þæt is,
þæt he þa synne þæs geþohtes mid tearum aþwea, & nemne
ær þæt fyr þære costunge gewitee, þæt he hine scyldigne
ongete swa swa oð æfentiid.
 16.86.3. Ac hwæðre is on þære ilcan bysmrunge swiðe
nedþearflic gescead, þa we smealice geþencan sculon, of hwylcre wisan
þæm moode hit gegonge þæs slæpendan.
 16.86.6. Forðon hwilum hit gelimpeð of oferfylle, hwilum of
þæs gecyndes oferflownesse & untrumnisse, hwilum of geþohte.
 16.86.7. Ond þonne hit of þæs gecyndes oferflownesse &
untrumnesse becymeð, ealle gemete þeos bysmrung nis to ondrædenne, mid
þy þæt mood þis ne weotende aræfneð; forþon heo is ma to
sorgienne, þonne to gefremmenne.
 16.86.11. Mid þy heo þonne gelimpeð seo bysmrung for
oferfyllo, þonon hafað þæt mod hwylcehugu scylde, nales hwæðre
oð bewerennisse to onfonne þæm halgan geryne, oðþe þa symbelnesse
to mærsienne mæssesonges, gif þæt ned abædeð oðþe
symbeldæg gelimpeð oððo oþer sacerd in þære stowe ne bið, se
ðe for hine þæt geryne mæssesonges gegearwie.
 16.86.16. Gif þær þonne oðre seon, þe ða þegnunge
gefyllan mægge, þonne sceal he hine eaðmodlice ahabban from
onsægdnesse þæs halgan gerynes, þæs þe ic demo.
 16.86.19. Gif þonne of scondlicum geþohte þæs wæccendan
upcymeð seo bysmrung slæpendes, hwæt þonne openað þæm moode
his scyld; forðon he gesiið from hwylcum wyrtruman seo bismitenis
forðbicwom, þæt is, þæt he wæccende þohte, þæt he
weotonde aræfnde.
 16.86.22.  Ac þonne gena is se seolfa geþoht to asmeagenne,
hwæðer he geeode þe mid scynisse þe mid lustfulnisse, oððe
hwæþer þonne gena, þæt mare is, mid gyfunge þære synne.
 16.86.25. Forþon þrim gemetum bið gefylled æghwilc syn,
þæt is, ærest þurh scynnesse, & þurh lustfullnesse, &
þurh geðafunge.
 16.86.27. Seo scynis bið þurh deoful, seo lustfulnes bið
þurh lichoman, seo geðafung þurh gast.
 16.86.28. Forðon þa ærestan synne se weriga gast scyde
þurh þa næddran, ond Euae þa swa swa lichoma wæs lustfulliende, ond
Adam heo þonne swa swa gast geþafode: ða wæs seo synn gefylled.
 16.86.31. Ond micel nedþearfnis is, þætte mid gescead
betwihan þa scynisse & þa lustfulnisse & eft betweohn þa
lustfulnisse & þa geþafunge þæt mood seolf his dema sy.
 16.86.34. Forþon mid þy se weriga gast þa synne scyeð in
moode, gif nænig lustfulnis þære synne æfterfylgeð, allum gemetum
ne bið þær syn þurhtogen.
 16.88.2. Mid þy þonne se lichoma onginneð lustfullian,
þonne onginneð þær seo syn acenned beon.
 16.88.3. Gif he þonne mid þoncmeotunge & þreodunge
geþeafað, þonne bið ongyten þær syn gefremed beon.
 16.88.5. Ond in scynisse synne, gif þæt mod bið in
lustfulnesse, þæt bið fædnis: in þafunge bið deofolfremednis: ond
þæt oft gelimpeð, þætte se weriga gast saweð in geþohte,
þætte se lichoma þæt in lustfulnesse tihð; ond hwæðre þæt
mod þære ilcan lustfulnesse ne geþafað.
 16.88.9. Ond mid þy we weoton þæt se lichoma ne mæg
lustfullian buton þam mode, hwæðre þæt seolfe mod bið winnende
wið þæm unrihtwillungum þæs lichoman: hwæt þonne þæt mod
in þæm lichomlecan lustfulnesse sume gemete þurh ned bið gebunden,
þæt hit þære lustfulnesse of þam sylfan rihte wiðcwyð, þæt
hit ne geþafige.
 16.88.14. & hwæþere mid þa lustfulnesse gebunden bið,
ac he swiðe goað & geomrað hine swa gebundenne beon.
 16.88.16. Bi ðon se mæsta cempa & se hehsta þæs
heofonlican weorodes Sanctus Paulus se apostol goiende & geomriende
cwæð: Ic geseo oðere æ in minum leomum wiðfeohtende þære æ
mines moodes, & gehæftedne mec is lædende in synne æ, seo is in
minum leomum.
 16.88.19. Ono gif he gehæfted wæs, hwæt he þonne no
feaht; ac þa he feaht, forðon he wæs gehæfted.
 16.88.21. Ono he feaht mid þa æ þæs moodes, þære
wiðfeaht seo æ, seo þe in his leomum wæs.
 16.88.22. Gif he feaht, ne wæs he gehæfted.
 16.88.23. Ono se mon bið, þæs þe swa to cweðenne sy,
æghwæðer ge gehæfted ge freo: he bið freo of þære
soðfæstnesse, þe he lufað; he bið hæfted of þære
lustfullnesse, þe bireð he geneded.
 16.88.26. Þis seondon ondsware þæs eadigan papan Sanctus
Gregorius to geþeahtunge & to frignesse þæs arwyrðan biscopes
Agustinus.
 16.88.28. Swelce Agustinus heht him eac onbeodan, þætte her
wære/ micel rip onweard & fea worhton; ond he ða sende mid þæm
foresprecenan ærendwrecan him maran fultom to godcundre lare.
 16.88.31. In þæm wæron þa ærestan & þa mæstan
Mellitus & Iustus & Paulinus & Ruffianus; ond þurh heo sende
gemænelice þa þing all, þa ðe to cirican bigonge & þegnunge
nedþearflecu wæron, huslfatu & wigbedhrægl & circan
frætwednes & biscopgegyrlan & diacongegyrlan, swylce eac þara
apostola & haligra martira reliquias & monige bec.
 16.90.4. Sende eac swylce Agustine þæm biscope pallium &
gewrit, in þam he getacnode, hu he sceolde oðre biscopas halgian & on
hwylcum stowum settan in Breotone.
 16.90.7. Sende eac swilce se eadiga papa in þa ilcan tid
Gregorius Æþelberhte cyninge ærendgewrit somed & woruldgife monige
in missenlicum mægwlitum: wolde eac þone cyning swilce mid þissum
wilwendlicum aarum wuldrigan, þæm þe he ðæs heofonlican rices
wuldor mid his gewinne & mid his lare geornnesse openede & cyðde.
 17.90.13. Ond ða Sanctus Agustinus se biscop sona, þæs þe
he þæm biscopseðle onfeng in þære cynelecan byrg, ða edneowade
& worhte mid cyninges fultome þa cirican, þe he ær geara geo
geleornade ealde Romanisce weorce geworhte beon.
 17.90.16. Ond þa in usses Drihtnes Hælendes Cristes noman
gehalgode; ond he þær him seolfum eardungstowe gesette & eallum his
æfterfylgendum.
 17.90.18. Swelce eac mynster getimbrade be eastan þære
ceastre, in þæm mid his trymnesse & lare Æðelberht se cyning
weorðlice cyrcan heht getimbran þara eadigra apostola Petri & Pauli,
& mid missenlecum geofum welgade; in þære cirican Agustinus lic &
ealra Contwarena biscopa somed ge heora cyninga geseted beon meahte.
 17.90.24. Þa cirican hwæðre nales he Agustinus, ac
Laurentius biscop his æfterfylgend heo gehalgode.
 17.90.25. Wæs se æresta abbud þæs ylcan mynstres Petrus
haten mæssepreost, se wæs eft ærendwræca sended in Gallia rice, ond
þa wæs besenced in sumne sæs sceat, se wæs haten Amfleat.
 17.90.28. & from þære stowe bigengum in uncymre byrgenne
geseted wæs.
 17.90.29. Ac se ælmihti God wolde gecyþan, hwylcre gearnunge
se halga wer wære: ond æghwelce niht ofer his byrgenne heofonlic leoht
wæs æteawed, oð þæt þa neahmen ongeton, þa hit gesawon,
þætte þæt wæs micel wer & halig mon, se ðe þær bebyrged
wæs.
 17.90.33. Ond heo ða aspyredon þæt, & hwonan he wæs:
genoman þa his lichoman, ond in Bonagia þa ceastre, æfter gerisenre are
swa miclum were & swa halgum in cyrican gesette & bebyrged wæs.
 18.92.3. Ðyssum tidum forewæs Norðanhymbra rice se
strongesta cyning & se gylpgeornesta, Æðelfrið haten.
 18.92.4. Se me allum Ongolcynnum & aldormonnum Bretta þeode
fornom & forhergade, swa efne þæs ðe meahte wiðmeten beon Saule iu
cyninge Israhela þeode, butan þæt he wæs þære godcundan
æfestnisse unwis.
 18.92.7. Ne wæs æfre ænig cyninga ne aldormonna,
þætte ma heora londa utamærde & him to gewealde underþeodde;
forðon he to gafolgyldum heo gesette Ongolþeode, oðþe of heora londum
adraf.
 18.92.10. Meahte se cwide wel beon to him geþeoded, þe Iacob se
heahfæder in Saules hade þæs cyninges cwæð, þa he his sunu
bletsode: Beniamin is risende wulf; on ærmergen he iteð hloðe & on
æfenne herereaf dæleð.
 18.92.14. Ða wæs for his fromscipe onstyred Ædan Scotta
cyning, þa ðe in Breotone eardigað; teah hine þa ferd on & cwom mid
unmæte weorode & stronge wið hine to gefeohte.
 18.92.16. Ac he hwæðre oferswiðed mid feawum onweg fleah.
 18.92.17. Wæs ðis gefeoht geworden on þære mæran stowe
þe cweden is Degsastan.
 18.92.18. Þær lytestne eal his weorud oflsegen wæs.
 18.92.19. On þam gefeohte eac swylce Ðeodbald Æþelfriþes
broþor wæs ofslægen mid ealle þy weorode þe he lædde.
 18.92.21. Þæt gefeoht Æþelfrið gefremede þy endlyftan
geare his rices, þæt he hæfde feower & twentig wintra.
 18.92.23. Þæt wæs þæt æreste gear Focatis þæs
caseres, se þe hæfde Romana rice.
 18.92.24. Siððan of þære tide nænig Sceotta cyninga ne
dorste wið Angelþeode to gefeohte cuman oð ðysne andweardan dæg.
 18.92.26. Her endað seo æreste boc & onginneð seo
oðer.
