 21.476.1. Wæs he bebyrged in Sancte Paules portice þæs
apostoles, se is in Sancte Andreas ciricean, þær he seolfa byrgenstowe
geworhte.
 21.476.3. Æfter þæm feng Aldwulf to þære
bisceopþenunge, þone Berhtwald ercebisceop gehalgode.
 21.476.6. Æfter þissum wæs ymbe seofan hund wintra &
nigon and twentig æfter þære Drihtenlican menniscnesse; æteowdon
twegen steorran ymb þa sunnan utan, þa syndon on bocum cometa nemde; &
hy mycle fyrhto onstyredon þæm monnum þe hie sceawodon & gesawon.
 21.476.10. Oðer hiora foreeode þa sunnan on morgen, þonne hio
upgangende wæs, oþer on æfenne æfterfyligde, þonne hio on setl
eode, swa swa hie witegan were grimmes wæles uppeornendre sunnan samed &
setlgongendre, þæt hi gehwæþere tide ge on dæg ge on niht micel
yfel monnum toweard tacnedon.
 21.476.14. Stod se leoma him of, swilce fyrenþecele, ongean
norðdæle middangeardes.
 21.476.15. Æteowdon hie þa steorran in Ianuarius monðe &
twa wucan awunedon.
 21.476.16. Þære tide sona æfter se hefigesta wol Sarcina
þeode Gallia rice mid sarlice wæle ond earmlice fornaman &
forhergodon; & hie sona æfter medmiclum fæce in þære ilcan
mægþe wyrþe wite onfengon & þrowedon hiora getreowleasnesse.
 21.476.20. Þy ilcan geare swilce se halga Godes wer Ecgbreht, swa
swa we beforan gemyngedon, þy seolfan Eastordæge forþferde to Drihtne;
& sona ofer þa Eastortide, þæt is <foreign>septima Idus Maias</foreign>, Osric
Norþanhymbra cyning of life gewat, æfter þon þe he þæt rice <foreign>XI</foreign>
gear hæfde & styrde.
 21.476.24. Ond he wolde & gedemed hæfde þætte Ceolwulf
æfter him cyning wære & his rices æfterfylgend.
 21.476.25. Wæs he Cenredes broþor þæs cyninges, se ær
him rice hæfde.
 21.476.26. Þæs cyninges rice ge foreweard ge forðgong swa
monegum & swa miclum styrenessum wiþerweardra ðinga yþiað &
gemengde syndon, þætte þæt mon nu geta gewitan ne mæg, hwæt be
þissum mon writan scyle, oððe hwilcne ende syndrigo þing hæbbende
seondon.
 22.476.31. Wæs þa ymb seofan hund wintra ond <foreign>XXI</foreign> æfter
þære Drihtenlican menniscnesse þætte Beorhtwald ercebisceop longre
eldo fornumen forþfered wæs þy fiftan dæge Iduum Ianuarium.
 22.478.2. Sæt he þæt bisceopsetl seofon & þritig
wintra & <foreign>VI</foreign> monað & feowertyne dagas.
 22.478.3. For þæm þy ilcan geare wæs ercebisceop geworden
Tatwine, se wæs of Myrcna mægþe.
 22.478.4. Wæs he ær mæssepreost in þæm mynstre, þe
is geceged Breodun.
 22.478.5. Wæs he gehalgod in Cantwarena byrig from þæm
arwyrþan werum Daniele Wintanceastre bisceope ond Ingwalde Lundenburge
bisceope ond Aldwine Liccetfelda bisceope ond Aldulfe Hrofesceastre biscope
þy teoþan dæge Iunius monþes; wæs Sunnandæg.
 22.478.9. Wæs se wer mære in æfæstnesse & in snytro
& in wisdome ond swylce eac in halgum gewritum æþellice intimbred
& gelæred.
 22.478.12. Seondon nu & in ondweardnesse Cantwarena ciricena
bisceopas Tatwine & Aldwulf; ond Ingeweald Eastseaxna bisceop; Eastengla
bisceopas siondon Aldberht & Heaþolac; Westseaxna bisceopas siondon
Daniel & Forðhere; Mercna bisceop is Aldwine.
 22.478.15. Ond þæm folcum þa þe eardiað be westan
Sæferne is Wealhstod bisceop.
 22.478.17. Wilfrið is Huicna bisceop.
 22.478.17. Is Cyneberht Lindesfearona bisceop.
 22.478.17. Sio biscopscir Wihte þæs ealondes belimpeþ to
Daniele Wintanceastre biscope.
 22.478.19. Suðseaxna mægð wæs wuniende fela geara butan
bisceope & him bisceopþenunge secað to Westseaxna bisceope.
 22.478.20. Ond ealle þas mægþe & eac oðre
suðmægðe oþ gemære Humbre streames mid heora cyningum eac swilce
æþelbolde Mercna cyninge in hyrsumnesse underþeodde seondon.

 22.480.1. Bryttas þonne, þeah þe hie of miclum dæle mid

Alc 14 (Forst)
B9.7.2.
Alcuin, De virtutibus et vitiis (London, British Library, MS. Cotton Tiberius A.III) Chap. 14: Forster 1909, 257-9.



 1. Be gecyrrednysse.
 1. Hit is geræd on ðam godcundan gewritum & þus his
gecweden, Sunu, ne yld þu na, þæt þu to Gode gecyrre.
 2. Forþon þu nast, hwæt se towearda dæg þe bringeð.
 3. Seþe yldeð, þæt he to Gode ne gecyrre, he renað pleoh
his agene sawle, forþonþe se deað hit no nylð.
 4. Se deað, gif he cimð to þam, þe þæt yldeð,
þæt he to Gode gecyrran ne wyle, butan tweon he hine gelædeð to ecum
witum.
 6. Þæt his swiðe unhalwendlic, geþoht, þæt wa ymb
þa mergenlican cyrringe þænce & þa andweardan agimeleasige.
 9. Gehyrest þu synfulla, to won yldest þu, þæt þu to
Gode gecyrre?
 10. For hwon ne ondrædest þu þe, þæt þe ferdeað
bereafie þæs dæges þinre gehwyrfednesse?
 11. Nast þu, þæt men færlice sweltað?
 12. Nu þa þæt god is, þæt mon his senna forlæte
& to Gode gecirre, do we wylc man hraðe.
 13. Forðonþe God us gehateð forgyfenesse, gif we to him
gecyrran willað, & he us mænigne fyrstmearc ne hateð langes lifes,
for þon gehwyrfe gehwilc man hine sylfne hraðe to Gode, & forlæte se
arleasa man his unrihtwisnesse wegas.
 17. Forþon, gif færunga cymð se ytemesta dæg, þonne
bið losod seo yldig, & þær bið to lafe þæt rice þam
synfullan men.
 18. Gif þu nelle losian, gecyr to Gode, þonne leofest þu.
 20. Ne scealt þu na georwenan be þira synna forgyfenesse.
 20. Ac gecyr to Gode, þonne leofast þu, & to dædbote.
 21. Þu cwyst <foreign>cras</foreign>, þæt is leden word, & hit his on ure
geþeode tomorgene.
 22. Ac for hwon nelt þu todæg?
 23. Þu cwyst, hwylc yfel is þæt, þæt ic cweðe
tomergen?
 24. Ic cweðe, hwilc yfel is þæt, þæt ic cweðe,
þæt þu todæge to Gode gecyrre?
 26. Nu, hwonne þu cwyst min lif bið lange, þonne cwæðe
ie, hit lange sie, sie hit god, gif hit scort sie, sie hit eac god.
 27. Gif þu tun bigest, þonne þu wilt godne bicgan.
 28. Gif þu wif nimest, þu wilnast, þæt hit god sie.
 29. Gif þu bearn hafast, þu wyscest, þæt þa sin gode.
 30. Swa ic eac nu be þam wacestan þingum cwæðe, gif þu
seos bigest, nylt þu, þæt hi sin yfele.
 31. & wilt, þæt þin lif si yfel?
 32. On hwon abelh þe þin lif?
 32. Forhwon wilt þu beon ana yfel betweoxn eallum þinum godum?
 34. Ne lata þu, þæt þu to Gode gecyrre, ne geyld þu hit
of dæge to dæge.
 35. Þis sind Godes word, næs mine.
 35. Ne geherest þu þas word from me, ac wit hie gehyrað begen
fram Gode.
 37. Nu, hwonne þu cwyst <foreign>cras, cras.</foreign> þæt is tomorgen,
tomorgen.
 38. <foreign>Cras</foreign> eawla þæt is hræfnes stæfn.
 38. Se hræfen ne gecyrde na to Noes earce, ac seo culfre cyrde.
 40. Gif þu þonne wilt don dædbote, þonne þu syngian ne
miht, þonne forlætað þe þine synna, nalles þu hie.
 41. Genoh fremde bið se man dædbote don, ær he eald sie.
 42. Hit is to andrædanne, þæt he sie geniðrad eft,
þonne he him mildheortnysse weneð.
 43. Soðlice ne mæg se man him þonne him nanre mildheortness
wenan ne forgyfenesse, seþe nu forleosað þa getæsan tide þære
dædbote.
 45. Þær ne mæg se man geearnian, þæt he bideð,
seðe her nolde gehyran, þæt God bebead.
 47. Seþe nu þære forgifenan tide þær dædbote
forleasað, holinga he eft cleopað beforan Cristes heahsetle.
 49. Nuþa sceal ælc mon, þæt he to Gode gecyrre þa hwile
þe he mæge, þe læs, gif he nu nelle þa hwile þe he mæge, eft
þonne he late wille, þæt he ne mæge.

Alc 26 (Forst)
B9.7.3.
Alcuin, De virtutibus et vitiis (London, British Library, MS. Cotton Tiberius A.III) Chap. 26: Forster 1909, 260-61.



 1. Be þurhwununge.
 1. Ne bið no þam cristenan menn sceawod se fruma þæs godan
weorces, ac se ende, forþonþe ælcum men bið demed be his þam
endenystan weorcum.
 3. Monige men beoð, þe wel onginnað & yfel geendiað
hira drohtnunge.
 4. Swaswa Iudas, he wæs ærest apostol & he wæs eft
Cristes læwa, & þa ongeat his agene scylda, & he hine an grine
aheng.
 6. Paulus he ongan ærest swyðe yfele, ac he eft geendode
swiðe wyl his lif.
 7. He wæs ærest cristenra manna ehtere & he wæs eft
þeoda lareow.
 9. Seo þurhwunenes heo is mægen þæs godan weorces, swaswa
Drihten sylf cweð, seþe þurhwunað on þam godan weorcum oð ende, he
bið hal.
 11. Na seþe god onginneð, ac seþe on þam gode
þurhwunað, bið hal.
 13. Þonne soðlice Gode licað ure drohtnunge, þonne we þa
god, þe we onginnað, on þurhwuniendum ende gefyllað.
 14. Nis nænig mægen, þæt mon god onginne, ac þæt
bið mægen, þæt hit mon geendige.
 16. Nis na þæt ece rice þam, þe god onginneð, gehaten,
ac hit bið þam, þe on gode þurhwunigað, geseald.
 17. Symle on ælces monnes life bið se hende gescapon, hwilc
he sie on þære ytemestan tide his lifes.
 19. Forþonþe ælc man be þam hende his lifes oðþe
bið gerihtwisod oþþe geniþarad.
 21. For þon ælc man, þæt he to gode onginge higige, he
þæt he þæt fulfremman mæge, to þon þæt he geearnian þa
ecan mede æt Gode.

END_TEXT

Alc (Warn 35)
B9.7.4.
Alcuin, De virtutibus et vitiis (London, British Library, MS. Cotton Vespasian D.XIV) Chaps. 1-16: Warner 1917, 91-105.



 1. <foreign>De scientia.</foreign> ærest ealre þingen æighwylce mæn is to
secene, hwæt seo se soðe wisedom, oððe hwylc seo seo soðe snytere,
for þan þe se wisedom þyssere wurlde is dysignysse beforen Gode.
 3. Se soðe wisedom is, þæt man fram deofles þeowdome
gewite, & his synne forlæte.
 5. & seo fullfremede snytere is, þæt man Gode þeowige
æfter his bebodan & soðfæstnysse, for þan þe þurh þa twa
þing byð þæt eadige lif begeotan, swa se sealmscop cwæð, gecerr
fram yfele & do god.
 8. Buten tweone ne mæig nane mæn to ecere hæle gehelpen,
þæt he yfeles geswica, bute he god do.
 9. Ac soðlice ælc man, þe swa wis byð, þæt he yfeles
geswica & god do, he byð eadig on ecnysse.
 11. Þæt eadige lif is oncnawenysse þære godcundnysse,
& seo oncnawenysse þære godcundnysse is mæign godes weorcas, &
þæt mæign godes weorcas is wæstme þære ecen eadignysse.
 14. <foreign>De fide.</foreign> Ac þeos oncnawednysse þære godcundnysse,
& þære soðfæstnysse wisedom is to leornigen þurh þone rihtne
geleafe, for þan þe nan mann ne mæig Gode lichien bute rihten geleafen.
 18. Soðlice se byð gesælig, þe on riht leofeð, & wel
libbende þone fulfremede geleafe healdeð.
 19. Witodlice se geleafe byð unnytt buten þan gode weorcan, swa
eac þa gode weorc bute þan rihten geleafen nane mæn ne helpð.
 21. Beo þan Jacobus se apostol cwæð, hwæt helpð,
broðre mine, þæt hwa secge, þæt he geleafe habbe, þonne he þa
gode weorc næfeð?
 23. Weneð he, mæig hine seo geleafe gehealden?
 24. Soðlice se geleafe bute gode weorcan, he byð deaden gelic,
& se lichame byð dead buten þan gaste.
 25. Beo þæs geleafen hehnysse us is eft to specane, for þan
þe þæt gewrit, þe þu þe bæde awriten beo Godes bebodan mid
feawe wordan, ne mæig befon þa deopnysse þæs rihte geleafen.
 29. <foreign>De caritate.</foreign> On eallen Godes bebodan seo soðe lufe
hæfð þone ealdordom, buten þære fullfremednysse Gode naht lichigen
ne mæig.
 31. For Paulus se apostol þuss cwæð, Ne martyrhad, ne
þysser wurlde forhogung, ne ælmesdæde, ne byð Gode gecweme bute
þære soðen lufe.
 34. Beo þære eac ure Drihten fram sumen writere geascod
wæs, hwæt wære þæt mæste bebod, & þuss he andswerode
& cwæð, Lufe þinne Drihten God of eallre þinre sawle & of
eallen þine mode.
 37. & þære eac to geehte & cwæð, Oðer is
þyssen gelic, lufe þinne nexte swa swa þe sylfne, for þan þe on
þyse twam bebodan eall Godes æ & witegene bec byð gefyllede.
 39. Witodlice þa þa he cwæð, Of eallre heorte & of
eallre mihte, & of eallra sawle, & of eallen mode, þæt is mid
eallen andgite, & mid eallen wille, & mid eallen gemynde, God beon to
lufigene.
 42. Soðlice eall seo Godes lufe is on þære gehealdnysse his
beboden, swa swa he sylf cwæð on oðre stowe, gyf me hwa lufeð, þonne
healdeð he mine beboden.
 44. & eft he cwæð, on þan oncnaweð mænn, þæt
ge byð mine þeignes, gyf ge habbeð soðe lufe betwux eow.
 46. & eft se apostol cwæð, seo soðe lufe is fullnysse
Godes æ.
 47. & Johannes se godspellere cwæð, þiss bebod we
habbeð fram Gode, þæt se þe God lufige, he eac lufige his þone
nextan.
 49. Gyf þone hwylc man axige, hwa beo his nexte, þonne wyte he
swyðe rihtlice ælcne Cristene mann beon his nexte, for þan we ealle
byð on þæs fulhtes bæðe, Gode to bearnen gehalgode, to þan
þæt we seon gastlice gebroðre on þære soðen lufe.
 53. Soðlice æðelre is seo gastlice gebyrd, þone se
flæsclice.
 53. Beo þære ure Drihten cwæð, Bute hwa seo eft
acænnod of wætere & of þan halgen gaste, ne mæig he becumen to
heofone rice.
 55. Ærest mæn sceal leornigen, hwæt sien Godes beboden,
& heo syððen healden, swa swa man geornest mage.
 57. Se þe þonne swa deð, þonne mæig he oncnawen,
þæt he hæfeð on him þa soðe lufe þære Godes bebodan.
 59. Ic wylle nu þinre estfullnysse, min se leofeste sune, feawe
næmnende ætywwigen, þæt on þan feawen ongytenen, þu þe eð
muge þære oðre manega oncnawen.
 62. <foreign>De spe.</foreign> Se æðele þeode Larðeaw, he foresette on
þreo wisen ure sawlen neodðearflice, þæt is hyht & geleafe &
soðlufe, & þære is mæst seo soðe lufe.
 65. Ne sceal nan mann, þeh he seo ofsett mid ungemættre
byrdene his synnen, geortreowigen beo þære æwfæstnysse þære
godcundan mildheortnysse, ac mid witendan hyhte & mid dæighwamlice
tearen him forgyfonysse biddan, for þan þe swyðe rihtlice he mæig him
forgyfenysse wenen, se þe geswicað þære yfelre weorcan.
 70. For þan hyhte þære forgeofonysse we ne sculen singallice
synegian, for þan þe God swyðe rihtlice þa synne witneð, ne we eac ne
sculan orwenen beo þære forgeofenysse, ac æigðer þysser frecnysse
we sculen forbugen, we sculen ure yfele þeawes forlæten, & us on God
symle gehyhten.
 74. Swa eac on ælces geswynces nearenysse us is to gernene to
þære uplicen ærfæstnysse fultumes, for þan þe on Goden ane is
ælc hyht & ælc hæle, swa swa se witega cwæð, on Gode is min
hæle & min wuldor, God is min fultumend, & min hyht is on Gode.
 79. <foreign>De scripturarum lectione</foreign> Seo ræding haligre gewritan is
oncnawenysse þære ecen eadignysse.
 81. On þan halgen gewriten se mann hine sylfne mæig sceawigen
swa swa on hwylcen sceawere, hwylc he byð, & hwyder he hygeð.
 83. Seo singale ræding haligre gewriten, heo clænsað þa
sawle þæs rædendan, heo gebrincð on his mode þone ege hellewites,
& heo his heorte aræreð to þan upplicen gefean.
 85. Se þe wyle simle mid Gode beon, he sceal him oft gebiddan,
& he sceal oft halige gewriten rædan, for þan þe þonne we us
gebiddað, we specað to Gode, & þonne we halge bech rædað, God
specð to us.
 89. Seo halige ræding twifealde gyfe heo brincð þan
rædindan.
 90. Ærest heo lærð his modes andgit, þæt hit þa
scearpere byð, & eac þæt heo fram þysses middeneardes idelnysse to
Godes lufe gelædeð.
 92. Seo ræding haligre gewritan is swyðe arfæstlic weorc,
& heo swyðe helpð to sawlen geclænsunge.
 93. Gelice heo & se lichame byð gefeded mid flæsclicen
meten, swa eac se innre mann, þæt is seo sawle, byð gefedd mid þan
godcundan spæcen, swa se sealmscop cwæð, swettre byð mines muðes
gomen þinre spæce, þone hunig oððe beobread.
 97. Se byð swyðe gesælig, se þe þa halge gewriten
rædeð, gyf he þa word gewænd to weorca.
 98. Soðlice ealla þa halge gewrita synden gewritena for ure
hæle, þæt we mugen ongyten þurh þa soðfæstnysse.
 100. For ofter spyrneð se blinde, þone se lochigende, swa eac
se þe nat Godes bebodan ofter he synegað, swa swa he nat, þone do se þe
heo wat.
 102. Gelice & se blinde buten larðeawe, swa eac se mann buten
larðeawe swyðe uneaðe he mæig gan on þone rihtne weig Godes
bebodan.
 105. <foreign>De pace.</foreign> Se Hælend, þa þa he on heofone asteah, he
sealde his þeignen sibbe bebodan, & þuss cwæð, mine sibbe ic sylle
eow, & mine sibbe ic læte mid eow.
 108. He sealde þa farende, þæt he wolde eft cumende on heom
eallen gemeten.
 109. Þære sibbe frætewe se hælend on oðre stowe
æteowde wunderlice, & þuss cwæð, eadige byð þa gesibsume, for
þan þe heo byð Godes bearn geceide.
 111. Gehereð nu, þæt se byð Godes bearn geceid se þe
wyle gesibsum beon, & nele se na beon Godes bearn genæmned, se þe nele
sibbe healden.
 113. Se forsacð him God to fæder, se þe sibbe forhogað.
 114. Ac swa þeh þeos sibb mid þan gode mannen, þe Godes
bebodan lufigeð, is to healdene, na mid þan unrihtwisan, ne mid þan
scyldigen, þe habbeð sibbe betwux heom on heore synnen.
 117. Seo Cristes sibb heo fremeð to ecere hæle; seo sibb, þe
on deofle is, heo becumð to ecere forwyrde.
 119. Simle we sculen habben þa sibbe mid þan godan mannen,
& gefiht wið þære yfelra manna unðeawes.
 120. We sculen fleon þa unðeawes, na þa mænn sylfe, þeh
heo yfele seon, for heo synd Godes gesceafte.
 122. Soðlice seo sibb, þe on þan goden mannen is, broðra
geðwærnysse & þa soðe lufe þære nextan heo gegaderað.
 124. Seo sibb þone gast synderlice heo geearneð.
 124. Seo sibb is moder þære soðe lufe, & heo is
halignysse tacn.
 125. Beo þære Drihten cwæð þurh þone witega, Lufieð
sibb & soðfæstnysse.
 127. Seo sibb byð þæs folcas hæle, & þæs
sacerdes wuldor, & heo byð eallra heora feonden ege geseowenlicra gea
ungeseowenlicra.
 128. Seo sibb is mid ealle mæignen to healdene, for þan þe
simle mid Gode wuneð, se þe on þære halge sibbe wuneð.
 130. Se sacerd sceal þæt folc mid sibbe læren, &
þæt folc sceal mid eadmodnysse heren.
 132. <foreign>De misericordia.</foreign> Mildheortnysse is swyðe hehlic god, beo
þære se hælend sylf cwæð, eadige byð þa mildheorta, for þan
þe heom mildheortnysse æfterfolgeð.
 135. Ne mæig se synfulle him nanre mildheortnysse wenen to Gode,
se þe ne cann nane mildheortnysse þan þe wið hine gesynegiað.
 137. Ac forlæte se man nu þa hwilwendlice scylde, to þan
þæt he geearnige to onfone þæt ece god.
 138. Gyf we nu wilnieð, þæt ure sawlen syn geclænsode
fram synne fulnysse, þonne ne scule we na wiðsacan, þæt we
mildheortnysse ne habben ofer þa mæn, þe us nu abelgeð, þæt on
domesdæige drihtenes mildheortnysse to geearnienne mid mildheortnysse
weorcan, þæt we seon gefultumede.
 143. Hwu mæig se him ænigre mildheortnysse wenen to Gode, se
þe byð wælreow on his efenþeowwes?
 144. Ælc mann, swa swa he wylle, þæt him God milde seo, eft
swa he sceal gemiltsigen þan þe hine abelgeð.
 146. Swyðe sicore forgyfonysse se mæig him biddan æt Gode,
se þu nu wyle forgyfen þan þe wið hine agylteð.
 147. Drihten sylf us eac swyðe æðelice trymede to
mildheortnysse weorcan on þan godspelle, þa þa he cwæð, beoð ge
swa mildheorta, swa swa eower heofonlice fæder is mildheorte.
 150. He læteð his sunne scinen ofer þa goden, & ofer
þa yfelen, & he sændeð ren ofer þa rihtwisen & ofer þa
synfulle.
 152. Ælc mildheortnysse wyrcð hire sylfre stowe æfter hire
agenre geearnunge.
 153. Se þe mildheortnysse deð, he brincð Gode swyðe gecweme
lac.
 154. On ælcen deme sceal beon æigðer gea mildheortnysse,
gea wraca, for þan þe heora naðer ne mæig beon wel abuten oðren,
þe læste on þære mildheortnysse ane forgyfe his heringmannen
orsorhnysse to synegien, oððe eft for þære wraca anre þæs
agyltendan mod seo gehwerfed on orwennysse, & se deme þonne fram Gode
nane mildheortnysse ne geearneð, ac þas mildheortnysse se mann sceal
ærest on him sylfen aginnen.
 161. Hwu mæig se beon on oðre mæn mildheorte, se þe byð
on him sylfen wælreow, se þe him gearecað þa ece wite þurh his
synnen?
 163. Ac se byð swyðe mildheort, se þe þa mildheortnysse
ærest on him sylfen anginneð, & hine wið synnen georne healdeð,
þæt he ne þurfe beon on ecnysse mid deoflen gecwylmed, & þonne
syððen þæt him on him sylfen licode, he eac oðre mannen sylle.
 167. <foreign>De indulgentia.</foreign> Drihten cwæð on his godspelle,
forgyfeð, þonne byð eow forgyfen.
 169. & eft he cwæð, gyf ge forgyfeð þan mannen, þe
wið eow synegieð, þonne forgyfð eow se arfæste fæder eower
synnen.
 171. Gyf þonne ge nylleð forgyfen þan mannen, þe wið eow
synegiað, þone eac nyle se heofonlice fæder eow forgyfen eower gyltes.
 173. Soðlice þæs drihtenes cwiden swyðe mycele
mildheortnysse heo hleoðreð ofer us þan mannen, þe hine on riht ongytan
magen.
 175. Witodlice beo ure agena dome us demeð eft God, & sumen
gemete hit is on uren anwealde, hwu we beon eft gedemde.
 177. Gyf we mildheortlice demeð beo þan mannen, þe wið us
agylteð, þonne demð he mildheortlice beo us, þe wið hine synegieð.
 179. Behealden we Godes ælmihtiges bisne, swa swa se æðela
þeoda larðeaw cwæð, forgeofe we betwux us, gyf ure ænig to oðren
ænigne/ gylt wyte, swa swa God on Criste forgeaf us ure synnen, swa eac
forgyfe we þan þe wið us synegieð.
 182. & eft he cwæð, ne scealt þu nane mænn gelden
yfel mid yfele.
 183. Eac on oðre stowe he cwæð, ne beo þu oferswiðed mid
þan yfele, ac oferswið þæt yfel mid gode.
 185. Cuðlice hit is to wytene, þæt æighwylc man swylce
forgyfonysse onfohð æt Gode, swylce he her his þan nexten, þe wið
hine agyllteð sylleð.
 187. Swyðe raðe gehereð se ælmihtige God ure gebedan for
ure synnen, gyf we wylleð geheren þæra manna benen, þe wið us
agyllteð, þonne heo æt us forgyfenysse biddað.
 190. Se þe mildheortlice cann forgyfen þan þe wið hine
synegieð, buten tweone he onfohð miltse æt Gode.
 192. Soðlice swa us byð forgyfen eft, swa swa we nu forgyfeð
þan þe us mid hwylcere uneðnysse scaðieð.
 194. <foreign>De pacientia.</foreign> Hit cweðð on þan godspelle, þurh eower
geðyld ge mugen habben eower sawle hæle.
 196. On eallen þæs mannes life geðyld is neodðearflice to
habbene.
 197. Swa swa we sculen geðyldelice arefnen þa teonen, þe us
oðre mænn doð, swa us is eac neoðearf, þæt we eall þa broca
& þa geswync, þe us on becumeð, geðyldelice arefnen.
 199. Swyðe oft on þyssen wurlde þa gode mæn byð fram
þan yfele mannen geswæncte.
 201. For þan þeh hwylc mann æfter his gode weorcan broca
& geswync ræfne, ne sceal he naðer ne cweðen ne þæncen, ic
forleas min gode weorc, þe ic ær worhte.
 203. Soðlice gyf hwa þuss cwyð, þonne byð hit geherd,
þæt he na for Godes lufe, ac for þysses wurldes gesælignysse, &
for manna lofe god weorc geworhte.
 206. Oft God cunneð mid his swinglen, mid hwylcen mode se mann
god do, oððe on hwylcre strængðe he aræfne þa costnunge, þe him
on becumð.
 208. Soðlice eower cunneð God, cwæð se apostel, þæt
he wyte, hweðer ge hine lufigen.
 209. Eallinge seo costnunge wyreceð geðyld, & þæt
geðyld wyreceð fullfremod weorc.
 210. Eadig byð se þe þa costnunge oferswiðð, for þan
þonne he afandod byð, he onfoh þone lifes beh, þe God behet þan þe
hine lufeden.
 212. Ne byð nan mann wel wis, gyf he geðyld næfð.
 213. On þan geðylde is to secene forgyfenysse sped, & na
hwu se man muge his teona eðest gewrecan.
 215. Sume mæn synden, þe for þan sume hwile heora teona
geðyldelice forbereð, þæt he wyle abidan, hwænne he hire eað
gewrecan muge.
 217. Ac þa mæn nabbeð na þa soðe geðyld.
 217. Seo soðe geðyld is, þæt mann hwylce uneðnysse on
anweardnysse ellenlice aræfne, & næfre emb þa wræce ne
þænce, ac hit on his heorte forgyfe.
 219. We muge beon martires buten irene & lege, gyf we þa
geðyld soðfæstlice on ure mode gehealdeð mid uren þan nextan.
 221. Herigendlicre is, þæt man swylcne teona swigende forbuge,
þone hine man andswerigende oferswiðe.
 223. Se þe geðyldelice aræfneð yfel on þysser wurlde, on
þære towearde wurlde, he onfohð ecne wulderbeh.
 225. <foreign>De humilitate.</foreign> Swyðe eaðe we magen oncnawen on drihtenes
wordan, hwu mycel þæt mæign is eadmodnysse.
 227. He cwæð to Phariseum, to þan þæt he heora
ofermette gebegde.
 228. Ælc þe hine sylfne upp ahefð, he byð geeadmedod,
& se þe hine sylfne geeadmedeð, he byð upp ahafen.
 230. Eadmodnysse stapen we mugen to heofone hehnysse gesteon.
 231. Þone hehne God ne mæig hine man þurh ofermeta
geræcen, ac þurh eadmodnysse, swa swa beo him awriten is, God
wiðstandeð þan ofermodan, & þan eadmedan he syllð his giefe.
 234. Beo þan hit is on sealmen gecweðen, se heage God gesihð
þa eadmedan, & þa hege he feorrene gecnawð.
 235. Þa hege he sette her for þan ofermodan.
 236. Þa eadmoda he gesihð, to þan þæt he heo to him
nyme.
 237. Þa hege, þæt is þa ofermoda, he on feorren gecnawð,
to þan þæt he heo fram him awurpe.
 238. Leornige we eadmodnysse, þæt we mugen þurh þa Gode
lichigen & genelæcen, swa swa he sylf cwæð on his godspelle,
leornigeð æt me, for þan þe ic eam milde, & eadmede on heorta,
& þonne gemete ge reste eower sawlen.
 242. Þurh oferhyde seo wunderlice gesceaft ænglen feoll of
heofone, & þurh Godes eadmodnysse, seo tyddernysse mannes gecynde up to
heofone asteah.
 244. Se gewune eadmodnysse is swyðe arwurðe betweonen mannen,
swa swa Salomon cwæð, þær þær ofermette byð, þær byð
fracodne & ungerisne, & þær þær eadmodnysse byð, þær
byð wisedom.
 247. & eft oðer wismann cwæð, swa þu geðungænra
seo, swa geeadmode þu þe swyðer on ealle þingan, þonne gemetest þu
gyfe beforen Gode.
 249. & eft drihten cwæð, to hwan lochige ic bute to þan
eadmodan, & to þan stillen, & to þan þe heom mine word
ondrædeð.
 251. Swa hwa swa eadmod & stille ne byð, ne mæig on him
eardigen seo gyfe þæs Halge Gastes.
 252. God wæs for ure hæle eadmod geworden.
 253. For þan sceal ælce mæn sceamigen, þæt he ofermod
seo.
 254. Ælces mannes heorte swa heo byð swyðer ofdune gehelded
for eadmodnysse, swa heo byð ufer ahafen beforen Gode.
 256. Soðlice se þe eadmod byð, he byð upp ahafen on þan
ecen wuldre.
 257. Se ærest stape eadmodnysse is, þæt man
soðfæstnysse word eadmodlice gehere, & hit on his gemynde healde,
& þæt he þæt soðfæstnysse word lære lustlice &
gefræmme.
 259. Witodlice þæt mod, þæt seo soðfæstnysse ne
gemeteð mid eadmodnysse gefyllod, sone seo soðfæstnysse hit befligð.
 261. God is seo soðfæstnysse.
 261. Ælc mann swa swa he hine swyðere geeadmedeð, swa byð
he mare beforen Gode, & se ofermode swa he hine sylfne wunderlicre
æteoweð beforen mannen, swa he aworpenre byð beforen Gode.
 265. Se þe buten eadmodnysse god deð, he byð gelic þan þe
on mycele winde dust berð.
 266. To hwan la ofermodegeð seo eorðe & seo axe, þæt
is se mann, þonne he þurh þære oferhygde wind byð toblawena, þa
gode weorc, þe he ær þurh fæsten & þurh ælmesdæden
gegaderede?
 269. Geherest þu, man, ne wuldre þu na on þinen agena
mæignen, þu hæfest oðerne deme, na þe sylfne.
 271. On þæs gesicðe þu scealt þe sylfne geeadmeden on
þinre heorte, þæt he þe upp ahebbe on þa time his tocymes.
 272. Stih nu ondun, þæt þu muge þonne asteon up.
 273. Geeadmede þe nu, þæt þu seo þonne up ahafen &
geheged.
 274. Se þe him sylfen þynceð yfellic, he byð fæger
beforen Gode.
 275. Beo þu lytel beforen þinen agene eagen, þæt þu seo
mycel beforen Godes eagen.
 276. Swa mycele deorewurðre þu byst beforen Gode, swa mycele
þu þe sylfen forseowenlicre þyncest.
 277. On þære hegesten are sitt seo mæste eadmodnysse.
 278. Eadmodnysse mæign is ælcre are lof.
 280. <foreign>De compunctione cordis.</foreign> Seo onbrerdnysse þæs mannes
heortan cumeð of eadmodnysse, & of þære onbrerdnysse ondetnysse,
& of þære andetnysse cumeð seo dædbote, & of þære soðe
dædbote cumð seo forgyfonysse þære gylten.
 284. Seo onbrerdnysse þære heortan is eadmodnysse þæs
modes, þonne se mann gemuneð his þurhtogene synnen, & þa mid tearen
mæneð, & him ondrædeð þone andrystlice Godes dom.
 286. Of twifealden onbryrdnysse aspringeð & gewunigeð
teares flowen; hwilon þone se mann, swa swa ic ær cwæð, gemuneð his
yfele weorc & for þan wepeð, hwilon eac, þone se gode mann for his
gode weorcan wilneð, þæt he heonan mote, & he for þan wepeð,
þe him lysteð Godes andweardnysse, & þæs gefean, þe he ær
æfter swanc.
 292. Beo þan se witege cwæð, minre sawle þyrste to þan
lyfigende Gode, hwænne ic cume & me æteowige beforen Godes ansene.
 294. Þreo cynn synden þære onbrerdnysse lufen, mid þan
þæt mod þæs rihtwisen mannes swyðe halwendlice byð onbryrd.
 295. An is þæt gemynd his þære þurhtogena synnen,
oðer is seo sceawung his ælðeodignysse on þyssen earmen life, þridde
is seo gewillnung þæs heofonlicen eðles, þæt he sum hwænne
þærto becumen muge.
 298. Þonne þeos on þæs mannes heorte becumð, þonne is
to gelefene, þæt God þurh his gyfe seo andweard þæs mannes heortan,
beo þan eac hit gecweðen is on sealmen, God, min lif ic cyððe þe
& mine teares ic sette beforen þinre gesihðe, swa swa on þinen
foregehaten.
 302. Þæt foregehat is forgyfenysse, þe we habbeð fram
Gode.
 303. He awecceð on ure heorta dædbote teares, þæt is
swyðe wilsumlic goldhord on mannes heorte, seo swetnysse þære
onbryrdnysse þæs mannes sawle.
 306. Þonne heo byð onbryrd on þan mæn, þær he æt
his gebeden byð, swyðe hit hire gehelpeð to þære ecen hæle.
 308. Þonne þurh gebeden seo anbryrdnysse byð ut agoten of
þæs mannes heorte, nis hit nan tweonung, þæt se Halge Gast beo
andweard on þære heorte.
 311. <foreign>De confessione peccatorum.</foreign> Gelomen us læreð þæt
halige gewrit, þæt we fleon to þan læcedome soðre andetnysse ure
synnen, ne swa þeh þæt God beðurfe ure andetnysse, þan eall cuð
is, gea þæt we doð, gea þæt we specað, gea þæt we
þænceð, ac we for þan elles ne mugen beon hale bute we andetten &
bereowsigende beon, þæt we to unrihte dyden þurh gemeleaste.
 317. Se þe nu hine sylfne to his scrifte wregeð for his agene
synnen, ne mot hine eft deofol wregen on domes dæige, gyf he þonne
þehhweðere þa synne, þe he ondett, þurh reowsunge adilegeð, &
heo syððen eft ne geneoweð.
 320. Jacobus se apostel cwæð, andetteð eower synnen betwux
eow, & gebidde eower ælc for oðerne, þæt ge mugen beon hale.
 322. & eft se apostel cwæð, seo andetnysse þæs
muðes becumeð þære sawle to hæle.
 324. & Salomon cwæð, synfulle mannen to lare, se þe
ahydeð his unrihtwisnysse, ne byð he gereht beforen Gode.
 325. Se þe heo geandetteð & forlæteð, sone he begytt
Godes mildheortnysse.
 326. Þæt is swyðe mycel hæle læcedom, þæt we eft
ne gecerren to þan unrihten, þe we ær geandettan, ne we ne geednywigen
þa dolhswaðe þære ærrena wunden.
 329. Eac Johannes se godspellere cwæð, ondette we ure synnen,
for þan þe God is swyðe getreowe, he us forgyfð ure synna, & he us
eac geclænseð fram ælcen unrihte.
 331. Swa eac se salmscop cwæþ, ic secge & ic ondette mine
Drihtene eall min unriht wið me sylfen, & þu Drihten me forgeafe minre
synne arleasnysse.
 334. Ondette se synnfulle, þa hwile þe he on þyssen life seo,
þæt þæt he to unrihte dyde, for þan þe mid hellwaren nis nan
wæstmbære ondetnysse, ne þære nan bereowsung to hæle becumen ne
mæig.
 337. Ac nu is Gode anfænge tid, & nu synden hæle
dæges, nu is forgyfonysse tid þan reowsigendan, & æfter deaðe
byð wræce tid þan þe nu byð gemelease, þæt heo heora synnen ne
andetten.
 340. Soðlice ealle þa arlease mænn habbeð swyðe bitere
dædbote on þan ecen wite, & heom seo ne gehelpeð to nanre
forgyfonysse, ac heora ingehyd heo þræsteð heora wites to ecan.
 343. Heo mihten heom gebyrgen þa unmætnysse þære wite
þurh ondetnysse & þurh dædbote, ac heo hit forgemeleasoden.
 344. For þan gelice se lege heo uten bærneð, heora ingehyd
heo innen þræsteð.
 346. Hwu mæig se læce gehælen þa wunde, þe se untrume
seuneð þæt he him eowie?
 347. For þan wilneð God ure andetnysse, þæt he þa
rihtlucor muge ure synnen forgyfen.
 348. Se þe his synnen adilgað & heo scuneð, & he heo
halewendlice andetteð, God se þe hire byð nu gewite, he heora byð eft
werigend.
 350. Beðænce æghwa nu hine sylfne, & hine beo his
synnen deme, þe læste hine God eft gedeme to þære ecen nyðerunge.
 352. Twifealdne wop sceal ælc man habben on dædbote, ærest
þæt he þurh gemeleaste forlet þæt god, þæt he don scolde,
& eft þæt he þurh þristnysse, þæt he don ne scolde,
þurhtihð.
 355. Seo andetnysse heo gerihtwiseð þone man.
 356. Þurh þa andetnysse cumeð þære synne forgyfenysse.
 356. Ælc forgyfonysse hyht is þære andetnysse.
 357. Seo andetnysse is mildheortnysse weorc, & heo is þæs
untrumen hæle.
 358. Seo andetnysse is se læcedom ure synnen mid þære
soðen dædbote.
 360. <foreign>De penitentia.</foreign> ðære soðen dædbote mæign se
Hælend sylf on his godspelle æteowde, þuss cweðende, Doð dædbote
eower synnen, þonne genelæceð eow heofona rice.
 363. & Johannes se fulhtere cwæð, Doð medeme wæstmes
dædbote.
 364. Þæt is se medeme wæstme þære dædbote, þæt
man þa geworhte synne bewepe, & þe þa he þonne bewepe, þa he eft
ne wyrce, swa swa þæt halige gewrit cwyðð, ne geec þu na synne ofer
synna.
 367. & drihten cwæð þurh Isaiam þone witega,
aðweað eow & byð clæne.
 368. Se byð aðwegen & byð clæne, se þe his þa
geworhte synnen bewepeð, & þa þa he þonne bewepeð, eft ne wyrce.
 370. Se eadige apostel Petrus cwæð beo þan mannen, þe
heora synnen bewepeð, & eft æfter þan wope þa ilca synne wyrceð,
þe heo ær fore weopan, þæt hit wære gelicost, þan þe se hund
wære eft gecerred to his spywðen, & eft fræte þæt ilca,
þæt he ær speaw.
 374. Eac þæt halge gewrit cweðð, gyf þu sume synne dest,
ne geech þu þa synne mid oðre synnen, ac þu God georne bide, þæt
he þe þa gefremda synne forgyfe.
 376. Seo soðe dædbote ne byð na æfter geara gerime
gescrifen, ac beo þæs synfulles mannes modes sarignysse, for þan se
eadige apostel Petrus sone æt Gode forgeofenysse onfeng, þe he swyðe
biterlice weop þære þreofealdan forsacanysse synne.
 380. Seo dædbote þeh heo beo lytle hwile, gyf heo byð mid
inneweardre heorta sarignysse gedon, fram Gode þan rihtwise Deme ne byð heo
forseowen, se þe æighwylcere heorta digelnysse sceaweð.
 383. Ne seceð God na swa swyðe þa lenge þære tide, swa
he sceaweð þære lufe smyltnysse þæs dædbetenden.
 384. Soðlice se þe mid ealle moda on Crist getreoweð, þeh
he manega synnen swelte, on his geleafe he leofeð on ecnysse, swa swa he sylf
on his godspelle cwæð, ic eam ærist & ic eam lif, se þe on me
gelefð þeh he dead seo, he leofeð, & ælc þære þe leofeð
& on me gelefð, ne swelteð he næfre.
 389. Þiss he cwæð beo þære sawle deaðe, se þe her
cumð þurh þa untrumnysse synne.
 390. God is swyðe mildheort, & he is geare, to þan þæt
he þurh his mildheortnysse hæle þa þa he gemeteð þæs wurðe,
þæt he heo þurh heora rihtwisnysse hælen mæig.
 393. God wyle, þæt ælc mann sy hal, nele he, þæt
ænig forwurðe.
 393. He eac cwæð þurh þone witega, on swa hwylcen dæige
swa se synfulle gecerred byð to Gode, he leofeð on life & he ne
swelteð.
 395. Seo se man swa swyðe synfull swa he seo, gyf he to
dædbote gecerren wyle, ne twynige him na, þæt he þurh Godes miltse
mæig his synna geearnigen.
 398. Godes mildheortnysse helpð, & se gefultumeð þan
mannen, þe on þyssen wurlde heora synna dædbote doð.
 399. On þære towearde wurlde ne mugen we nane dædbote don,
ac þær we sculen ure weorca & ure unrihtes ageldan.
 401. On þysser wurlde is se frigdom dædbota, æfter deaðe
nis nane mænn nan bote gelefd.
 403. <foreign>De conuersione ad dominum.</foreign> Hit is gerædd on þan
godcunden gewriten & is þuss gecweðen, sune, ne elca þu na to Gode to
gecerran, for þan þu nast, hwæt se towearde dæig þe bringeð.
 406. Se þe elcað, þæt he to Gode ne gecerð, he deð on
plih his agene sawle, for þan þe se deað hit na ne elcað na.
 408. Se deað gyf he cumð to þan þe elcað þæt he to
Gode gecerran nele, bute tweone he hine lædeð to þan ecen wite, þæt
is swyðe unhalwendlic geðoht, þæt hwa emb þa morgenlice cerringe
þænce, & þa anweardan forgemeleasige.
 411. Geherest þu synfulle, to hwan elcest þu, þæt þu to
Gode gecerre?
 412. For hwan ne ondrædest þu þe, þæt þe færdeað
bereafige þæs dæiges þinre gehwerfenysse?
 413. Nast þu, þæt mænn færlice swelteð?
 414. Nu syððen þæt god is, þæt man forlæte his
synnen & to Gode gecerre, do þæt ælc man raðe, for þan þe God
us behateð forgyfonysse, gyf we to him gecerran wylleð, & he us
nænne fyrstmearca ne behatt langes lifes.
 417. For þan gehwerfe ælc man hine to Gode, & forlæte
se arlease man his unrihtwisnysse weges, for þan gyf færinge cumð se
utemeste dæig, þonne byð gelosed seo elcunge, & þær byð to
lafe seo wite þan synfulle mænn.
 421. Gyf þu nelle losien, gecerr to Gode, þonne leofest þu.
 422. Ne scealt þu na georwenen beo þinre synne forgyfenysse, ac
gecerr to Gode & do dædbote.
 423. Þu cweðst, <foreign>cras</foreign>, þæt is Leden word & is on ure
þeodan tomorgen.
 424. Ac for hwan nelt þu todæig?
 425. Þu cwytst, hwylc yfel is, þæt ic cwæð, tomorgen?
 425. Ic cweðe, hwylc yfel is þæt, þæt þu todæig to
Gode gecerre?
 426. Nu gyf þu cwetst min lif byð lang, þonne cweðe ic, gyf
hit lang seo, seo hit god.
 428. Gyf hit scort seo, seo hit eac god.
 428. Gyf þu tun bygst þonne þu wylt godne.
 429. Gyf þu wif nymst, þu wilnest, þæt heo god seo.
 429. Gyf þu bearn hæfest, þu wyscest, þæt heo seon
gode.
 430. Swa swa ic eac nu beo þan wacasten þingen cweðe, gyf
þu scos bygst, nelt þu, þæt heo seon yfele, & wylt, þæt þin
lif seo yfel?
 432. On hwan abealh þe þin lif?
 432. For hwan wylt þu beon ane yfel betwux eallen þine gode?
 433. Ne elca þu, þæt þu to Gode ne gecerre, ne elca þu
hit of dæige to dæige.
 435. Þiss synden Godes word na mine.
 435. Ne geherst þu þas word fram me, ac wyt heo gehereð begen
fram Gode.
 436. Nu gyf þu cwetst, <foreign>cras, cras,</foreign> þæt is þæs
hræfenes stefne.
 437. Se ræfen ne gecerde na to Noes arca, ac seo culfre cerde.
 438. Gyf þu þonne wylt don dædbote, þonne þu synegian ne
miht, þonne forlæteð þe þine synnen, na þu heo.
 440. Genoh fræmde se mann byð fram rihten geleafen, se þe
nele his synnen dædbote don, ær he eald seo.
 441. Hit is to andrædene, þæt he seo genyðered eft,
þone he him mildheortnysse wenð.
 442. Soðlice ne mæig se mann him þonne nanre mildheortnysse
wenen, ne forgyfenysse, se þe nu forleoseð þa getæse tide þære
dædbote.
 444. Þær ne mæig se mann geearnigen þæt þæt he
biddeð, se þe her nolde geheren þæt þæt God bebead.
 446. Se þe nu þære forgyfena tide & þære dædbote
forleoseð, on idel he eft cleopað beforan Cristes hehsetle.
 447. Nu sceal ælc man efsten, þæt he to Gode gecerre þa
hwile þe he muge, þe læste, gyf he nu nelle þa hwile þe he muge, eft
þone he wyle, he ne mæig.
 451. <foreign>De timore domini.</foreign> Godes ege is se frume wisedom.
 452. Þæt is swyðe mycel wærscipe wið synnen, þæt
him ælc mann simle Godes andweardnysse ondræde.
 454. Se þe fulfremedlice him God ondrædeð, he hine sylfne
swyðe geornlice wið synne healdeð.
 455. Þa mænn, þe heom God ondrædeð, byð on þan
ytemesten dæige swyðe wel, & heora mede wuneð on ecnysse.
 457. Se þe him scamige, þæt he beforen mannen egen synegie,
swyðer him sceal scamigen, þæt he beforen Godes egen ænig unriht
wyrcð.
 459. God þa weorc ne gesceaweð, ac þa inwearda heorta.
 460. Þa þa mid þan halgen ege heom God ondrædeð, heo
simle seceð þæt þæt Gode liceð.
 461. Oðer byð þære bearne ege, oðer byð þære
þeowen.
 462. Þa þeowwes heom ondrædeð heora hlafordes for wite,
þa bearn heom ondrædeð heora fæderes for lufe.
 463. Nu we Godes bearn synden geceigde, ondræde we us hine of
þære soðe lufe swetnysse, na of þæs eges biternysse.
 465. Se wise mann on eallan his weorcan he him God ondrædeð,
& he geðænceð, þæt he Godes andweardnysse nahwyder befleon ne
mæig, swa swa se salmscop cwæð, hwyder gange ic fram þinen gaste,
oððe fram þinre ansene hwyder fleo ic?
 469. & eft he cwæð, ne fram eastdæle, ne fram
westdæle ne openeð nane stowe God on to befleone.
 470. Se þe him God ondrædeð, he onfohð his lare, se þe
wacað on Godes beboden, he gemeteð ece bletsunga.
 472. Eadig byð þæs mannes sawle, þe him God ondrædeð,
& heo wuneð gesund fram þære deofollice costnunge.
 474. Eadig byð se man, þe simle for Godes ege forhteð, &
him forgyfen byð, þæt he simle Godes ege hafeð beforen his eagen.
 475. Se þe him ondrædeð God, he abugð fram ælcen
þweoren siðfæte, & gerecceð his weges to mægnes paðen.
 477. Se Godes ege, he ut adrifð þa synnen, & he gegadereð
mæign.
 478. Se Godes ege gedeð, þæt se mann byð wærr, &
behealden wið þæt þæt he ne syngige.
 479. Þære se Godes ege ne byð, þære byð ealles lifes
talnesse.
 480. Se þe him God on gesunden þingen ne ondrædeð, on
ungesunden he to him ne beflihð, he for þan swingað, þæt he eft
hæleð.
 482. Eadig byð se were, se þe God ondræt, & on his
beboden byð swyðe geornfull.
 483. Se Godes ege, he ut adrifð þone helle ege.
 484. Swa ondræden we us God, þæt we hine lufigen, for þan
þe seo fullfremede lufe ut adrifð þone þeowlice ege.
 487. <foreign>De ieiunio.</foreign> ðæt byð fulfremed fæsten, þe mid
ælmessen & mid gebedan byð up ahafen, heofones hit þurhleoðreð,
& becumeð to þæs hecstan hehsetle, þonne byð se mann gastlic
geworden, & he mæg þe eð to Gode geðeodan, þone seo
forhæfednysse his lichamen byð þurh gebeden, and þurh ælmessen upp
ahafen.
 492. Þurh fæsten & þurh gebeden byð geopenede
þære heofonlice geryne digolnysse, & þæs godcundan gerynes
digolnysse byð onwrigen.
 494. Adam, þa hwile þe he hine fram þæs unalefdes treowes
blædon forhæfde, he wunede on neorcsenewange, & sone swa he heo
æt, he wæs ut adrifen.
 496. Þæt fæsten is swyðe strang wæpen wið deofles
costnunge.
 497. Ælc deofles costnung mæig swyðe raðe þurh
fæsten beon oferswiðed.
 498. Swa eac ure Drihten lærde, þæt we heora onhrynes mid
fæsten & mid gebeden oferswiðen scolden, & þuss cwæð,
þiss deofolcynn ne mæig man ut aweorpen ne oferswiðen bute mid fæsten
& mid gebeden.
 502. Þa unclæne gastes byð simle þider baldeste, þær
þær heo geseoð oferætes & druncanysse oft rædlice begangen.
 503. Seo forhæfednysse heo gehlænseð þone lichame, ac heo
gefætteð þa heorte.
 505. Heo gewanhæleð þæt flæsc, ac gestrangeð þa
sawle.
 505. Us is eac to wytene, þæt þa fæstene byð Gode ealra
þinga gecwemeste, mid oðre gode weorcan.
 507. Þa mænn, þonne heo fæsteð & eac oðer yfel
doð, heo æfterhyrigeð deoflen, þe ne beðurfen nanes lichamlices
meten, ac heom byð simle on se gastlice nið.
 509. Ac se fæsteð swyðe wel metes, se þe hine sylfne eac
fram yfele weorcan, & fram þysses middeneardes geornfullnysse
awændeð.
 511. Betere is, þæt man his mod gereordige on þan
gebeorscipe haligre lare, þone he his deadlice flæsces wambe mid
manigfealden meten gefylle, his sawle to forwyrde on ecere pine.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Aug
B9.8.
Augustine: Warner 1917, 65.



 1. Augustinus sæde on his cwidbocan þæt nan mann ne mihte
asmeagan Godes æ, & his bebodan fullice healden, bute se þe smylte mod
hæfde, & frig ælcere gedrefednysse.
 3. He sæde þeh, þæt þære wæren swyðe feawe
oððe nan, þe swa frig wære.
 4. Cwæð þeh, þæt nan ne scolde beon swa idel, þæt
he betwux þan bisegan þysser wurlde, sum þing ne ongunne leornigen beo
his frigdomes mæðe, & ælc mann eall alæte swa swa he mæst
muge unnytte embhogen, & geæmtige hine to Godes þeowdome, for þan
þe God forgelt ælcen mænn beo his dæden, swa swa he sylf cwæð
on his godspelle.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Eluc 1 (Warn 45)
B9.9.1.
Honorius of Autun, Elucidarium: Warner 1917, 140-43.



 1. Sum mann sæigð þæt synne nis nan þing, & gyf
þæt soð is, þonne is hit wunder, þæt God fordemð þa mænn
for þa þinge þe naht nis, & gyf synne is ænig þing, þonne
geworhte God hit, for he geworhte ealle þing, & gyf þæt soð is,
þonne fordemð he eft mid unrihte þa mænn þe doð þæt þæt
he sylf gescop.
 5. Of Gode synden ealle þing, & ealle he geworhte heo gode,
& for þan we understandeð þæt synne nis nan þing on antimbre,
for ælc antimber is god, ac yfel næfð nan antimber, & for þan hit
nis naht.
 8. Hwa is wyrhte þære synne?
 9. Mann is wyrhte þere synne, & deofol tyhtere.
 9. Is hit hefigteme þing þæt man synegige?
 10. An lytel synne, þone man heo hæfð gedon, beo his
gewittscipe, heo is mare þone eall middeneard, & eall þæt æfre
ænig man deð to synne, eall hit gewænt ure Drihtene to wurðmynte,
& for þan ne mæig nan mann betellen, þæt on eallen Godes
gesceaften beo aht, bute God.
 14. Hwu?
 14. Nis manslege & forleger yfel?
 15. Sume siðe byð manslege god, swa hit wæs þa þa Dauid
sloh Goliam, & Judith Holofernem.
 16. Ac þonne byð manslæge yfel, þonne man hine deð beo
his agene gewille unscellice, & forleger is on ælcen time synne, for hit
nis næfre Gode gewill, ne beo his hæse gedon.
 19. Syððen God geworhte þa gode & þa yfele, & hit
is gewriten þæt God ne hateð nan þære þingen þe he geworhte,
hwu sculen we understanden þæt God lufeð þa gode & hatað þa
yfele?
 22. God lufeð ealle þa þing þe he geworhte, ac he ne
gebringð heo na ealla on anre wununga.
 23. Swa swa se litigere þe lufeð ælces heowes lit, ac naht
ealla gelice, & ælc lit he fæstneð on swylcen styde swa þær to
berist, swa deð ure Drihten beo þan mannen of þyssen middenearde, &
for þan man sæigð þæt he lufeð þa þa he bringð into his
rice, & hatað þa þa he bescufð into helle.
 28. Hwæt is agen cyre?
 28. Hwæt is frigdom to geceosan god oððe yfel?
 29. Þone frigdom hæfde mann on neorxenewange, ac nu is se
fridom geðeowtod, for se mann ne cann nan god, bute God þurh his geofe him
tæce.
 31. Ne þaget ne mæig he hit geforðigen, bute God him fylste
þærto.
 32. Hwæt is beo þan mannen þe forwurpeð þæt wurld,
& gewændeð heora lif to drohtnunga for heora synnen, & þærto
nymeð heow & gewæden, & binnen lyttlen fyrste leggeð þa adun,
& gewurðeð eft wyrse þone heo ær wæron?
 35. Manega synden þe beginneð god to donne, & eft hit
forlæteð, & gecerreð to þan yfele.
 37. Of swylce mannen is gewriten þæt heo græmigeð God.
 37. On swylcen wisen þegneð se deofol ure Drihtene.
 38. Hwu þegneð he him?
 39. For he nolde beon mid uren Drihtene on wuldre mid wele &
mid blisse buten geswynce, þa geaf God him ane wica þæt he næfre ne
byð geswyncleas, for he is smið, & his heorð is seo gedrefodnysse,
& seo tyntrega.
 42. Þa hameres & þa beliges synden þa costninga, þa
tangen synden ehteres, þa fielen & þa sagen synd þæra manna
tungen, þe wyrceð hatunge betweonen heora emcristene, & bliðelice
specað yfel.
 45. Þurh swylcne smið & þurh swylce tol, geclænsað
ure Drihten þære halgena sawlen, ac of þan yfela mannen God sylf nymð
þa wræce.
 47. Hwy synden þa lyðere mæn swa welige on wurlde, &
habbeð of heore wille genoh, & þa gode mænn habbeð swa feola
ermðen & byrstes ælces godes?
 49. Eall þæt is for þan gode mannen, þæt heo ascunigen
& lytel tellen & unwurð of þan wele þe þa yfela mæn byð of
swa swyðe asadede, & þa gode mænn synden byrstige & gedrefde
& unfere, þe læste heo toswyðe blissoden on heora lichames hæle,
& on heora wurldwelen, & gyf heo hwæt lytles habbeð gegylt, &
gedon ongean Godes wille, þæt beo geclænsod & forgeofen þurh
þære drohtnunge, & heo byð gewulderbegede for heora þolemodnysse.
 56. Hwy is eft þæt sum god mann hæfð on wurlde genoge
welen & æhte, & lichames hæle, & sum yfel mann hæfð
ermðe & næfte & unhælðe?
 58. For þan hæfð ure Drihten getyðed þan gode mannen
wele & æhte, þæt heo mugen on nytt beteon þæt God þe heom is
leof, & God heom sceaweð beo þan, þæt syððen þa
ateorigendlice þing byð swa behefe & leofe to brucane, wel swyðe
mycele betere & fremfullre byð þa heofonlice welen, þe næfre ne
forealdigeð, ac æfre þurhwunigeð on godnysse.
 58. & for þan God gyfð þan gode mannen mihte, þæt
heo geforðigen þæt god þæt heo beginneð, ærest for heom
sylfen, & syððen for oðren Godes þeowen, þæt heo heom helpen,
swa wel swa heo mugen, & eft for þan þæt heo geletten þa lyðere
mænn, þæt heom ne onhagige ofer þan goden to yfeligen eall þæt
heo wolden, & heo habbeð heora hæle, þe læste oðre gode mænn
beon unrote for heora unfernysse, ac þæt heo beon bliðe for heora
hæle.
 70. & eft þære byð sume yfele mænn, þe byð
swyðe byrstige & unfere, for þan þæt heo understanden beo þan,
þæt bitere byð þa saregan þe heo sculen on helle on ecnysse
geðrowigen, for heora unmihte.
 73. Hwu is þæt þæt manig yfel mann leofeð lange, &
manig god mann sone swelt, & eft sum god mann leofeð lange, & sum
lyðer mann lytle hwile?
 75. God lætt libben þa yfele mænn for þan þæt þa
gode beon þurh heom gefandode, oððe þæt heo heo beðæncen &
gecerren of heora hindernysse, & bute heo gecerren, heora pine wurð þa
mare.
 78. & þa gode mænn swelteð raðe, for þan þe God
nele þæt heo læng drohtnigen on þan swicolan middenearde, ac habben
þa reste, & þa blisse þe heo habbeð geearnod.
 81. & eft sume þa gode habbeð lang lif, for þan þe
heora earninga ehð ælce dæige mid godnyssen, & for þan þæt
þa yfela mænn scolden nymen forbisne æt heom of goden þeawen, &
gecerren fram heora unðeawen.
 84. & eft sume arlease mænn sone swelteð, þæt heo
sone habben þæt þæt heo æfter eodan, & eac for þan þæt
sume þa gecorene þe sume dæle dweligeð, beon þurh heora deað
afyrhte & gemanede to Godes þenunga þe heo forelcodan.
 87. Synden þa mænn gesælige þe nabbeð on þyssen
wurlde nane ermðe?
 88. Ac þa syndon eremingas & ungesælige, þe on eallra
ednysse libbeð heora lif, & habbeð eall heora gewill, for heo byð swa
swotlice gefostrede to beornen stranglice on helle fyre.
 91. Ac eadige byð þa þa habbeð on þyssen wurlde mycelne
wane & ermðe, & is mycel æfter of heore wille, for þurh swylcere
swingle heo byð gelaðede to Godes rice, swa swa hit is gewriten, God
swingð ælcne sune þe he gemð & lufeð.
 94. Þa arlease mænn þeh heo habben on þysser wurlde sum
dæl heora gewilles, þehhweðere heo byð unmihtige, & ne byð heo
næfre teonlease.
 97. & þa gecorene þeh heo habben æt sumen sæle
earfoðnysse on þan middenearde, þehhweðere heo habbeð mycele mihte of
Gode, & heom getitt mycel geðingðe.
 99. Do me þæt to understandene.
 100. Yfele mænn nabbeð nane mihte, for þan þe God is heom
gram, heo ne mugen willnigen nanes godes, ac yfel heo gewillnigeð, &
þæt heo mugen don, & we habbeð beteald þæt yfel nis nan þing,
& for þan heo ne mugen nan þing, for heo ne mugen buten yfel.
 104. Heo ne byð næfre teonlease, for heo byð geteontregeð
mid hindre geðanca, & heo byð æfre on mycelan ege, þæt mann heo
nyme oððe slea, oððe heora æhte heom benyme, ac gode mænn
habbeð mycele mihte of Gode, for heo habbeð þa geofe æt Gode, þæt
heo wylleð god don, & wel mugen, & nelleð nan yfel don.
 108. Þa habbeð mycele mede for heo habbeð blisse for
þære sicornysse Godes rice.
 110. Get ic þe wylle an oðer seggen, þæt næfre ne sceal
yfele mannen na god getidan, ne gode mannen nan yfel.
 111. Hwy sægst þu swa?
 112. Ne byð yfele mænn welige on middenearde, & fægere,
& spedige of æhte, & of fægere gebytlen, & of fægere
wifen, & of deorewurðe reafen?
 114. & þa gode mænn byð bereafode, & geswungene,
& acwelmede on hungre & on cele.
 115. Ðeh hit þynce mannen, þæt arlease mænn habben wele
on þyssen wurlde, heo byð þehhwðere swa swa þa fissces þe habbeð
mycele blisse, þonne heo gegripeð þæt æs, & ne byð na þaget
gewærre þæs angles þe þær inne sticað, & heo beswicð to
deaðe.
 119. Eall swa þa rice mænn for þan estlice meten & for
þa gode dræncen, heo sculen beon gefyllde mid biternyssen, swa swa wæs
se rice mann on helle þe þæt godspell gemunð, & for þære
fægere wifmanna lufen heo sculen drigen brynstanes stænc on helle, &
for þære scrude fægernysse, heo byð bewæfde mid tale & mid
scande, & for þan orfe, & for þan gebytlen, heo habbeð weoremes
& hellepinen.
 125. Ac þa gode mænn þe habbeð pine on þyssen
middenearde, for þan cwarterne, & for þa hæftungan, heo sculen
habben þa heofenlice selen, & for þa swinglen, heo gebideð frofre
& blisse.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Eluc 2 (Warn 46)
B9.9.2.
Honorius of Autun, Elucidarium: Warner 1917, 144-5.



 1. Hwy aras ure Drihten of deaðe þæs formeste dæges
þære wuca?
 2. For he wolde þone forwordene middeneard eft aræren on þan
ylcan dæige, þe he ærst getimbrod wæs.
 3. Hware wicode he þa feowertig dages æfter his æriste?
 4. Swa swa we gelefeð, he wunede on þære eorðlicen
neorxenewange mid Helian & Enoche, & þa þa mid him arisen of
deaðe.
 6. Hwylce wlite hæfde he æfter þan æriste?
 7. Beo seofenfealden brihtere þonne sunne.
 7. On hwylcen heowe gesegen hine his leorningcnihtes æfter his
æriste?
 8. On þan ylcan, þe heo ær wæren bewune hine to geseone.
 9. Com he to heom gescrydd?
 10. He genam reaf of þan leofte.
 10. Hwu oft æteowde he hine his gingran?
 11. Twelf siðen, þæs formesten dæiges his æristes he
wæs æteowod eahte siðen.
 12. Ærest he com to Josepe, þær þær he wæs on
cwarterne for ures Drihtenes lichame, þe he hæfde bebyriged, swa swa þa
gewriten us cyðeð, þe Nichodemus us wrohte.
 15. Æt þan oðre siðe he com to seinte Marian, his moder,
swa swa Sedulie us sægð.
 16. Æt þan þridden siðe, he com to seinte Marian
Magdalene, swa swa Marcus us cuðð.
 17. Æt þan feorðan siðe, he com to þan twam Marian,
þær þær hi gecerden fram þan þruwe, swa swa Matheus us
sæigð.
 19. Æt þan fifte siðe, he com to sancte Jacobe, swa swa
sancte Paulus berð gewitnesse, for he hæfde forhaten, þæt he nolde
metes abiten fram þan Fridæige, þe he gepined wæs, ær þonne he
of deaðe arisen wære, þæt he hine gesege on life.
 23. Æt þan sixten siðe, he com to sancte Petre, swa swa
Lycas awrat on his godspelle, for he wæs unrot for þære forsacunge,
þæt he hæfde Crist forsacan, & wæs toscyled fram þære
apostlene geferræddene & þurhwunede on wope.
 26. Æt þan seofoðen siðe, he com to þan twam
leorningcnihten, þe eoden to Emmaus, swa swa se sylfe Lycas eft sette on
gewrite.
 28. Æt þan eahteðe siðe, he com to heom ealle belochene
gate, þær þær heo wæren togædere on æfen, swa swa Johannes
us cyðð on his gewrite.
 31. Æt þan nigeðen siðen, þa þa Thomas grapode his
wunden.
 31. Æt þan teoðe siðe he com to heom æt þære sæ
Tiberiadis.
 32. Æt þan ændeleofte siðe, on Galilea dune.
 33. Æt þan twelfte siðe, he com to þan ændeleofonan
apostlen, þær þær heo sæten togædere, þa þa he tælde
heora ungeleafsumnesse.
 35. Hwy sæigð se godspellere, þæt he hine ærest
æteowde Marien Magdalene?
 36. Ða godspelles wæren mid swyðe mycelen wisdome &
scele gewritene, & heo nolden þær on writen nan þing, bute þæt
þæt wæs heom eallen cuð.
 38. Steah he ane into heofene?
 39. Ealle, þa þa of deaðe aræred wæren, astugen mid
him.
 40. On hwylcen heowe steah he up?
 40. On þan heowe, þe he hæfde beforan his þrowunge, he
steah up oð þa wolcnen, & þa þa he com bufen þan wolcnen, þa
genam he swylc heow swylc he hæfde on þan munte Thabor.
 43. Hwy ne steah he to heofene, sone swa he arisan wæs of
deaðe?
 44. For þrim þingan.
 45. Ðæt æreste þing, for þan þe þa apostles scolden
witen sicerlice, þæt he arisen wæs of deaðe, for heo gesegan hine
etan & drincan mid heom.
 47. Ðæt oðer þing wæs for þan he wolde æfter
feowertig dagen stigen to heofene, þæt he cydde mid þan, þæt ealle,
þa þe gefylleð þa ten bebodan of þære æ, beo þære feower
godspellere lare, þa sculen æfter him to heofene.
 50. Þæt þridde is þæt þæt cristene folc sceal
stigen to heofene binnen feowertig dagen æfter þær pine, þe heo
þoligeð under Antecriste.


END_TEXT
START_TEXT

BenR
B10.3.1.1.
Benedict, Rule: Schroer 1885-8, 1-133.



 1.1. HER BEGINÐ SEO FORESPRÆC MUNECA REGULES.
 1.2. GEHYR ÐU MIN BEARN geboda ðines lareowes and anhyld
þinre heortan eare, and myngunge þines arfæstan fæder lustlice
underfoh and caflice gefyl, þæt ðu mid þinre hyrsumnesse geswince to
Gode gecyrre, þe þu ær fram buge mid asolcennysse ðinre
unhyrsumnesse.
 1.6. Eornestlice min sprec and lar is to æghwylcum þara
asend, þe his agenum lustum wiðsæcð and mid þam strencstum and þam
beorhtestum hyrsumnesse wæpnum drihtnum Criste soðum cyninge hyrsumian
wile, ærest þinga swa hwylc god swa þu beginst, þæt hit ðurh
drihten to fulfremedum ende cuman mote, mid singalum gebede geornfullice
gewilna.
 1.13. Þæt ure heofenlica fæder, þe us him to bearnum
teleð, næfre ðurh ure yfelan dæda ne geunrotsige and on us his graman
sette, him is on elcne timan to hyrsumienne mid þam godum, þe he us geunnen
hæfð, þilæs þe he us beyrfewerdige, ðæt is, fram his
eadignesse ascyrie, swa swa fæder deþ his bearn, þonne he him for his
gyltum gram bið and his æhta him ne an, na þæt an, þæt he us
æhta bedæle, ac þæt he us, þe him to wuldre fylian nellaþ, swa
swa egeful hlaford, mid urum yfelum dædum gegremed, to ecum wite ne sylle.
 2.4. Utan eornestlice on sumne timan astandan ðurh haliges
gewrites myngunge, þe þus cwyð: Nu is tima, þæt we of slepe arisen,
þæt is, þæt we synna geswicen and on godum weorcum wacule syn.
 2.7. Mid openre gymenne godcundes andgytes we eac gehyren, hwæt
dæghwamlice sio godcunde stefn myngað and clypað ðus cweþende: Gyf
ge todæg Godes stefne gehyren, nellen ge elciende eowere heortan ahyrdan;
and eft þus cweþ: Se þe hlystes earan hebbe, gehyre hwæt þæt
haliggast to eallum þam, ðe to Gode gelaðede syn, cwiþ: Cume ge mine
bearn, gehyrað me; Godes ege ic eow tæce; yrnað and onettað, þa
hwile ðe ge lifes leoht habban, þylæs ðe deaðes þystra eow
gelæccen.
 2.16. And drihten on micelre folces menige smeað and scrutnoð,
hwæt ða feawa syndan, þe his willan wyrcen willen, and ðus acsiende
cwyþ: Hwa is manna, þæt lifes wilnige and gode dagas geseon wille?
 2.19. Gif þu þis gehyrende andswarast: ic eom se þe ðæs
wilnað, God ælmihtig ðus to þe cwyþ: Gif ðu habban wille soð lif
and ece, forhafa þine tungan fram yfelre spræce and ðine welras nan
ðing facenlices ne sprecen; buh fram yfele and wyrc god; sec sibbe and hyre
gefolga.
 3.1. Ðenne ge þus doð, min ansyn bið ofer eow and min hlyst
æt eowrum benum, and ær ge me to clypian, ic cweþe: Efene nu ic eom
geara to eowere neode.
 3.3. Hwæt is lustlicre to gehyrenne þenne þeos laþiende
Godes stefn?
 3.4. Efene nu drihten ðurh his mildheortnesse us lifes wegas
anywyþ.
 3.5. We eornestlice mid clænnesse modes and lichoman and mid
geleafan and godra weorca biggenge and mid haligra mægena hæfene his
wegas geornlice faren and geearnian, þæt we hine, þe us to ðam wege
gelaþode, on his rice geseon moten.
 3.9. Natoþæshwon his rices eardung bið gefaren buton mid
gymene and gehealdsumnesse godra dæda; ofst and hradung godra weorca is to
þæm rice weges færeld.
 3.13. Ac uten ahsien urne drihten þurh þæs witegan myndgunge
þus cweþende: Drihten, hwa mot wunigean on þinre eardungstowe and hwam is
rest geunnen on þinre halgan dune?
 3.15. We gehyraþ æfter ðisse æscan drihten andswariendne
and þone weg his eardunge þus tæcendne: Se on rihtne weg færð to
minum rice, þe butan leahtra besmitenesse wunað and rihtwise weorc
begæþ, and se þe soð on his heortan beðencð and facenlices nan
ðing mid his muþe ne clypað, and se þe his neahstan yfeles nan ðing
ne dyde, and se þe hosp and edwit on his neahstan ne sette, and se þe
þone awirigedan deofol, ælces yfeles lareow fram his heortan awyrpð mid
ealre his lare and hine for naht teleð, and ealle his geþohtas and hopan on
God beset, and þa þe God ondredaþ and hy þurh heora godan dæda ne
anhebbaþ, ac drihten, þe þa god on hi worhte, weorðiaþ and
mærsiað, þus mid þæm witegan clipiende: Na us, drihten, na us, ac
þinum naman sele þu wulder.
 4.4. Swa eac Paulus þurh his mæran bodunge him sylfan nanes
lofes ne tilade, ac eal þæt lof Gode betæhte, þe him snytera and
wisdom sealde, ðus cweþende: þurh Godes gife ic eom þæt þæt ic
eom; eft se sylfa Paulus cwiþ: Se þe wuldrige, wuldrige on God
ælmihtigne and no on hine sylfne.
 4.9. Be þæm ilican andgyte se hælend cwiþ on þæm
halgan godspelle þus clypiende: Se þe gehyrþ þas mine word and hi mid
weorcum gefylð, ic hine gelicne læte wisum were, ðe ofer fæstum stane
bytlode; flodas coman, windas bleowan and þæt hus swiðlice gespurnun,
and hit no feol, forðy þe hit gestaþolod wæs ofer fæstum stane.
 4.15. Ealle god wyrcende and on his halgan gefyllende and
tremegende drihten geanbidaþ, hwæþer we mid weorcum his lare gefyllan
willen.
 4.17. For bote urra synna þises lifes dagas us to fyrste
forlætene synt, swa cwyþ se apostol: Wast þu ðe nast, þæt Godes
geþyld þe to dædbote gelaþaþ?
 4.19. Soðlice mildheort drihten þus cwyþ: Ne wilnege ic
ðæs synfullan deaðes, ac þæt he gecyrre and lif age.
 4.21. Þa we eornostlice urne drihten ahsedon be þæm bugendum
his eardungstowe, we gehyrdan hwæt þa gebodu synd, þe we þa eardunge
mid geearnian sceolon; mid gefyllednesse goddere þenunge we weorðaþ
heofena rices yrfeweardes.
 5.1. We forþy heortan and ealne lichoman to gecampe gegearwian
and to hyrsumnesse halgra gebeda.
 5.2. Þæt we þurh tyddyrnesse mennisces gecyndes þurhteon
ne magon, we urne drihten geornlice biddæn, þæt he us þurh his gife
gefultumige to gelaste laste his geboda.
 5.5. And gif we hellewites susla forbugan willað and to ecum life
cuman, þa hwile þe we moten and on þisum lichoman wuniað and ealle
þas forsprecenan þing ðurh lifes lyhtinge gefyllen magon, is to hradienne
and to efstenne þæt us on ecnesse to life gefyrðrige.
 5.10. Toþi þenne ic eornestlice settan wille bysega and
bigengas þysses drihtenlican þeowdomes.
 5.11. Þeah hwet teartlices hwæthwara stiðlice on þisum
regule, þe ures færyldes latteow to Criste is, geset and getæht sy, for
gesceades rihtinge and for synna bote and soðere sibbe gehealdsumnesse, ne
beo þu þurh þi forht and afæred, ne þurh yrhþe ðinre hæle weg
ne forlæt.
 5.16. Þæs weges ongin, þe to Criste læt, ne meg beon
begunnen on fruman butan sumre ancsumnysse, ac þa geþingþa halegera
mægena and se gewuna þisse halgan drohtnunge, þe gedeþ leafleoht and
eaþe, þæt ðe ær earfoðe and ancsumlic þuhte.
 5.20. Se weg is rum and forðheald, þe to deaðe and to
hellewite læt; se is neara and sticol, þe to life and to heofona rice
læt.
 5.22. He is us þeah to gefarenne mid rumheortum mode and mid
godum and glædum geþance and mid gefyllednesse Godes geboda, swa þæt
we on mynstre þurhwunigen on Cristes lare and tæcinge, þæt we hine
geefenlæcende mid geþylde earfeþa and eahtnesse þolien, þæt we
his rices gemænnesse and gefean mid him agan moten.
 6.4. HER ONGINNAÞ ÞÆRA MYNSTRA CAPITULAS.
 1.6.5. Be muneca cynne.
 2.6.6. Hwilc se abbod beon sceal.
 3.6.7. Be þi þe man eal gefere to healecum geþeahte
gelaðige.
 4.6.9. Be goddra weorca tolum.
 5.6.10. Be hyrsumnysse.
 6.6.11. Be swigean.
 7.6.12. Be eaþmodnesse.
 8.6.13. Be þam twelf stæpum ealre eaþmodnesse.
 9.6.14. Be godcundum þenungum on nihtlicum tidum.
 10.6.15. Hu fela psealma on nihtlicum tidum to singenne synt.
 11.6.16. Hu on sumera seo nihtlice tid to healdenne sy.
 12.6.17. Hu on sunnannihtum nihtlic wæcce to healdenne sy.
 13.6.18. Hu dægredsangas on freolstidum to healdenne syn.
 14.6.19. Hu hi on weorcdagum to healdenne syn.
 15.6.20. Hu on freolsdagum seo nihtlice wæcce to healdenne sy.
 16.6.21. On hwylcum tidum alleluia sceole beon sungen.
 17.6.22. Hu þa godcundan weorc on dæge sceolan beon gedon.
 18.6.23. Hu fela sealma þurh þa sylfan tida sceolan beon
gecwedene.
 19.6.25. Hwilcre endebyrdnesse þa sealmas to cweþenne syn.
 20.6.26. Hwilcre endebyrdnesse þa sealmas to cweþenne syn.
 21.6.27. Be gebedes arweorðnesse.
 22.7.1. Hwilce mynstres teoþingealdras beon sceolon.
 23.7.2. Be muneca reste.
 24.7.3. Be gylta bote.
 25.7.4. Hwylc gemet on þære bote to healdenne sy.
 26.7.5. Be hefigtymum gyltum.
 27.7.6. Be þam þe butan hæse abbodes wið þa
dædbettendan þeodað.
 28.7.8. Hu abbod careful beon sceal ymbe þa dædbetendan.
 29.7.10. Be þam þe oft geþreade synt and na þe betram ne
beoð.
 30.7.12. Be þam þe utfarað, hwæðer hi mon eft underfon
scyle.
 31.7.14. Be geongra monna steore.
 32.7.15. Be mynstres hordere.
 33.7.16. Be mynstres tolum and gehwylcum æhtum.
 34.7.17. Be þæm þæt munecas syndrige æhte næbben.
 35.7.18. Be þæm þæt man eallum munecum gelice don scyle.
 36.7.20. Be wicþenum.
 37.7.21. Be untrumum gebrodrum.
 38.7.22. Be ealdum munecum and cildgeongum.
 39.7.23. Be þære wucan redere.
 40.7.24. Be ætes gemete.
 41.7.25. Be drences gemete.
 42.7.26. Be gereordes tidum.
 43.7.27. Be muneca swigean æfter nihtsange.
 44.7.28. Be þam þe to late to tidsange and to beodferse
cumað.
 45.7.30. Be þam amansumedan, hu hi dædbeten.
 46.7.31. Be þam þe on cyrican misfoð.
 47.7.32. Be þæm þe on lytlum þingum gyltað.
 48.7.33. Be getacniendlicum tidum Godes weorces.
 49.8.1. Be dæghwomlicum weorcum, and on hwilcum tidum hi
rædan sceolon.
 50.8.3. Be lenctenes gemene.
 51.8.4. Be þæm gebroðrum þe feor fram cyrican wyrceaþ.
 52.8.5. Be þam gebroðrum þe on fare syndon.
 53.8.6. Be mynstres gebedhuse.
 54.8.7. Be cumena andfenge.
 55.8.8. Be þæm þæt nan munec ærendgewritu, ne nane
oþre lac ne underfo.
 56.8.10. Be mynstermonna hræglhuse and be heora hrægltale.
 57.8.11. Be abbodes beodes gereorde.
 58.8.12. Be mynstres cræftigum.
 59.8.13. Be nigcumenra gebroðra andfenge.
 60.8.14. Be riccera and þearfena bearna andfenge.
 61.8.15. Be abbodum and oþrum geþungenum, þe mynstres
wilniað.
 62.8.17. Be elþeodegum mynecum, hu hi mon underfon sceal.
 63.8.18. Be mynsteres sacerdum.
 64.8.19. Be ealles geferes endebyrdnesse.
 65.8.20. Be þes abbodes hadunge.
 66.8.21. Be mynstres prouoste.
 67.8.22. Be mynstres geatwearde.
 68.8.23. Be þæm þe ut of mynstere on ærende farað.
 69.8.24. Be unacumendlica þinga gebode.
 70.8.25. Be þæm þe nan oþerne on mynstre ne bewerige.
 71.8.26. Be þæm þe nan oðrum dynt ne beode.
 72.8.27. Be þæm þæt ælc oþerum hyrsumige.
 73.8.28. Be godum æfste, þe munecas habban sceolon.
 74.8.29. Be þæm þæt ælc rihtwisnysse gemen on þissum
regule nis geset.
 8.31. Her geendiaþ þa capitulas.
 1.9.2. BE MUNUCA CYNNE.
 1.9.3. Feower synt muneca cyn.
 1.9.3. Ðæt forme is mynstermonna, þæt is þara þe
under regule and abbodes tæcincge on gecampe wuniað.
 1.9.5. Oþer cyn is ancrena, þæt is westensetlena, þe no on
niwan wylme, ac on lancsumere mynsteres drohtnunge geleorniað, þæt hie
anstandonde mid Godes fultume þurh broðra getrymnesse ongean deofol and his
flæsces and geþohta leahtras winnan magan.
 1.9.10. Þridde cyn is muneca ealra atelucost, sylfdemena, þe no
on regules and lareowa tæcinge ne beoð afandode swa swa gold on heorðe,
ac æfter leades gecynde on costnunge gemyltað and awacigað and on
woruldþingum ealne heora hiht besettað, and swylce hie mid sceare and
munuces hiwe God ælmihtigne pæcen.
 1.9.15. Ða wuniað twam and þrim ætgædere and hwilon
ænlipige, no on Godes eowode belocene, ac on agenum lustum beswicene; him is
for æ heora idelra gewilnunge lust; swa hwylc idel swa him to geþance
yrnð and him gecoren bið, þæt hie taliað halig, and swa hwæt swa
him oflicað, þeah hit halig sy, hie hit lætað unalyfed.
 1.9.20. Þæt feorðe muneca cyn is, þe is widscriþul
genæmned, þa ealle heora liflade geond missenlice þeoda farað and twam
and þrim dagum geond missenlicra monna husum wuniað, æfre
unstaþolfæste and woriende, agenum lustum and heora gitsunge unalyfedlice
fyliað and hyrsumiað.
 1.10.1. On eallum þingum hie synt wyrsan þænne þa
sylfedeman, þe on anre wununge stilnesse healdað; be heora ealra earman
drohtunge sel is to swigienne, þonne embe to sprecenne.
 1.10.4. We þas forði forlæten and to þæm stræcstum
mynstermonna cynne gecyrren and Gode fultumigendum heora drohtnunge
geendebyrden.
 2.10.8. HWYLC SE ABBOD BEON SCYLE.
 2.10.9. Abbod, ðe ðæs wyrðe sy, þæt he mynsteres
wealde, he sceal a gemunan, hwæt he gecweden is, and þæs ealdorscipes
noman mid dædum gefyllan.
 2.10.11. Cristes gespelia he is and his note and spelinge on
mynstre healt; he forþi his agenum naman geciged is, geseðendum apostole
and þus cweðendum: Ge onfengon bearna gewiscinge gast, on þæm we
clypiað abba, þæt is fæder.
 2.10.16. And hit forði næfre ne geweorþe, þæt abbod
ænig þing lære oþþe gesette oðþe hate, butan Godes bebode; ac
his hæs and lar, þæsma godcundre rihtwisnesse, on his underþeoddera
modum sy symble geondstregd; sy he a gemyndig, þæt mycel smeauncg bið on
þæm egefullum Godes dome, ægðer ge ymbe his lare, ge ymbe his
underþeoddra hyrsumnesse.
 2.10.21. Wite he eac, þæt he bið gewitnod swa swa gymeleas
hyrde, gif se hyredes ealdor, þæt is drihten, to lytele note and
nytwyrðnesse on his heorde angyt.
 2.11.3. And he eft æt þam dome freo and carleas bið, gif he
mid ealre gymene þa ungehyrsuman heorde gehylt and his seocum, þæt is
synfullum dædum ealle lacnunge gegearewade, þus mid þæm witegan
cweþende: þine rihtwisnesse, drihten, ic on minre heortan ne bediglode,
soðfæstnesse þine and halwendnesse ic gesæde, hy þeah forhogiende
me forsawon, ðurh þy þonne wite and deað ricsað on þa ungehyrsuman
heorde his gymene.
 2.11.11. Eornostlice, se þe þone mæran noman abbodes
underfehð, he sceal mid twyfealdre lare þa wyldan and tyn, þe him
underþeodde synt, þæt is þæt he ælc god and halignesse mid godum
dædum swiðor tæce, þonne mid worda lare, þæt þa andgytfullan
mid worda lare to Godes willan gemyngode syn and þa unandgytfullan mid godum
dædum getrymede and anbryrde hine geefenlæcen.
 2.11.17. Eal þæt he forbeode and his gingrum læþe, he
þæt no mid weorce ne gefremme; gif he þonne wel lærð and yfele mid
weorce bysenað, he bið forþearlice aworpen, and drihten þurh his
witigan to him synfullum þus clypað: Hwy cwyst þu mine rihtwisnesse and
hwy nimest þu mine beboda on þinne muð?
 2.12.2. Þu soðlice hatodest rihte lare and awurpe mine word
wiðæftan þe.
 2.12.3. Þu gesawe gehwæde mot on þines broðor eage and ne
gesawe þone mæstam cyp on þinum agenum eagan.
 2.12.5. Þæt is on andgite: þu asceonudest þa læstan
gyltas on þine gingran and þa mæstan noldest on þe sylfne.
 2.12.7. Ne sie fram abbode hada toscead on mynstre gehealden,
þæt is ne sy nan fram him geweorðad for gebyrdum oðþe for ylde
oþþe for ænigum oþrum þingum, butan for Godes ege anum and for
soþes wisdomes gesceade.
 2.12.10. Ne sceal he nænne swiðor lufian þonne oþerne,
butan he hwylcne on godum dædum and on hyrsumnesse beteran ongyte; ne sceal
he þone æþelborenan settan beforan þane þeowborenan, gif se
þeowborena ær on þæm mynstre wæs, butan he for hwylcum gesceade
hit do, þæt is, gif se æþelborena mid godcundum cræfte þone
unæþelborenan oferþyhð, sy he gemedemad furður be his geearnungum
þonne se unæþelborena.
 2.12.17. Na be gebyrdum anum þis is to healdenne, ac be ealles
mynstres endebyrdnesse, þæt se sy furþor forlæten on stealle and on
setle, se þe furðor on geearnunge for Gode sy.
 2.12.20. Sy swylcera gebyrda oþþe gecyrrednesse swylce he sy,
butan hwylc þonne oþerne mid geearnunge oferþeo, sy he gemedemad on stede
and on setle, swa swa his gecerrednes sy, for þon ge þeow ge freoh, ealle
we synd an Criste an.
 2.13.3. And under anum Gode gelicne þeowdom we underfengon,
forðan þe mid Gode nis anfangennes nanra hada, þæt is nanes riceteres,
ne ylde, butan geearnunge anre.
 2.13.5. Ealle he sceal gelice lufian his underþeoddan, and eallum
him sceal beon an steor and an lar, æfter heora geearnunga anddyfene.
 2.13.8. Abbud sceal symle on his lare healdan þone apostolican
cwide, on ðam he cwæþ: þrea and witna and halsa and cid; he sceal
mencgan þa reðnesse wið þa liðnesse.
 2.13.10. He sceal gedon, þæt his reðnes ateowe fæderlice
and arfæste lufe, þæt is, þa unstillan and þa heardheortan he sceal
þreagean, and þa gehyrsuman and þa mildan and þa geþyldigan he sceal
witnian and halsian, þæt hy bet and bet don, and þa gymeleasan and þa
oferhogiendan he sceal ægðer ge mid wordum, ge mid dædum þreagan.
 2.13.16. Ne sceal he hit no yldan and hiwian, swilce hit him
uncuð sy, ac sona swa he hwæt unrihtes ongyte, he hit sceal sona mid ealle
him framadon; he sceal geþencean þæs sacerdes frecednesse Eli of Silo.
 2.13.19. Þam godum, gif hy hwæt misdoð, he sceal mid wordum
styran, and þæm þweortymum mid swingellum and mid licumlicre
clænsunge; he sceal geþencean þæt hit is awriten: ðam dysegan ne
mæg mon na mid wordum gestyran, and eft on oþre stowe: Sleah þine sunu
mid gyrde, þonne alyst þu his saule from deaðe.
 2.14.3. Se abbod sceal simle gemunan, þæt hit awriten is,
þæm þe bið mare befæst, from þæm eac mare bið abeden.
 2.14.4. He sceal geþencan, þæt he swiðe uneþelice wisan
underfehð, þæt is, þæt he sceal rædan and racian oþra manna
saulum, sumum mid olæcungum, sumum mid þreaungum, sumum mid lare, no
þæt an, þæt he sceole symle gyrnan, þæt he him þæs
befæsten eowdes nanne æfwirdlan næbbe, ac eac þæt he mage gefeon
be þæm wæstme heora godra weorca.
 2.14.11. Ne sceal him na lytel þincean, se underfeng saula
reccendomes, þara he sceal ealra riht agyldan on domesdæge.
 2.14.12. Ne sceal he syfian ne mænan ymb woruldspeda,
forþæm hit is awriten: Secað ærest Godes rice and his rihtwisnesse,
he eow gifeþ eal, þæt ge beþurfan; and eft hit is awriten: Ne bið
nan wana, þam þe God on riht ondrædað.
 2.14.16. Wite eac se abbod, þæt se þe onfehð saula to
ræccænne, he gearwað hine selfne to dome on þæm dome on
domesdæge, and þær he sceal riht agyldan for ealle þa þe he onfeng,
and eac for his agene saule.
 3.15.2. BE ÐY ÐE MON EAL GEFERE ON HEALECUM GEÐEAHTE
GELAÐIGE.
 3.15.4. Swa oft swa ænig ðing healices on mynstre to donne sy,
gelaðige se abbod eal þæt gefere and secge eallum, embe hwæt neoda to
smeagenne sy.
 3.15.6. And heora ealra geþeaht gehyrende smeage on his agenum
geþance and þæt do, þæt him selost þince.
 3.15.8. Forþi þonne we eal gefere to geþeahte gelaðian
heton, forði þe oft God þan ginstum anwryhð, hwæt selost sy to
healdenne.
 3.15.11. Þeahtigen þænne þa broþru and swa ræd syllen
mid ealre eadmodnesse and underþeodnesse, þæt nan ne gedyrstlæce mid
anwilnesse his agenne ræd to bewerigenne, ac stande eal so geþeahtung on
þæs abbodes dome, and do þæt him selost and halwendost þince, and
hie ealle gemænelice him to þæm hyren geornlice.
 3.15.16. Ac ealswa hit geriseð, þæt þa geongran þam
yldrum hyren, swa eac geriseþ, þæt se ealdor, þæt is se abbud,
swiðe rihtlice and foreþanclice eal gestyhtige and gesette, þæt him
gemæne bið.
 3.15.20. On ælcum þingum hie sceolon habban þone regol to
lareowe, and no of þæm abugan þurh ænige gedyrstignesse; ne sceal nan
mon on mynstre girnan, þæt he his agenum willan folgie.
 3.16.2. Ne eac sceal nan mon geþristlæcan, þæt he aht
stiþlices spræce ongean his abbod, nauþer ne binnan mynstre ne butan;
gif hit hwa deþ, þonne sceal he underhnigan þære steore regollicre
lare.
 3.16.5. Wite se abbod þeah, eal þæt he do, þæt he hit
do mid Godes ege and gehealdsumnesse þæs regoles, forðæm þe butan
tweon he sceal ealra his doma riht agyldan beforan þæm rihtwisan deman on
domesdæge.
 3.16.9. Gif þonne hwylc læsse þing sie to smeagenne, þonne
hæbbe he þara yldestra manna geþeaht, forðæm hit is awriten: Eall
þæt þu do, do hit mid geþeahte, þonne ne gehreoweð hit þe na.
 4.16.14. BE GODDRA WEORCA TOLUM.
 4.16.15. Ærest mon sceal God lufian of ealre heortan and of
eallum mode and of eallum mægene, and æfter þon his nyhstan, swa swa
hine sylfne.
 4.16.18. Ne sceal mon manslean, ne on unriht hæman, ne stelan,
ne unalyfedlice gelustfullian, ne leasunga secgan, ac ælcne man mon sceal
arweorðian, and ne sceal nan mon don oþrum, þæt he nelle, þæt him
mon do.
 4.16.21. Mon sceal his agnum lustum wiðsacan and folgian Cristes
lare; his lichoman gehwa sceal clænsian, þæt is mid forhæfdnesse
wyldan; estmettas no to grædiglice mon ne sceal lufian, ac fæsten mon
sceal lufian.
 4.17.2. Earme mon sceal hyrtan and nacode scrydan; untrume neosian
and deade bebyrgean; geswenctum helpan and sariendne frefrian.
 4.17.4. And fram weoruldwilnungum hine sceal gehwa fremdian and nan
þing beforan Cristes lufe settan.
 4.17.5. Yrre ne sceal mon fulfremman; yrsunge tidelice sceal mon
gehealdan; facn ne sceal mon on heortan gehabban; lease sibbe ne sceal mon
syllan; soþe lufe ne sceal mon forlætan.
 4.17.8. Swerian ne sceal mon, þylæs mon forswerige;
soðfæstnesse of heortan and of muðe mon sceal simle forðbringan.
 4.17.10. Ne sceal mon yfel mid yfele gyldan, ne nanum men nænne
teonan ne don, ac þonne him mon yfel do, he sceal geþyldelice aræfnian;
his fynd mon sceal lufian for Godes lufan; þa wergendan ne sceal mon na
ongeanwerian, ac ma bletsian; ehtnesse for rihte mon sceal eaðmodlice
geþolian.
 4.17.15. Ne sceal mon beon ofermod, ne druncengeorn, ne oferæte,
ne toslapol, ne slaw, ne gnorniende, ne tælende.
 4.17.16. Ac ealne his tohopan he sceal habban on God; ðonne he
hwæt godes deþ, þonne sceal he þæt eal tellan to Gode, and þonne
he hwæt yfeles deþ, he sceal witan, þæt þæt cymð of him
sylfum.
 4.17.20. Domesdæg he sceal simle geþæncean, and hellewitu
he him sceal a ondrædan, and þæs ecean lifes he sceal mid ealre
geornfulnesse girnan, and ælce dæge he him sceal deaðes wenan.
 4.17.23. His weorca he sceal giman on ælce tide, þæt þa
gode sien, and he sceal geþencan, þæt he nahwer Gode dygle ne bið, ac
he hine æghwær gesihþ; þa yflan geþohtas, þe him on mod
becumað, he sceal sona on Criste toslean and his gastlican lareowe andedtan.
 4.18.4. Ðonne he hie toslyhð on Criste, þonne he geðenceð
Cristes þrowunge and his wundra and mid þæm geþohtum aflymeð þa
yfelam geþohtas.
 4.18.6. His muð he sceal from ælcum þweoran and yflum wordum
gehealdan; ne sceal he fela sprecan, ne idele word ne leahtorbere; ne hleahter
ne sceal he lufian.
 4.18.9. Halige rædan he sceal lustlice gehyran and gelome on
gebedum beon; his forðgewitenan yfelu he sceal dæghwamlice mid tearum Gode
andettan and hie georne betan.
 4.18.12. Ne sceal he his lichoman luste folgian; his agenne willan
he sceal onscunian, and his abbodes bebodum on eallum þingum he sceal hyran,
þeah hit sy, swa swa hit ne gedafenað, þæt he wyrs do, þonne he
lære.
 4.18.15. Hie sceolan gemunan þone drihtenlican cwide, on ðæm
he cwæþ: þæt þæt hie eow secgan, do ge þæt, and þæt
þæt hie don, ne don ge þæt.
 4.18.17. Ne sy nan lofgeorn, ne wilnigende, þæt his dæda
halige gesæde sien, ær hie halige weorðan, ac hicge, þæt hit mid
soðe gesæd beon mæge; he sceal Godes bebodu dæghwamlice mid godum
dædum gefyllan and his clænnesse lufian; ne sceal he nænne mon
hatigan; ne sceal he andan and æfest healdan, ne geflit lufian.
 4.18.23. He sceal upahefednesse forfleon and his ealderas
weorðian and his geongran lufian; for Godes lufan for heora fynd hie sceolan
gebiddan; ær sunnan setlgange hie sceolan to sibbe fon wiþ þa
ungeþwæran; and he næfre ne geortreowe be Godes mildse.
 4.19.3. Efne nu þis synd gastlices cræftes tol and gebytla;
ðænne hie from us dæges and nihtes unablinnendlice beoþ gefyllede and
on domesdæge eft betæhte, seo med us bið from drihtne agolden, þe he
sylfa behet, þæt is: þæt mænnisc eage for hire mærðe
micelnesse geseon ne mihte, ne mannes eare gehyran, ne on mannes heortan ne
astah, ðe God ælmihtig gegearwað eallum þam, þe hine lufiað.
 4.19.9. On mynstres claustre geferrædene staþolfæstnes
ealle þas þenunge began sceal and geornfullice wyrcean.
 5.19.13. BE HYRSUMNESSE.
 5.19.14. Ðære forman eaðmodnesse stepe is hyrsumnes butan
elcunge.
 5.19.15. Seo gedafenað þæm þe nan þing him leofre ne
lætað, þonne Crist ælmihtigne.
 5.19.16. Þa hie begað for heora halgan þeowdomes behate,
oþþe for hellewites ogan, oððe for ðæs ecan lifes wuldre.
 5.19.18. Sona swa heom ænig þing fram heora ealdre geboden
bið, hi þæt butan elcunge mid weorce gefremmað, swylce hit fram Gode
sylfum geboden sy.
 5.19.20. Be swilcum drihten þus cwyð: Of eares hlyste he
hyrsumode me.
 5.19.21. Eft he to lareowum þus cwið: Se þe eow gehyrð, he
gehyrð me, and se þe eow mishyrð, he mishyrð me.
 5.20.1. Eornostlice, þa þe þyllice synt, sona swa him hwæt
beboden bið, heora agenne willan aweorpað and swa hwilce bysiga, swa hy on
handa hæfdan, unfulworhte lætað and mid hwatum hyrsumnesse fet þæs
beodendan stefne mid weorce gefolgiað, and swilce on are berhthwile seo
foresæde þæs lareowes hæs and þa fulfremedan þæs
lærincmannes weorc mid Godes eges cafscipe gemænelice butu þa þing
beoð gefyllede.
 5.20.8. On swylcum wunað seo lufu þæs færeldes to ecum
life, forði þonne hi þæne ancsuman weg geceosað, be þæm se
hælend cwyð: Ancsum and neara is se weg, þe to life læt, þæt is,
þæt he be his agenum dome ne libbe, ne he agenum lustum ne hyrsumige, ac
be fremedum dome and hæse donde sy, on mynstre wunigende, þæt abbod his
wealde and tæce, a gewilnige.
 5.20.14. Buton tweon, þa þe þilice beoð, hi
geefenlæcað þone cwide, þe drihten be him sylfum þus cwæþ: Ne
com ic toþi, þæt ic minne agenne willan worhte, ac þæs, þe me
hider sænde.
 5.20.17. Ðeos sylfe hyrsumnes bið Gode antfenge and mannum
lufteme, gif þæt gebodene bið gefremed unforhtlice and unsleaclice and
unasolcenlice and butan ceorunge and butan nellendes andsware; seo hyrsumnes to
soðe, þe bið þæm ealdrum gegearwod, heo bið Gode gedon; he
soðlice sylf þus cwæþ: Se þe eow gehyrð, he gehyrð me.
 5.20.22. And mid godum mode and glædum geþance þa
underþeoddan leorneras heora ealdrum hyran sceolan, forði butan tweon
þæne glædan hyran God lufað and þone unrotan hataþ.
 5.20.25. Witodlice, þeah hwylc leorninccniht his ealdres gebodu
mid weorce gefremme, gif he hit mid muðe beceorað oþþe mid mode
besargað, ne bið hit þeah Gode andfenge, þe ælces mannes heortan
þurhsyhð, ac for swylcere dæde he nane mede æt Gode ne onfehð, ac
gyt ma on ecum wite mid þam murcnerum, þe Gode mishyrdon, bið geset,
butan he mid fulre dædbote his ungeþanc gebete.
 6.21.8. BE SWIGAN.
 6.21.9. Utan don swa swa se witega myngað, þus cweðende: Ic
cwæþ, þæt ic beheolde mine wegas, þæt ic ne gylte þurh mine
tungan; ic gesette minum muþe heordnesse; ic adumbade and an godum clypungum
gestilde.
 6.21.12. Mid þissum wordum se halga witega gesweotulað,
þæt we sceolan idelra worda for synna wite geswigian: þonne he for
swigan mægene foroft godra clypunge geswac, eornostlice mon sceal idelra
worda geswican.
 6.21.16. Þeah fulfremedum leornerum for swigean hefignesse
seldhwænne leaf geseald sie to sprecenne ymbe halige spræca and ymbe
þære saule getimbrunge, forði hit þus awriten is on halgum bocum: On
