Conf 5 (Mone)
B11.5.
Poenitentiale Theodori and Capitula d'Acheriana: Mone 1830, 515-27.



 86. Ne sceal se bisceop him sylf nænie abbod geceosan æfter
dæs oþres deaðe ne be him lifigendum, þeah he on weg gewite and
gesynsigie, ne mot he ðær nænne oðerne to gesettan butan ðæra
broþra willan.
 87. Nis na to onfonne seo halige onsægdnes of ðæs mæsse
preostes handa, þe ne can his orationes and his lectiones mid rihte
gefyllan.
 88. Ða ðe nyton hweðer hig gefullode beoð and lætað hy
æft fullian þat bið swylce hig æft crist ahon, fæsten þonne,
þa hwile þe he libban, ælce frigedæg to anes mæles and þa ðreo
æfestenu.
 89. Gyf þonne hwilc mon wene, þat hit sy alyfed for sumre
clænnesse, þat hyne man tuwa fullige, þonne fæste se III gear on an,
and syððan eac hit bete a mid fæstene and mid ælmessan, þa hwile
þe he libbe.
 90. Beo sunnandæges weorce Grecas and Romana rowað and
ridað, ac man ne mot naðer ne hlaf bacan ne in cræte faran, buton hwa to
cyrcean on farane.
 90. Men ne moten baðian sunnan dagum, ne eac Grecas nellað
openlice writan on ðam dagum, ac gif hwylc nydþearf bið, þonne willað
hy digellice writan in heora husum.
 91. Ða ðe wyrceað sunnandæg æt þam forman cyrre,
Grecas hy ofer cidað, æt þam oðrum cyrre nimað hwæt hwugu on
þæs ðe hy wyrceað, and æt ðam þriddan cyrre þone ðriddan
dæl ðæs þe hig mid gescyldigeað.
 91. And gyf hit synt þeowe men, and hig hit hyra willes doð,
syn hy beswungene, and gif hit syn freo men, fæsten hy VII niht flæsce
and ealað.
 92. Ne sceal cyrcean timber to ænigum oðrum weorce, buton to
oðre cyrcean, oððe hit man for bærne to sumere freme, þe ðam godes
þeowum þearf sy, ðe inin þam mynstre syn, and hit næfre sy gedon
þam leawedum to bryce.
 93. Witodlice nis þat nan riht, þat ænig man for geflite and
for andan wið cweðe godcundra hada cyre and fore stihtunge.
 94. Cyricean man mot settan on oþre stowe, gyf bit nyd þearf
sy, ac hy man ne mot na eft halgian, butan þat an mæsse preost hig geond
stregde mid halig wætere.
 95. Ða neat, þa beoð gemengde to wulfum and to hundum, ne
beoð þa na mannum to etanne, ac swynum and hundum, ne se heort, ne se ra,
gif hy beoð deade fundene.
 96. Grecas ne syllað na hyra swynum astorfen flæsc, ac hy
lyfað þa fel to sceon and þa hyda and þa hornas and þa wulla doð to
nytte, and swa þeah innaht haliglices, and gif hit gelimpð, þat swyn
etað astorfen flæsc, oððe henna mannes blod, ne gelefað we na,
þæt hy syn forðon to aweorpanne.
 97. Fugelas and oðre nytenu næron na lyfede to etanne, gif hi
beoð on nette awyrged, ne ðeah se heafoc hine abite, gif he bið dead
funden.
 98. Ða feower heafod cwidas in actibus apostolorum þus be
beodað, þat man hine forhæbbe fram dyrnum geligere, and fram awyrgedum
nytene, and fram blode, and fram defolgylde.
 99. Hors we ne forbeodað, ac hit is ungewunelio to etanne.
 100. Hara is alyfed to etanne and he his eac swiðe god wið ut
sihðe, and his gealla his swiðe god wið pipor gemenged, wið inwerce and
wið muðsare.
 101. Mid Grecum man moste wifigean æt ðam ðriddan cneowe,
æt þære ealdan æ bebode, and nonu ær æt þam fiftan, æfter
Romana dome, ac swa þeah gif se gesinscipe wurðeð geworht ær ðam
þryddan cneow, ær man þa sibbe wite, ðonne ne mot hine man abrecan, ac
hy sceolan butu on ðe maran for hæfednesse beon, and on mare dæd bote
þonne oðre men.
 101. Ac gif hy ær ðam þriddan cneow hig gesamnien, þonne
is ðæt to brecanne and nis þat nanum men alyfed, þe byð oðrum
æt þam ðriddan cneow oððe near, þat he mine þat wif, þat se
oðer ær hæfde.
 102. Se ðe twige wifige oððe wif ceorlige, fæste I gear,
and siððan a wodnes dagum and frigedagum and þa oðre æfestenu forga
flæsc and naðe raþer forlæte his wif.
 103. Þonne gif wer þrywa wifað, oððe wif ceorlað,
oððe gyt ma, fæste IV gear and þa hwile, þe he lyfige, fæste
wodnesdæge and frigedæge and þa oðre æfestenu forga flæsc, and
ne syn hy na þeah hwe ðære gedælde, gyf hy on riht gesinscipe
gegaderode syn.
 104. Gyf here genime hwylces mannes wif, and he hi ne mage eft
begytan, sy ðam wære alyfed, þat he nime him oðre.
 105. Gyf hwylc wif oððe ceorl gehate, þat hy willan on
mægð hade þurh wunian, and ðonne se ceorl hine geðyðe to hwylcum
wife, ne mot he na þat for lætan, ne heo hine for ðam gehatum, forðy
dyselicu gehat and unaberendlice beoð to abrecanne, ma ðone to healdene.
 106. Gyf hylces mannes wif bið ðearnunga forlegen, ðonne is
him alyfed, þat he forlæte hy and nime him oðre.
 107. Nis þam wife na alyfed, þæt heo forlæte hire wær
butan leafe, þeah heo for beo, buton Basilius demde, þæt heo moste gan
on mynster, gif heo wolde.
 108. Se ðe hæme on sunnandæg, bidde him æt gode
forgifnesse and fæste III dagas.
 109. Nis nanum men alyfed, þæt he nime on his þeowe ænig
feoh, butan his willan and butan forwyrhtum, gif he hit mid rihte gestryneð.
 110. Nis þam mæsse preost alyfed, þat he yppe þæs
bisceopes synne, farðam se bisceop hæfð anweald ofer hine.
 111. Cild man mot sellan into mynstre, þeah man þat oðær
gehate, swa ðeah is betere, þat man þat gehat gelæste.
 112. Eac gelice oðre nytenu man mot alysan, gif hit nydþearf
bið.
 113. Gyf hwylc wif wiccunga bega, and þa deofollican
galdorsangas, blinne and fæste an gear and þa III æfestenu, oððe
þonne gyt ma æfter þæra geearnunga.
 114. Ða wif, ðe doð aworpennysse hyra bearna, þa ylcan
gemete syn hy gedemde ærðon þa bearn cwice syn.
 115. And þonne æfter ðonne þis ymbe XL nihta ðæs
sædes onfengnysse, syn hi geteald to manmydrum, and fæston þonne III
gear, ælce wodnesdæge and frigedæge and þa ðry æfæstenu.
 116. Gyf se leaweda man his agen cild of þrycce and acwelle,
fæste an gear on hlafe and on wætere, and þa II forga flæsc and
ealu, and forhæbbe hine fram ælcum wife, þa hwile þe he ða
dædbote do.
 117. Ða ðe beoð gehadede fram Scyttiscum preostum oððe
bisceopum, oððe fram Bryttiscum, ða ðe sceare nabbað, swa oðre
circlite preost, ne ða eastron swa ne healdað, swa we healdað, þa
scylon æft fram þam riht geleaffullum bisceopum on tendnysse and sumere
oratione beon getrymede.
 118. Eac gelice þa cyrcean, þa beoð fram þam bisceope
gehalgode, sceolan mid halig wætere beon geond stregde.
 119. Se ðe steleð hwæt in godes cyrcean, forgelde hit
feowerfealdlice.
 120. Gyf beo weddod mæden nelle to ðam, þeo heo beweddod
byð, and wæs hiræ willa, forgelde þonne þat feoh, þat heo ær
under feng, and þær to eacan gedð swa mycel, swa ðes feos ðryddan
dæl sy, and þa magas forgeldon þat wedd, and gyf he þonne hy niman
nelle, hæbbe forseald þæt feoh, þæt he sealde.
 121. Se ðe storfan ete, fæste XL daga.
 122. Gyf hine hungor to dryfð, þonne ne dereð hit him na.
 123. Gyf hwylc mæsse preost oððe diacon bringe wif ham on
folcæs gewitnesse, sy he amansumod.
 124. Gyf hwa hæme mid his modor, fæste XV gear, and hit
næfre ne wrixlie buton sunnandæge anum.
 125. Gyf wif ana forlegennysse do mid hyre sylfre, fæste III
gear.
 126. Gyf mæsse preost for his geþohtum weroðeð besmiten,
fæste XX daga.
 127. Gyf he gehrine þa breost mid his hand, fæste III wucan.
 128. Gyf hwilc man þurh nydinga his geþohtes his sæd ageote,
fæste XL daga.
 129. Gyf he hit sylf awæcce, æt þam forman cyrre fæste
XX daga, and æt ðam oðrum XL daga.
 130. Gyf hwylc man on his geðohtum oððe of his gewitte feole,
and him gelimpe þat he man of slea, for geldon þonne man his magas and hine
wið oðær swylc gescyldan.
 131. Gyf man hine ofslea on ðam ungewitte, ær man wite,
hwæþer his magas him fore ðingian willon, forgeldon ðone man his magum
þa men, ðe hine ofslean.
 132. Gyf man þurh ðryst læcnysse man fullað, and ne bið
him sylfe, se bið to aworpenne fram ælcere cyriclicre gesamnunge, and he
ne sy næfre eft gehadod.
 133. Se mæsse preost þe fullað men and man ge ac sige þat
he bið sylf unfullod, sy he ðonne eft gehadod and gefullod and getrymede
mid bisceopes bletsunge, and ealle, ða ðe ær gefullade, syn hy æft
gefullod.
 134. Swa hwilc swa hine sylf ne treowe be his fulluhte, and eac
oðre men nyton, hweðer he gefullod wæs, he sceal beon eft gefullod.
 135. Se ðe for ofer fylle spiwe, reowe III dagas.
 136. Gyf hwylc man hine wið fæmnan forlicge, fæste IV gear,
oððe twa be ðam fullestan.
 137. Se ðe mid oðres ceorles wife hæme, fæste IV gear,
twa on wean weallige, twa elles on ðam feowertigum and þry dagas on wucan.
 138. Gyf bædling mid bædlinge hæme, X winter fæste.
 139. Se ðe þis werlice man deð, IV gear fæste.
 140. Gyf hit cniht sy, æt ærestan II gear, gif he hit æft
do, IV gear fæste.
 141. Gyf he be leoðum deð, an gear oððe III and XL.
 142. Se ðe girneð hine sylfne to forlicgeanne and ne mæg, XL
daga fæste oððe XX daga.
 143. Gyf he hit gedo, XX daga fæste, oððe hine man swynge.
 144. Cnihtas þaðe hæmað heom be tweonan, hit is demed,
þæt hy man swinge.
 145. Se ðe sæd on muð sendeð, þæt is wyrreste.
 146. Se ðe oft hæme se æresta canon demeð, þat he X
winter bete, and se æftera VII gear.
 147. Gyf broðor mid breðer hæme þurh his lichoman
gemegnysse, XV winter fæste buton flæsce.
 148. Gyf modor mit hire littlan suna hæmeð on hire, III gear
flæsces ne onbyrige and ænue dæg on wucan fæste to æfenne.
 149. Se ðe gebismroð sylfran geligera on geðohte, do hreowe,
oððæt se ge þoht se ofer swyðæd.
 150. Se ðe lufige fæmnan on his mode, bidde him æt gode
forgifnesse.
 151. Gyf he secge, þat he hi hæbbe and he hy næbbe, VII
dagas fæste he.
 152. Gyf leaweda man munuc ut of mynstre alæde for stolenne,
gange he on mynstre and gode þeowige, oððe him under mennyssce
þeowdom.
 153. Se ðe oft stale deð, VII gear bete, swa him his scrift
tæce, and se ðe stale deð, and he to bote gecyrreð symle, he sceal
þingian wið þone, þe he abylgð and hit æft agyfæð, þonne
lyttlað he ðæt fæsten.
 154. Gyf he nyle oððe ne mæg, þa settan tida he fæste.
 155. Se ðe samnað ungemetligce for his unwysdome, sylle he
ðone ðriddan dæl þeorfum.
 156. Gyf he gehalgod þing forsteleð, III gear fæste butan
flæsce.
 157. Gyf leaweda man oðerne ofslihð for feorþinge, gif he
nylle his wepn forlætan, VII gear fæste, III butan flætce and
ealað.
 158. Gyf hwylc man munuc oððe cleric acwelle, forlæte his
wepn and gode þeowige oððe VII gear fæste, and þæt beo be
bisceopes dome.
 159. Se ðe man of sleað on folcgefeahte, XL daga fæste, and
gif he hit þurh yrre do, III gear bete.
 160. Gyf he ðurh druncen oððe þurh oðerne cræft man
ofslea, III gear fæste oððe ma.
 161. Gyf he ðurh unnytte ceaste man ofslea, X gear bete.
 162. Se man se ðe mænneað swereð on cyricean, XI gear
fæste.
 163. Gyf he hit benyde do, III feowertigo fæste.
 164. Se ðe on mannes handa að swerige, nabbað þat Grecas
for riht.
 165. Gyf he on bisceopes handa oððe on mæssepreostes handa,
oððe on diacones, oððe on weofode, oððe on gehalgedum cristes
mæle, and se að bið mæne, III gear fæste.
 166. Gyf he on ungehalgodum cristes mæle man swered, an gear
fæste.
 167. Ða ðe mane aðas begað, III gear bete.
 168. Se ðe oft and gelome feola heafodlicra gylta gemyrceð,
þat is morðor, and mæne aðas, and yfelra geligera mid wifum and mid
nytenum, forleta ða yfela dæda and ga on mynstre and bete oð his
deað.
 169. Beo þam feo, ðe bið on fremdre mægðe and on feondum
of genumen, þat bið on oðrum kininge ofercumenum, gesylle ðæs
ðriddan dæl þearfum, and godes ciricum gedæle and feowertig daga
fæste, forðam hit bið kyninges hæs.
 170. Se ðe mannes blod oððe sæd drinceð, III gear
fæste.
 171. Gyf man oðrum men æht gestryde, forgelde hit feower
fealdlice, swa Crist sylfa cwæð.
 172. Gyf holinga hwylc man mid unclænnysse handa his mete oð
hrineð, oððe hunde, oððe catte, oððe mus, oððe nytenu, and
unclæne blod on ungewis þigeð, ne sceðeð him þæt.
 173. And se ðe for nyd þearfe þigeð þat nyten þe
unclene bið gesawen, fugel oððe wil deor, ne sceðæð him ðæt.
 174. Gyf fugeles meox on wætan befeallað, sy hit of anumen and
do halig wæter on, þonne bið clæne se mete.
 175. Forþon se ðe mid blode oððe mid ænige unclæne
þinge sy besmiten, gif he hit ðigeð and ne wat, ne dereð hit him na.
 176. Gyf he hit wat, bete be ðæs widles gemete.
 177. Gyf bisceop oððe mæsse preost hæmen, þoligean
heora hades oððe hrædlice blinnon.
 178. Messepreost, gif he fæmnan cysse ðurh his lust, XX daga
fæste.
 179. Gyf hwylc mæsse preost untrumum men spræce for wyrne and
he þonne on ðære tyddernysse swelte, sy he on domesdæg þæra
sawla scyldig.
 179. Forðon ðe dryhten sylfa cwæð, on swa hwylcum
ðæge swa se synfulla man gecyrred bið, life he leofað and nane
swylteð.
 179. Seo soðe gehwyrfednys mæg beon on ðæra yte mæstan
tide, forðon ðe dryhten ne sceawað na þat an ðæra tida lenge ac
ða clænan heortan.
 179. Swylce se sceaða on þara ytemæstan tide andetnysse on
anre beorht hwyle geearnode þat he moste beon on neorxna wonges gefean swa to
ælmihtigum gode gelæded.
 180. Munuc oððe nunne, gyf heo bearn gestreonen, VII gear
beten.
 181. Se ðe oft þurh reðnysse his geþances sæd ageoteð,
XL daga fæste.
 182. Se ðe sleapende on cyricean his sæd ageoteð, III dagas
fæste.
 183. Gyf he betuh ðeoh do, an gear oððe III feowertigo.
 184. Gyf hit cnyht sy, XX daga fæste, oððe hine man swynge.
 185. Gyf he hit mid gehadedum men do, III feowertigo oððe eal
gear fæste.
 186. Gyf munuc gewyteð fram godes cyrcean, VII gear fæste.
 187. Ðæs forlorenan hades hreow bið deað ac seo sawl
leofað.
 188. Se ðe gewemmeð his þone nehstan wif, III gear fæste
butan his agenum wife, and on oðre wucan II dagas oððre þreo
feowertigo.
 189. Gyf hit byð fæmnan, an gear fæste, butan flæsce and
ealoð and liðe.
 190. Gyf he nunnan gewemme, III gear fæste, swa heo cenne, swa
heo nane cænne.
 191. Gyf hit mennen sy, six monað fæste and eac alyse hy.
 192. Gyf wif gewite fram hire wære, an gear fæste, gif heo
unbesmiten to him gecyrð.
 193. Elcora, gif heo oðre ham lædeð, III gear fæste.
 194. Wif on gebyrdum monða tidum ne gange heo on cyrcean ne to
husle ne gangan naðer ne nunnon ne leawede, gif hig þonne geþryst
læcan, III wucan fæste, forlegene wif VII gear fæste.
 195. And swylce wifman hreowe do on þa ilcan wisan gif heo on
cyrcean gange ær þæs blodes clænnysse, þæt is, feowertig daga
fæste.
 196. Gif se wer mid his wife hindan hæme, XL daga fæste.
 197. On oðre stowe hit cwið, þe he sceolo reowe don, swa se
ðe mid nytenum hæmð.
 198. Gyf he on ðam monðe ær ðam beorðre hire mid
hæmd, XL daga fæste.
 199. Gyf wif hire bearn þurh morðor acwælleð, XV winter
fæste and næfre ne awænde butan sunnan dæg.
 200. Ðearfende wif gif heo acwelleð cild, VII gear is gecweden,
þæt heo fæste.
 201. Wif seo ðe bearn onfehð and þat acwelleð on hire
innoðe, an gear fæste.
 202. Gyf heo æfter XL dagum hit acwelleð, swa swa myrðra heo
sceal hreowe don.
 203. Gyf þat cild swelte III wintra eald butan fulluhte, III gear
fæste fæder and modor.
 204. Seo ðe acwelleð hire cild butan fulluhte, X gear
fæste.
 205. Ða ðe onsæcgeað deoflum and þam leasestum þingum,
an gear fæste.
 206. Gyf hwylc wif seteð hire bearn ofer rof oððe on ofen for
hwilcere untrymðe hælo, VII gear fæste.
 207. Se ðe corn bærneð for lifigendra hælo ðear deade
men beoð bebyrgde, VII gear fæsten.
 208. On canone hit cwið, se ðe halsunga and galdor creaftas and
swefn hrace behealdað, þa beoð on hæðenra manna gerime.
 209. And eac swylce þa þe oðre men on ðam drycræfte
gebringað, gif hy on mynstre syn, syn hy ut aworpene, gif hy on folce syn,
betan fulre bote.
 210. Swyn þa ðe mannes blod eteð, þa man mot þicgean.
 211. Ac gif hy deade men terað, ne beoð hy alyfeðe to etanne
ær ymbe geares gang, þat him sy þat flæsc of agan.
 212. Se ðe hæme mid his swister, XII winter fæsten.
 213. Gyf wer and wif hig gesamnian and heo þonne secge, þæt
he ne mæg hæman mid hyre, gif heo hit þonne gecyðan mæge, þat
hit soð seo, nime hire oðorne.
 214. Se fæder mot his sunu for mycelre nydþearfe on þeowet
gesyllan, oððæt he bið VII siðon, he ne mot syððan, butan hit
his agen willa sy.
 215. Feowertyne wyntre man hine sylfre mæg þeowne gedon, ne
bið alyfeð æt þam þeowan his feoh to nimanne, þæt he mid his
swynce begiteð.
 216. Ðreo æfestenne beoð on geare on godes folce, XL daga
ær eastron, ðær þonne teoðan dæl þæs geares we sceolan
ageldan, and XL nihta ær ures dryhtnes gebyrdtide, and ofer pentecosten
þær bið L nihta ofer eastron þonne XL.
 217. Se ðe for deadne man fæsteð, wel he him fultumað.
 218. Cyning gif he hafað oþres kyninges land, he hit mot syllan
for his sawle.
 219. Swa hwylc man swa ðas scrift boc tilige to abrecanne ecre
fordemednysse, he sy fordemed, Amen.

END_TEXT

Conf 7 (Ker)

Directions to recite the Penitential Psalms: Ker 1957, p. 24.



 1. Gif ðu wille for þinra synna bereowsunge gedon &
andetnesse þinra scylda þonne scealt þu swa mycel swa ðu meaht mid
inreweardan heortan na mid efestlican wordan ac mid geþencendan mode þas
vii Daviðes psalms to dædbote gelomlice singan.
 5. & þu findæst swiðe hrædlice godes mildheortnesse
ymban ðe & þin mod bið mid gastlicere blisse onlihted.

 1. An messe forstant XII daga feasten, X messan IIII monað, XX

 3. Þeos godcundnes ys gesæt wyð manna firenum & gyltum,

 6. Hund twelftig saltera sealma gæð for XII monþa festen, l

Conf 9.1 (Forst)
B11.9.1.
Forms of Confession and Absolution (Cambridge, Corpus Christi College, MS. 190): Forster 1942, 14-18.



 1. Ic andette þe, Drihten ælmihtig God, & sanctam Marian,
þinre haligan modor, & eallum haligum & þe, bisceop, ealle mine
synna, þe ic earminge fram minre iuguðe oð þas tid ongean Godes
gesetnysse gefremede, on gyfernisse & on druncennysse, & on
unrihthæmede & on galnysse, on unrotnysse & on asolcennysse, &
on yrre & on yfelre gewylnunge, on andan & on yfelnisse, on hatunge
& on geflitfulnysse, on mænan aðe & on swicolnysse, on leasunge
& on ydele wuldre, on modignysse, on gesihðe & on leahtre, on
gehernesse & on swæcce, on stynce & on hrepunge, on leasre
gewitnysse, on gytsunge & on manslihte & on æræte & on
oferfylle & on eallum þweorum dædum.
 14. For þam ic bydde þe, sanctam Mariam, ures Drihtenes modor
& sanctum Michaelem þone heahengel & sanctum Petrum mid eallum
apostolum & sanctum Stephanum mid eallum martirum & ealle Cristes
andetras & ealle halige & gecorene fæmnan & þe, bisceop,
þæt ge gebiddan for me, þam unwurþestan synfullan, to þam
ælmihtigan Gode, þæt he us for urum synnum miltsige.
 21. Gemyltsige eow se ælmihtiga God & forgife eow ealle
eowre synna & alyse eow fram eallum yfelum dædum & gehealde eow fram
eallum synnum.
 23. & gelæde us Crist, þæs lifiendan Godes sunu, into
þam ecean life, Amen.

END_TEXT

Conf 9.3.1 (Hallander)
B11.9.3.1.
Forms of Confession and Absolution (London, British Library, MS. Royal 2B.V): Hallander 1968, 100-02.



 1. Myn drihten god ælmihtig, ic þe eom andetta minra synna
þara þe ic on minre gemeleste wiþ þe geworhte.
 2. Min dryhten god ælmihtig, ic þe eom andetta bote for mines
lichoman unsyfernessum þara þe ic dæges & nihtes worhte, ic eom
gewita morþres & ic eom wedloga & manra aþæ gewita, ic hit þe
min god andette for ealle mine dæda ge godes ge yfles.
 3. Min drihten god ælmihtig, ic eom oferfangen mid synnum to
wyrmlice forþon þe ic forgemeleasade þine beboda.
 3. Ic eom andetta bote for ealles mines lichoman gecynde & for
ealle þa wæstmas ðe minan synfullan lichoman gesette synd.
 3. Nu ic þe bidde, min drihten, for ealra þinra haligra lufan,
þeah ic þe þus synful to cige for minum nydþearfum þæt þu
gehæle mine sawle for minum synnum.
 4. Min drihten god, for ealra þinra apostola weorðunge ic þe
halsige þæt þu me ne forlæte on þæm egesfullan domes dæge,
þeah ic awacode.
 5. Min drihten god, for minre tyddernesse þeah ic þine bebodu
ne heolde.
 6. Nu ic þe þeah halsige, min drihten god, for þære
þrowunge þe þu þrowodest for ealra manna hælo, & ic þe
halsige, ælmihtig god, for þinum wuldorlican wuldre, hæle me for
soþfæstra sawla onfenge.
 6. Min drihten god, for þon þu wære in byrgenne geset, ne
læt me belucan on synfulra monna eardungstowe.
 7. Nu ic minum gewyrhtum þus wace truwige for minum synfullum
dædum.
 7. Min drihten god ælmihtig forgif me minra synna lissæ for
minre nydþearfe.
 8. Min drihten god ælmihtig forðon þu wære eadig on
ðinre modor innoþe ne forlæt me.
 9. Min sanctus Michael archangelus beo þu me þingere to
þæm heofenlican scyppende to ælmihtigum gode for minum mænigfealdum
synnum.
 9. Min drihten god, sele me gedefe hreowe & soþe andetnesse
ealra minra synna þara ðe ic on minre gemeleste gedyde wiþ weras oþþe
wið wif oþþe on diglum me mid synfyllum dædum gefylde.
 10. Min drihten god, ne læt me synfulne man deoflum gegan þeah
hi me þus synlice costedon forðon þu on syx dagum gescope heofonas &
eorþan & ealle weoroldgesceafta.
 11. Min drihten god, for ealræ þære gesceafte þe þu on
syx dagum gesceapen hæfdest & þa þu gerestes on þæm seofoðan
dæge, Min drihten god, for þinan restingdæge gehæl mine sawle fram
deofles anwealde of þem synfullan ham forþon ðær bið sorhful wop.
 12. Min drihten god, ne læt me aslidon on þa synfullan
eardungstowe þeah mine gewyrhta þus wace syn for minum gemelystum.
 13. Nu ic þe bidde, min drihten, þæt þu me selle god
ingehyd & gemynd þæt ic gelyfe on ðe & on ða ealle þe for
þinum naman þrowodon.
 13. Min drihten, ic þe bidde for ealra þinra apostola
arwyrþnesse þæt ðu me ne sceade of þæm soþfæstan ðe on
ðe gelyfaþ on fæder & on suna & on þæne halgan gast.
 13. Nu ic halsige þa heofanlican fæmnan Sanctam Marian, swylce
ic Michahel & Gabriel & Raphael, Iohannes, & Petrus, & Paulus,
& Andreas, Iohannes & Iacob, Matheus & Iudas, Philippus &
Bartholomeus, Thomas & Iacob, Symon & Taddeus.
 13. Nu ic halsige þa cristes þegnas for hiora ealdorlican setle
þæt ge me synfulne manne sceadon on þa earmfullan þystra for minum
yflum weorcum.
 14. <foreign>Per te Ihesu Xriste saluator mundi qui in trinitate perfecta
uiuis et regnas in secula seculorum, Amen</foreign>.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Conf 9.3.2 (Logeman)
B11.9.3.2.
Forms of Confession and Absolution (London, British Library, MS. Royal 2B.V): Logeman 1889a, 112-15.



 1. <foreign>Confessio et Oratio. </foreign> Eala þu ælmihtiga god
unasecgendlicere mildheortnesse, eala þu god unametenre arfæstnysse, eala
þu god scyppend & geedstaþeliend ealles mann cynnes, þu þe
afeormast fram fulum synnum þæra heortan þe þe andettað & ða
þe hi sylfe wregað ætforan gesihðe þinre mildheortnysse þa þu
alyst fram bende ælcere unrihtwisnysse þine mihte.
 1. Ic bidde mid ealre geomerunge þæt þu ðurh
menigfealdnysse þinra mildheortnyssa me forgife þæt ic hluttre
andetnysse ætforan þe don mote be eallum minum synnum þe min ingehyd me
nu wregð.
 1. & ic soðe dædbote ætforan þe don mote be eallum
þam synnum þe ic gesyngode on yfelum geþohtum & on þwyrum
smeageongum, on yfelre geþafunge & on unrihtwisum geþeahte, on
unclænre lust fullunge & on fracodre gewilnunge, on ydelum wordum &
on yfelum dædum.
 15. Ic syngode on gesihðe & swiðe on hlyste, eac on
swæcce, on stence & on hrewunge.
 17. Þu leofa drihten ealle lima me gesceope to menniscum bricum
gemæte & gelimplice ac ic earming hi awende to deoflicum weorcum &
mid synnum hi befylde & þe forseah drihten.
 20. Ic on ofermettum oft swiðe agylte & þurh upahefednysse
me to foran oþrum tealde & þine beboda drihten dyde me unwurðe.
 22. & ic nolde wegan þin wynsume geocne, ðine leohtan
byrþene on minum bæce ferian & ic unwærlice syngode oft þurh
modignysse.
 25. Ic on gyfernysse & on oferfylle & on druncennysse wið
þe drihten agylte oft & gelome on untiman.
 26. Ic eac earming ofer ælcum gemete on fulum forligre & on
fracodre galnysse me sylfne befylde ge on sawle ge on lichaman.
 29. Ic on gitsunge mid gitsigendum mode swiðe oft agylte &
beswac oðre æt heora æhtum þurh þa unrihtwisan gitsunge & ic
unriht oft spræc arleaslice & riht forsuwode þurh þone sylfan
leahter.
 32. Ic þurh weamodnysse worhte fela yfela & þurh manslihtas
me scyldigne dyde wið þe min hælend þa þa ic þin hand geweorc
unwyrcan dorste & deaðe betæcan.
 35. Nu synd mine handa þurh þone hefian gylt mid manna blodum
þe ic þurh gebeot oft & þurh hatheortnysse her on life ageat yfele
befylede & fæste gebundene swarum gyltum þurh þa sylfan
weamodnysse.
 38. Ic on unrotnysse oft eac agylte & swiðor ceorude þonne
min sawul behofode þa ða ic æhta forleas oððe leofne freond oððe
me hwæt mislamp on þises lifes ryne.
 42. & ic þa ongean þe drihten dyrstiglice ceorode þurh
þa unrotnysse þe is deaðes wyrcend.
 43. In syngode gelome þurh asolcennysse þa þa me god ne lyste
don ne gan to godes huse ne nan ellen niman to ænigum godan weorce.
 46. Ac ic leofode min lif lange on asolcennysse butan godum weorcum
& godum biggenge.
 47. Ic on idelum wuldre eac swylce agylte on gylp licere spræce
& gylpes cewte & wolde beon gehered þeah ðe ic herigendlic
nære.
 50. & on wlence ic ferde þurh þæt idele wuldor &
manna lyffetunge ic lufode to swiðe & on menigfealdre glencge ic glencgde
minne lichaman & mid sweartum synnum mine sawle awlætte & wolde beon
wið utan swa þeah wurðlic ge þuht.
 54. On eallum þisum heafod leahtrum ic healice agylte &
oðrum læssum gyltum ic gelome syngode & ic eaðe ne mæg mine
gyltas atellan.
 56. Ic bidde swa þeah drihten þæt hi beon þe geandette mid
soðre behreowsunge & þu mine sawle gehæle fram eallum synnum, þu
ðe eart sawla alysend.
 59. Ðu sealdest us hælend healicne truwan þurh ezechiel
cweþende þinne soðan witegan, gif se arleasa deð soðæ dædbote
be eallum his synnum þe he ær geworhte & ealle mine beboda gehylt
& deð rihtwisnysse & demð rihtlice he leofað his life & he
nane swylt.
 64. & ic ne gemune ealra his mandæda ac he leofað on his
rihtwisnysse þe hesylf geworhte.
 65. Eac þu sylf drihten sædest on þinum godspelle þæt
mare bliss bið on heofonum be anum synfullan men gif he gecyrð to þe
þonne be nigon & hundnigantigan þe nanre dædbote ne behofiað.
 69. Underfoh me nu drihten for þinre mildheortnysse &
aþweah me þurh þæs halgan gastes gife fram eallum minum synnum &
sele me staðolfæste heortan þæt ic ælc yfel onscunige &
ælce unrihtwisnysse & ic þine bebodu lufige & þe leofa,
drihten.
 73. Nel æt þu me æfre bugan to þam ærran leahtrum þe
ic receleas gefremode fullice for oft ac geedstaðela on me þu
ærfæstosta hælend swa hwæt swa ic amyrde þurh manfulle dæda.
 77. Gescylde me, drihten, wið þone swicolan deofol þæt he
me earmne oft ne beswice forþan þe min tyddernys ne mæg him wið
standan butan þu leofa hælend on lihte mine heortan & mid þinre
mihtigan handa me gehealde wið hine.
 81. Ðu miht eall þæt þu wylt swa swa ælmihtig god &
þu naht ne swincst þeah þu gescylde us heald me for þig leofa to lofe
þinum naman þæt ic on godum weorcum wunian mote oð mines lifes ende
mid soðum geleafan.
 85. Ic bidde þe nu, hælend, þæt þu gehæle mine sawle
þæt ic dælnimend beo on þam forman æriste swa þæt min sawul
of synnum nu arise þæt heo þe orsorhre on þam oþrum æriste
lichamlice arise to þam ecan life.
 89. Syle me nu scyppend gesælig geþanc & þa halgan mihte
þe men þurh geþeoð geleafan & hiht & halige lufe, modes
snoternysse & mihtig geþyld, ge metegunge & anrædnysse,
rihtwisnysse & mildheortnysse, clænnysse & cystignysse, sibbe &
arfæstnysse, soðfæstnysse & welwillendnysse wuldres, drihten.
 94. & syle me forgifennysse ealra minra synna & þæt
ece lif æfter þisum lænan life.
 96. Hælend crist, gehyr þas word þu ðe leofast &
rixast mid þam ælmihtigan fæder & þam halgan gaste butan anginne
& ende, Amen.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Conf 9.4 (Logeman)
B11.9.4.
Forms of Confession and Absolution (London, British Library, MS. Cotton Tiberius C.I): Logeman 1889a, 101-3.



 1. Ic eom þe ealra anddettende & þinum englum mid hreowe
& minum gastlicum scrifte for mine sawle & lichaman þe ic on
gesingode.
 3. Ic eom anddetta sodomitiscre synne þe hig ongegylton, þæt
ys geligre leasunga & gytsunga, getrywleasnyssa & þristleasnyssa
minra synna.
 6. Ic eom ealles anddetta morðor slihta, mænra aða,
tælnessa & twispræce & gytsungæ oðra manna feos, ideles
gylpes & unsibbe.
 8. Ic eom ealles andetta þæt ic wæs synna hyrde & syna
lareow.
 9. Ic eom ealles anddetta minum drihtene ofermodnysse,
unhyrsumnyssa, leasunga & receleasnyssa, gesewenlicra lusta &
ungesewenlicra þæra þe ic æfre gefremede on cyrcan oððe butan
cyrcan.
 12. Ic eom anddetta þæt ic onfeng on minne muð wealworda
& yfelre reþnysse, unnytra blissa þæra þe ic on minum mode
hæbbe minum willan oððe unwillan, gesewenlicra lusta oððe
ungesewenlicra þe ic eagon geseon mihte oððe earum gehyran oððe fotum
ge eode.
 17. Ic eom anddetta for fell, for flæsc, for ban, for sinuwa,
for muð, for tungan, for fet, for feax, for tearas, for mearh, for weres
sædes gewilnunga & wif manna gemanan & for gehwæt ðæs þe
me innan oððe utan gebyrede.
 21. Min drihten ælmihtig ealles þises ic eom þe forgyfnysse
biddende for ealra þinra haligra lufon þæt me næfre deofel naht onne
mæge bestælan æt minum ende dæge ne on domes dæg.
 25. Ic eom anddetta for eall þæt unriht þe ic æfre
gefremede on minum cildhade oððe on minre geogoðe oððe on minre
strengðe oððe on minre ylde þe æfter fulwihte agylte & on
manegum þingum swiðe gode abealh.
 28. Ic eom anddette gode & menniscum men gastcundum læce
sunnan dæges gylta þonne ic gastlic weorc wyrcan sceolde & on þam ic
fela dyde þæs ðe ic don ne scolde on unnettum stedum & setlum ge on
gangum ge on fenge ge on clyppe ge on hlehtre ge on spræce ge on unnyttum
luste ge on monigfealdum receleasnyssum gedyde & on oferæte & on
oferdruncenne.
 35. & me ys & me wæs min unnyt willa miceles to leof ge
on dæg ge on niht ge on æwfæstenum.
 37. Ic gesyngode þæt ic forhogode þa & eac on ðam
beboddagum þinra haligra þonne ic me are biddan scolde ic þa areceleasode
& to læt wæs mine cyrcan to secenne on ealle tid & hi oft sohte
for manne ege swiðor þone for godes.
 41. Ic ðe anddette min drihten þæt ic on eallum godes
bebodum wæs gymeleasra þone ic scolde & ealra synna ic eom anddetta
þæra ðe ic æfre gefremede wið minre sawle þearfe.
 44. & ic bidde ælmihtigne god for his miclan mildheortnysse
þæt he me syg arfæstra þone ic wið hine geworhtage ðæt he me
ne læte sceððan þa fyrenfullan æt minum ende dæge, ne minum
lichaman ne minum gaste, Amen.
 49. Ic andette þe drihten ælmihtig god & sancta marian
þinre haligan moder & eallum halgum & þe bisceop ealle mine synna
þe ic erminge fram minre iuguðe oð ðas tid ongean godes gesetnysse
gefremede on gifernysse & on druncennysse, on unrihthæmede, on galnyssa,
on unrotnyssa & on asolcennyssa, on hyrre & on yfelre gewilnunge, on
andan & on yfelnysse, on hatunge & on geflitfulnyssæ, on mænan
aðe, & on swicolnyssæ, on leasunge & on idele wuldre, on
modignysse, on gesihðe & on leahtre, on gehernysse & on spræce, on
stynce & on repunge, on leasre gewitnyssæ, on gytsunge & on
manslyhte, on æræte & on oferfylle & on eallum þweorum
dædum.
 60. Forþam ic bidde þe & sanctam mariam ures drihtenes
moder & sanctum michahelem þone heahengel & sanctum petrum mid eallum
apostolis & sanctum stephanum mid eallum martiribus & ealle cristes
andetteras & ealle halige & gecorene fæmnan & þe bisceop
þæt ge gebiddan for me þam unwyrðestan synfullan to þam
ælmihtigan gode þæt he us for urum synnum gemiltsige.
 67. Gemiltsige eow se ælmihtiga god & forgyfe eow ealle
eowre synna & alyse eow fram eallum yfelum dædum & gehealde eow fram
eallum synnum & gelæde us crist þæs lyfiendan godes sunu into þam
ecan lyfe, Amen.

END_TEXT

Conf 9.5 (Forst)
B11.9.5.
Forms of Confession and Absolution (Paris, Biblioth&e`;que Nationale, MS. Lat. 10575): Forster 1927-8, 114.



 1. Broðor ða leofestan, we onlysað eow of synna bendum on
gewrixle ðæs eadegan Petres, ðara apostola ealdres, ðamðe ure
dryhten ðone anweald sealde synna to gebindenne & eft to onlysenne.
 7. Ac swa miclum swa eow tobelimpð eowra synna gewregednes &
us togebyreð sio forgifenes, sie god ælmihtig, lif & hælo, eallum
eowrum synnum forgifen ðurh ðone ðe mid him leofað & ricsað geond
worlda/ world, Amen.

Conf 10.1 (Thorpe)
B11.10.1.
Formulas and Directions for the Use of Confessors (Cambridge, Corpus Christi College, MS. 190): Thorpe 1840, II, 224-8.



 1. Ðys syndon þa godcundan bebodu þe we scylon healdan.
 2. Ðæt ys ærest, seo soðe lufu Godes & manna &
clænnysse & fæsten & soðfæstnysse & beon eaðmode &
gemetfæste & fremsume & geþyldige & manþwære &
cumliðe & ælmysfulle & haligwæccan & beon mildheorte &
gesybsume.
 8. And þas þing we scylon forgan, þæt ys, oferhyd &
gytsunge & æfest & ydelne gylp & stala & reaflac &
unrihthæmed & oferdruncenys & morðor & mæne aþas &
leasunga & wyrignyssa & gecyd.
 14. Ðeos tid cymð ymbe twelfmonað þæt ælc man sceal
his scrift gesprecan & be his scriftes leafan on his fæsten fon &
Gode & his scrifte his gyltas andettan þa þe he geworhte oþþe on
manslihte oþþe on morðre oþþe on unrihthæmede oþþe on
ænigum þara þinga þe man wið God agyltan mæg.
 21. Þonne hafa þu rihtne geleafan to Gode & to þysse
godan tide & geornne beo betende þæs þu wite þæt þu geworht
hæbbe mid þinum fæstene & mid þinre ælmyssan & mid þinum
gebedum þe þu betst cunne & ælce Sunnandæg to cyrcan cum &
þær georne for þe sylfne gebide & for eall gefullod folc & for
þinne scrift þonne byst þu on ure eallra gebedrædene.
 30. Min leof, ic þe lære þæt þu þence hu þu hider
on world acenned wære oþþe þurh hwæt oþþe on hwon þu þas
lænan world & hu þin lichama & þin sawl hi gedælan scylon
& syþþan on hwylcere anbidstowe þin sawl bidan mote domes dæges
& eac þa tid þonne þin sawl & þin lichama gegaderode beon
scylon & eft to Godes dome gelædd & þonne þu scealt & ælc
man for his agenum gewyrhtum riht agyldan & onfon æt þam dome.
 41. & syþþan mid sawle & mid lichaman onfon swa ecum
life swa ecum deaþe swa þu ær geworhtest swa ecum life swa ungeendodon
wite.
 45. Ðonne þu on morgen ærest arise sena þe swyþe georne
& Gode bebeod þonne þu þe restan wylle do þæt ylce þinga þe
wið God þurh þinra synna andetnysse & bote þæt God þurh
þæt þe on worlde þine synna forgyfe & æfter worlde ece reste
& his mildheortnysse.
 51. Uton, min leof, geþencan hwylce ure yldran ær wæron
& hwylce we synd nu oþþe hwylce þa synd nu to sceawigenne þa þe
for hund wintrum mid eorðan moldan bewrogene wæron swylce þonne we
beoð sona swa us seo sawl of þam lichaman slypð.
 57. Uton þonne, min leof, þa hwile þe us God unne beorgan us
wið synna & wið þa unþeawas þe us deoful læreð.
 60. Ælc gramfærnys cymð of deofle & ælc geflit &
ælc ungelimp, þonne uton wiðstandam him & liþegian ure mod &
biddan us Godes miltse & his fultumes þæt we magon his bebodu
healdan.
 65. Uton secan ure cyrcean Sunnandagum & mæssedagum &
betweoh þam tidum symble swa betere swa oftor & beorgon us wið æfest
& wið yrre & wið unnytte word & wið oferdruncennysse &
wið tælnysse & wið twyspræcnysse & wið lease gewitnysse
& wið morþor & wið mæne aþas & wið oftrædlic
hæmed & wið ælce unclænnysse ures lichaman.
 73. And uton geþencan hu besceawigende we scylon beon ure sawle
& ures lichaman þa hwile þe us God unne þæt we her beon þæt
we huru æfter þysse worlde reste habbon mid Godes mildse.
 79. Min Drihten, ic þe bidde, þu þe cwæde on þinum
godspelle to eallum rihtgelyfedum mannum, <foreign>Petite et dabitur vobis</foreign>, Biddað
& eow bið geseald.
 82. Ic þe þonne min Drihten eaðmodlice bidde þæt þu me
forgyfe þæt ic þæs bidde þæs þe þin willa sig & minre
sawle ræd on ecnysse & mines worldlifes bletsung anstande.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Conf 10.2 (CCCC 320)
B11.10.2.
Formulas and Directions for the Use of Confessors (Cambridge, Corpus Christi College, MS. 320): Dictionary of Old English transcript, edited from MS.



 1. Gelyfst ðu on god ælfmihtine & on þone sunu & on
one halgan gast.
 2. Gelyfst ðu þæt ealle men sceal onarisan on domes dæg.
 2. Ofðincð þe eall þæt þa to yfele hæfst geþoht
& gecweden & geworht god þe sylle forgyfenysse.
 4. Ic bidde þe ærest for godes lufon & for his ege
þæt þu þin lif mid rihte lybbe & þinum drihtne mid eaðmedum
hyre & ðinne cristendom & þin fulwiht wel healde.
 6. & beorh ðe georne wið þa viii heah synna þe se
deoful us wyle mid beswican gif he mæg, þæt syndon morðor & stala
& mæneaðas & unrihtgitsung & unrihthæmed & gifernyssa
& tælnyssa & lease gewitnyssa.
 10. Ac lufa þinne drihten mid eallum mægene & mid eallum
mode inneweardre heortan.
 11. & sing þine gebedu to ælcre tide pater noster &
credan buton þu mare cunne gif þu ne cunne leorna.
 13. & gebide for ðinne fæder & þine moder & for
þinne hlaford & for eall cristen folc.
 13. Ic þe bidde & beode þæt þu gode ælfmihtigum
gehyrsum sy forðam þe me ys micel þearf þæt ic þe riht lære.
 16. & ðe ys neadþearf þæt þu riht do þæt þu
ne/ læte ungeandet ænige synne ðære þe ðu geworht hæbbe ne si
heo naðer ne to þan micel ne eft to þam lytel ne ðe næfre ne þince
to ðam hefig ne to þam uneaðelic ne to þam fullic to secgenne þæt
þu hit læte æfre ænig wiht ungeandet.
 20. & geþenc þæt þu anne nacodne lichaman in ðas
worold brohtest & þu hine scealt eft ana alætan buton þu hwæt for
godes lufon to gode gedo.
 22. & geþenc þæt þe is seo tid swiðe uncuð &
se dæg þæt þu scealt ðas lænan woruld forlætan to godes dome
gelæded beon.
 24. Nis nan leahter swa healic þæt man ne mæge gebetan gif
he his yfeles geswicð & mid soðre hreowsunge his gyltas be lareowa
tæcinge behreowsað.
 26. Se man ðe wile his synna behreowsian & bewepan þonne
mot he georne warnian þæt he eft þam yfelum dædum ne geedlæce.
 28. Se man þe æfter dædbote his manfullan dæda
geedniwað se greman god & he bið þam hunde gelic þe spið &
eft yt þæt he ær spaw.
 30. God ælfmihtig gefultumige us þæt we moton & magon
godes miltse begytan ða hwile þe we on þisum earman life beon moton.

END_TEXT

Conf 10.3 (Logeman)
B11.10.3.
Formulas and Directions for the Use of Confessors (London, British Library, MS. Cotton Tiberius A.III): Logeman 1889b, 513-15.



 1. Gif þu wilt nu læof ealswa þe micel þearf is andetnysse
don ealra þinra synna þonne do þu þæt mid ealre georfulnysse &
mid ealre eadmodnysse & ne gescamige þe naht for þam þanan cymð
forgifnes.
 4. And butan andetnesse nis nan forgefenes.
 5. Micle betere is þam men þæt him scamige her on life
beforan anan men his synna þonne him scyle eft gescamian on godes dome
ætforan heofenwaran & eorðwaran & helwaran þær ne mæg nan
man nan þing gode bediglian þæs þe he æfre her on life geworhte
godes oþþe yfeles for þam se þe behyt his leahtras ne bið he
gerihtwisad.
 11. & se þe hi soðlice geandet he alysð his sawle of
deaðe ealswa ure leofa drihten on his godspelle cweð, doð dædbote
eowra synna, soðlice heofena rice to eow genealæcð.
 14. Hit micel neod þonne we fela þurh deofles lare doð ongean
godes willan & bebod þæt we þonne eac þurh soðe eadmodnesse and
andetnysse betan þæt georne hreowsigende ealswa hit gesettan halige
fæderas.
 17. & ealle þa yfelan geþanc þe þe on heortan becumað
þurh deofles onbrincg andette þu þa þinum scrirfte þæt þu mote
þurh soðe andetnysse & dædbote habban heofena rice.
 21. Swiðe dysig is se man & dyrstig se þe syngað gelome
beforan godes eagan eallswa we ealles to oft doð.
 22. & he þanne forscamað þæt hit anan men andette for
þam nis nan man on þisum life geboran butan synnum butan gode anunum þe
his leof ful cuð þeos halige & þeos clæne tid lænten
fæstenes.
 26. On þære þu scealt þine gymealæste & for
gægednyssa þinum gaslicum scrifte geandettan & mid fæstene &
mid wæccum & mid gebedum & mid ælmesdædum.
 28. Fram synum þe aþwean þæt þu bliðelice mid
gastlicre blisse þa easterlican mærsunge cristes æristes gebidan mote
& þæs halgan husles þigene mid gelefan underfon to forgifenysse
ealra þinra synna & to geclænnysse deoflicra costnunga.
 32. Þis feortig daga fæsten us is git to teoþing dagum
þæs geares & swa hwæt swa we on twelf monþum misdoð on worde
oþþe on weorce, on dede oþþe on ræde, on æræte oþþe on
oferdrince oþþe on oþrum leahtrum eal we hit magan & motan mid godes
lefe & mid ures scriftes on þissere halgan tide gebetan.
 38. Gif we geornlice ure fæsten begað & ure ælmessan
& gebeda ealswa crist sylf us læreð behydað eower ælmesse
witodlice.
 40. & gebit for eow & ealswa wæter adwæscð þæt
fyr swa adwæscð eac seo ælmesse þa senne.
 41. Drihten on him sylfum astealde þis fæsten & fæste
on an þurh his godcundan mihte feowertig daga & nihta fram eallum
earðlicum biglefum.
 44. Witodlice on eallum tidum gedafenað cristenum mannum þæt
hi gode weorc began & ælmes deda & swa þeah swyþost on þissere
halgan tide for þam þe we habbað micele neode þa hwile þe we her
syndon on þysan lænan life & on þysan gewitendlicum þæt we
þonne on þære toweardan wurulde magan & motan becuman to life
þæs hefoncundan rices & to þam wuldre þære ecan eadignesse
þær we motan siþþan onsorhlice libban & rixian butan ælcere
geendunge mid urum drihtne hælendum criste & mid eallum his halgum.
 52. Gif we hit gehearnian willað mid urum godum dædum nis
nanes mannes mæð þæt mahte oþþe cunne asæcgan eal þæt god
& þa yðnessa þe god hæfð gegearwod eallum þam þe hine
lufiað & his beboda healdan willað & gelestan gif we þonne
willað his willan wercan & on his lufe þurhwunian þonne geearnige we
us butan ælcan tweon heofena rice mid criste selfan & mid eallan his
halgum.
 59. Ealra ærest nu leof aþena þe eadmodlice to earðan on
godes gesihðe to gebede & bide þa eadigan sanctam marian þine leofan
hlæfdian & þa hagan apostolas & halige martiras & þa halgan
confessores & þa mærsodan fæmnen þæt hi gebiddan to drihtne
for þe þæt se ælmihtiga god gesylle þe fulne wisdom & gewitt
& soð andgit to andeteenne ealle þine synna þe þu gemunan mage oþ
þisne andweardan dæg þæt þe næfre deoful æt witan ne mage
þæt þu butan andetnysse & bote heofenan of life ne gewite ær þu
ealle þine synna gebete.
 68. & syðþan aris up glaedlice & bliðelice mid truwan
& mid soðan geleafan & cyð us þine neode & þinra sawla
þearfe & we þe willað swiðe georne mid inweordre heortan fore
gebiddan þæt god ælmihtig þe getiwige & þine bene gehyre.

END_TEXT

Conf 10.4 (Ker)
B11.10.4.
Formulas and Directions for the Use of Confessors (London, British Library, MS. Cotton Tiberius C.I): Ker 1959, 275-7.



 1. <foreign>O homo indicabo tibi quid sit bonum.</foreign> ðu man þe god secst
and me hæfst gesoht on godes willan nu wylle ic þe tæcan hwæt þe
is god to donne on godes naman se god þe wæs æfre butan ælcum
angynne, se byð æfre butan ælcum ende.
 4. Gelyf eac þæt þu scealt arisan on domes dæg mid þam
ylcan lichaman and saule þe þu onstenst and þær agyldan gescead
beforan godes þrymsetle ealra þæra þinga þe þu geworht hæfst on
wordum and on weorcum and on þinum diglum geþance and þær onfon swa
hwæðer þu nu her geearnost swa ecere blisse swa ecere susle.
 9. And æfter þyssum geleafan þu scealt lufian þinne
drihten of ealre þinre heortan and of eallum þinum mode and of eallum
þinum mægene and toforan eallum oðrum þingum forþam he is ofer ealle
oðre þincg to lufienne and to ondrædenne and eac to wyrðienne forþam
ealle þincg synd þurh hine geworhte and gelyffæste.
 15. Lufa syððan ælcne cristenne mann be þam þe þonne
to gebyrian wylle and hafa clæne geþanc on þysse haligan tide and eac on
oðrum timan to ælcum cristenum menn.
 17. And gyf ænig man wið þe agylt habbe on worde oððe on
weorce forgyf him þæt for godes lufan gyt þu wylle þæt god forgyfe
þe þa gyltas þe þu wyð hine geworht hæfst.
 20. And hafa clænnysse wordes and weorces þæs þu
geforðian mæge forþam nis gode ælmihtigum nan god weorc fullice
andfencge ne licweorðe butan clænnysse ne seo clænnys þe ma butan
oðrum godum weorcum.
 22. And fæst ælce dæg on þys halgum læncgtenfæsten
to rihtes nones and to anes mæles butan sunnandæge anum.
 25. And forga hwit æt þunresdæg nyhst eastran butan þe
untrumnys forwyrne þæt þu hit forgan ne mæge ne swa fæstan swa ic
þe nu gesæd habbe.
 28. And syle ælce dæg þine ælmessan be þam þe þe
to onhagie þeah hit ne sy ne mare þonne se feorða dæl þines hlafes
and an hærinc hit byð swa þeah gode andfencge.
 30. Ne byð him na elles þin fæsten gecweme butan þu hit
mid ælmessan frætewige.
 32. And sec georne þine cyricean ge dæges ge nihtes and bide
ærast þinga for ðe sylfne and þonne for þine magas and for þinne
hlaford and for þone cyncg and for eall cristen folc ge for libbende ge for
licgende.
 35. And scyld þe wið ofermettas and with ærætas and wið
gitsunge and wið oferdruncen and wið andan and wið galnysse and wið
weamodnysse and wið tælnysse and wið lease gewitnysse and wið
manaðas and sleacnysse godes cyricean to secenne and wið ealle unþeawas
þæs þe þu mage wealdan.
 40. And lufa eadmodnysse and cystignysse and rumheortnysse and
gemetfæstnysse ælces þinges and gesibsumnysse and mildheortnysse and
clænnysse and glædnysse mid gefoge and soðfæstnysse and
anrædnysse godra weorca and ealle gode þeawas þæs þu aredigan
mæge þe gode ælmihtigum gecweme synd and licweorðe.
 45. Leof, ic bidde þe wæpman on godes naman and eac beode
þæt þu ne cume onn nanes wifmannes gemanan þurh hæmedþincg ær
eahta niht beon geeastrod.
 48. Gyf þu þonne hit for þinre tyddernysse gehealden ne
mæge gesprec sumne preosthades man þe þu to truwan habbe butan ic þe
getreowe sy and bet hit swa he þe tæce for þam betere þe is þæt
þe sceamige her beforan anum menn þonne beforan ealre heofonware and
eorðware and helware.
 53. And do eac be oðrum gyltum þæt ylce.
 53. And leof, geþenc hu uncuð þe is seo tid þe þu þis
læne lif an forlætan scealt butan þu hwæt her for godes ege and for
his lufan to gode gedo.
 55. Forþam þe is mycel neod þæt þu þa þinc georne
bega þe ic þe nu gesæd habbe ge on þysse tide ge eac on oðre.
 57. Leof, na cweþ þu na on þinum geþance þæt ic þe
feala þinga lære þe ic sylf gehealden næbbe ne gyt na healde forþam
ic wat me sylf þæt swyðe georne.
 60. Ac þeah ic wyrs do þonne ic þe lære ne do þu na swa
swa ic do ac do swa ic þe lære gyf ic þe wel lære.
 61. Micel þearf me is þæt ic þe riht læce and tæce
and þe is mycele mare neod þæt þu hit rihtlice healde.
 63. Ne þince þe na þas word to lange ne to hefige forþam hy
þinceað swiðe sceorte and swyðe weonsume þam þe heora drihten
inlice lufiað and wyrðian wyllað.
 65. Se eca dema þe ah ealra þinga geweald, þe unc mihtelice
gesceop and mildheortlice alysde gestrangie unc to his mæran willan and
geunne unc gyf his willa sy þæt wyt of dæge to dæge motan him
þeonde beon and þære halgan eastertide gebidan and þonne þæs
gehalgodan husles mid clænan lichaman and sawle onfon and æt sumum cyrre
to heofona rices myrihðe becuman þær he mid eallum þam þe his willan
worhtan and gyt weorceað leofað and rixað a on ealra worulda woruld a
butan ælcum ende, amen.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Conf 10.5 (Laud Misc 482)
B11.10.5.
Formulas and Directions for the Use of Confessors (Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Laud Misc 482, fols. 46-7): Dictionary of Old English transcript, edited from MS.



 1. Ðonne þu þæs mannes andetnesse gehyre & he þe his
dæda bote axige & þu his lifes gescead wite bide hine þonne ærost
for godes lufon & for his ege þæt he his lif mid rihte libbe & his
drihtne mid eadmedum hyre & his cristendom & his fulluht wel gehealde
& his misdæda andette & his sawle læce georne sece & his
fæsten wel bega & his cyrcan clænlice sece & godes beboda georne
hlyste & his larþeowa.
 12. & beod him þæt he hine wið ofermetta healde for
þam þan men is swiðe mycel þearf þæt he him beorge þæt
ofermetta ne forwyrnon his sawle reste.
 16. & ærætas & oferdruncolnys & unrihthæmed
& idel gylp & unsibbe & stala & leasunga & mæneaðas
& lybblac & ealle þas uncysta forbeod him.
 20. & bide hine & lær hine & cweð him to, Ic þe
halsige & beode & hate þæt þu gode ælmihtigum hyrsumige
forþan me is neodþearf þæt ic þe riht lære & þe is
neodþearf þæt þu riht do & þæt þe næfre deofol
beswican.
 25. Ne mote þæt þu læte ænige synne ungeandet
þæra þe þu geworht hæbbe ne seo heo naðer ne to þon mycel ne
eft to þon lytel ne þe næfre ne þince to hefig ne to þam uneaðelic
ne to þam fullic to secganne þæt þu his læte æfre ænig þing
ungeandet.
 32. & geþenc þæt þu ænne nacodne lichaman on þas
woruld brohtest & þu hine scealt eft ana lætan buton þu hwæt for
Godes naman to gode gedo þa hwile þe god þe þisses lifes & þisses
forð gewitendlican geunnan wylle.
 38. & geþenc þæt þe is seo tid swiðe uncuð &
se dæg þe þu scealt þas lænan woruld forlætan & to godes
dome gelæded beon & þonne mid þinre anre sawle riht ægyldan ealra
þinga gehwylces þæs þu ær mid þinum lichaman on þinum life
gefremodest.
 45. Þonne ne bið nan riht þæs þe þu æfre gedydest
godes oððe yfeles godes ælmihtiges eagum bemiðen.

END_TEXT

Conf 11 (Holthausen)
B11.11.
Title before a Latin Form of Confession: Holthausen 1889, 172.<P>Citation is a single line following ed.</P>



 1. Þis siondon ondetnessa to gode seolfum.
